Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: Jsilverheart77
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day trip to my favorite city NEW YORK. It was a last minute trip and the weekend we went, almost every hotel was booked solid. After much thought, I decided on Eventi. We booked the room directly with the hotel online and I also became a Kimpton Hotel Member. When booking I mentioned this was a special trip with my BFF, we were in town to see Oprah and Marthat Stewart. It was also a belated birthday celebration. We took a red eye flight and arrived at the hotel at 10am Saturday morning. I knew the odds of being able to check in were slim but I tried. We were told the room was not available. We had a full day planned and needed to freshen up a bit before heading out. The front desk lady informed us the restrooms were on the 2nd floor. Their lobby is chic and welcoming. But it was inconvenient that the restrooms were on another floor. The service was lacking. Instead of offering to help us up the elevator to the 2nd floor, the bellman simply put our luggage on the floor in the middle of the lobby. Both my friend and I were a little taken back. Alas, we carried our luggage ourselves up to the 2nd floor and back down to the lobby. What should have happened - the bellman could have offered us one of the 3 luggage carts lined up against the wall or at least offered to help us up. We returned back to the hotel at 8pm after a rainy day of walking and visiting in the city. I must add that Kevin, the concierge was helpful and kind with giving us directions. I must also add that this hotel is in an odd location. The website says midtown, but really its Chelsea - in the middle of the fashion district. Macy's and Herald square was a shirt 4 block walk, and a 6 block walk to the Flatiron District. I digress - we had a corner room (deluxe king) We had no view and that was ok. The room was clean and actually a good size for NY. And the bathroom was great. The shower was large and roomy. My most favorite part - the bed!!! It was one of the most comfortable beds EVER. My friend agreed it was some of the best sleep she has ever gotten in a hotel bed. There is no room service aside from cheese plates passed 10pm. We were never around for their complimentary beverages in the lobby. But it sounded nice. I expected a little surprise, a treat, a chocolate, a bottle of wine....basically anything acknowledging it was a special trip and birthday weekend for my best friend and I. This is why I love Omni Hotels, because they go the extra step to make you feel important to them. We had very little interaction with the staff during our stay. We did like the fact that a well dressed "security guard" kept an eye on the elevators after 8pm. It made us feel safer. The two large gray bins of towels and sheets really could have found a better place to be stored instead of right outside our door. Beds are excellent! Room is clean. Very little noise factor (we were in room 1102) When we checked out, we asked them to keep our luggage because our flight only left at 3pm. Once again, no one helped with the luggage. And they actually left our bags sitting in the middle of the lobby for 5 minutes unattended. We decided we would return and keep this hotel as an option for the future. There is room for improvement in the service area.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Helen C
Reviews.Content: I was there for 6 days in March. I loved the water in the lobby which was just ice water mixed with strawberries and lemons. It was refreshing! I thought the rooms were a bit dark for my taste. Housekeeping left the room tidy each day and had chocolates on my pillow each night.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Staycation!”
Reviews.Author: Jen P
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to say enough about the hotel! The staff was outstanding. The wine hour was a class touch. The room was immaculate and quite roomy! To find a hotel that give kids attention too was so special for my children! Just can't say enough we loved it and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: mousemott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi for 2 nights while in the city for the NYC Half Marathon. I am very fond of Kimpton hotels and the Eventi absolutely met my standards. Very clean and modern. Service was friendly and attentive. We had a cityview king room, which was small but adequate. The bathrooms are huge with a rainfall shower and no tub. Our room was on 18th floor with floor to ceiling windows and a great view of the Empire State Building. Nicely appointed with very comfortable beds. Located within a very short walk to Penn Station & Madison Square Garden. Not much in the immediate vicinity but within walking distance to a lot more. I love Kimpton’s complimentary wine happy hour and the Eventi offered an acceptable choice of Chardonnay and/or Shiraz. The only problem I encountered was I was inadvertently charged for mini-bar expenses, but it was taken care of with a call to accounting. Also, if you are a member of the Kimpton InTouch Rewards program, make sure to inquire about your $15 mini-bar credit. I was not made aware of this until after I returned home and inquired about the charges on my account. For dinner, check out The Breslin (outstanding lamb burger) located in the Ace Hotel just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “'$100 a night incidentals'”
Reviews.Author: scain40
Reviews.Content: We've just had our last night in room 2201 which gives a nice city view over the east of the city. Eventi is in a 'middle of everywhere' location with a nice walk to Hell's Kitchen in the west, Chelsea and West Village to south-west and Flatiron District to the East. And R line takes you up to Bloomie's if shopping is your bent (we found a 20% off sale that meant it was better value than the closer Macy's). Getting to Upper West Side requires a change - but you can't expect to get everywhere in a big city without this. We found a Roastown outlet a little down Sixth for coffee and tea and a nice fancy food place where you could load up various meal options and pay by the pound (we had this for one breakfast, lunch or dinner on different days). The staff were unobtrusive but polite when encountered. The cleaners were attentive, thorough and cheerful. We had room service a couple of times (pot of tea) and while unusual to us as Australians, I guess it's accepted that you pay gratuity as well as a delivery fee and there's still a standing invite to tip on the receipt. Helpfully, a 20% gratuity was already included in the restaurant bill. The meals we had on our last night (as the rain poured down on the canopy, which helped create a lovely atmosphere) were what you'd expect from a hotel - nice enough but not earth-shattering. The G&T's were tall and strong. The most inconvenient aspect of our stay was the practice of freezing an additional $100 a night 'for incidentals' on our credit card beyond the full cost of our stay. Hotels in Europe (places stayed in London, Paris, Berlin, Munich, Warsaw, Athens, for example) don't withhold upfront the amount to be paid on departure, but it seems to be an increasingly common practice in Australia. We haven't stayed anywhere else in America so we don't know if this is something that happens across the industry here. However, in Melbourne, for example, while they withhold the full tote of the stay in advance, the hotels (2 we've stayed at) will only put a stop on your card of $50 to cover mini-bar/room service - and ask you to sign a confirmation. For our 8 night stay, $100 a night constituted a fair portion of our budgeted spending money that was then locked in the ether. This practice doesn't seem to be articulated on the hotel website, otherwise we would have been able to plan/budget for it or even chosen another place to stay where we could have had an extra $800 in our pocket while here. All fine to have it released for when we get home (no explanation about how long it might be to return it, and why not release it on a nightly basis if the incidentals are used? More convenient for the hotel not to) but would have been nice to have the money to access if we needed it. This was the service aspect that soured our stay and turned a Good rating to Average.

Reviews.Title: “Try a new location in New York City”
Reviews.Author: WhatsTheNextTrip
Reviews.Content: We come to NYC several times a year and stay in a different area of the city each time. This time it was at the Eventi Hotel, 6th Ave and 30St. Two year old 22-story hotel with a 30 story apartment/condo on top of it. How's that for mixed use on the same footprint? The hotel entrance is on 6th Ave and the condo entrance is on 29St. We tried two different rooms -- the double queen facing west with views to the Hudson and NJ are bigger, while the king rooms facing east and with view of the Empire State Building are smaller. Nicely appointed. Evening wine and morning tea/coffee. Great staff at the desk; in the evening, a discrete "house officer" watching over those using the elevator. The location of this is very convenient, especially if you are arriving by train at Penn Station. The hotel is 1 block from the subway and an easy walk to Time Square and the theater district. If you like costume jewely, you are in the middle of the wholesale (most open to retail trade...talk them into 50% off the marked price) jewlry trade. All are imports...some stores from China and others from India. Korea Town is at 32rd St between 6th and 5th and that's interesting to try for dinner. Others a further walk away are east and north -- New York Public Library, Pierpont Morgan Library, and south -- Madison Park and Union Park. Empire State Building just 4 blocks NE and viewable from many rooms on the east side of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort, good staff and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: al3xh4
Reviews.Content: My family (from Paris, France) stayed there for a week while visiting and they got a good deal on the rooms, which depending on the season can also be expensive. Half of the building is the hotel, the other half are apt rentals, with superb views. As usual, the higher your room is, the more expensive it will be. The location is good, although the neighborhood is not the best one, you can walk everywhere. Early coffee served in the lobby and evening wine tasting were definitely very appreciated. The bar is really nice and the staff there friendly. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel over the trendier hotels of the area, where cool dominates comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Chic - such good times”
Reviews.Author: Moosemug
Reviews.Content: The hotel certainly met with my expectations and overall I was very impressed. Lobby - fairly small but tastefully decorated. This was the venue for the wine hour apart from one beautiful March evening where it was held on the terrace. Great lounge music played at all times. Staff - we found all the staff to be friendly and this created a homely atmosphere totally unexpected in Manhattan. Room - we travelled with our two teenagers so it was a little cramped but not a problem. Nice minimalist decor and a smart bathroom. Dining - we didn't try it. Rather than spend $15 per head on a basic breakfast we would use the nearest Whole Foods for morning pastries ( a few blocks south on 7th). Location - this was great and a short 5 minute walk to Macy's. The area didn't feel too touristy mainly due to the number of fashion wholesalers in the neighbourhood. However, it felt safe (unlike the area west of Times Square near the Port Authority bus terminal which had a number of high end hotels). There aren't a great number of restaurants in the area but Korea Town (basically one street) offered a great choice if you like oriental food. Be aware of the possibility that at some stage in the future there will be a residential condo building going up oppoiste the hotel. Other tips - we bought the New York Explorer pass which was about worth it. It did have a guidebook containing a 15% discount at Macy's which we used throughout our visit. Would we return - most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Does Service like this exist in the US???”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: We were planning to stay 2 nights in NYC and after a lot of research booked this hotel. I booked online and had booked, what I had assumed, a AAA rate. My reservation also said so. This rate included free parking ($50 normally), so it seemed like a good deal. The hotel is on 6th ave and 30th st. Very well located. We arrived at 8 PM. Valet was there to take our car. On check in the the front desk lady was behaving a bit cold. Maybe it was a long day for her. I told her that we had the AAA rate where the parking was included. She said, no, that was not the case. They had a separate parking inclusive rate and the AAA rate had no parking. I tried to argue but saw that it would lead nowhere. So I requested her to change our rate to the parking rate, which also she said we could not. Had to be done before hand. Not wanting to make an issue about it at that time, we took our keys and headed for the room. We were on the 19th floor. The room, for NY standards, was pretty decent size. As was the bathroom. Beds were comfortable. Free internet as I was a kimpton loyalty member. Post check in I decided to write to the loyalty club about my issue. Next morning I get an apology response from the loyalty club. She wrote to me that she had seen the webpage and agreed that it was confusing and that I was not wrong to assume that parking would have been included in the AAA rate. So she had spoken to the hotel manager and ensured that we did not get charged for parking!!! But that was not it. Due to the trouble that I had to go through they comped me 1 night at the Eventi for use anytime in the next 6 months!!! This was amazing. Such high level or service has pretty much ceased to exist in the US or for that matter anywhere in the world. I was amazingly surprised and sent her a thank you mail. This action has made me a kimpton loyal customer. The hotel itself is very nice. They have a free wine hour in the evening and free tea/coffee in the morning. It is located in the heart of manhattan. It is a 10 buck cab ride to downtown or the central park area. And enough eating option within a 5 block radius. The bell staff is very professional and courteous. The only thing is that valet takes about 20-30 minutes. But I guess they must be parking a bit far from the hotel. The hotel also has an attached parking garage at the back. Dont know the rate for parking. The best part is that the hotel is not overpriced. Our rate was 300++. For manhattan this is not bad at all. A lot of other average hotels charge more than this. I would highly recommend a stay at this hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorite stays in NYC”
Reviews.Author: betynezz
Reviews.Content: this hotel is excelent, great staff, clean, free wifi and modern... located in a nice area (i am done with the upper east side)... highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I expected!”
Reviews.Author: psinhk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights last week. Was impressed with the room size and furnishings but when night came, we realized the air cond had a mind of its own... it went on and off several times a night and this went on every night. My friend's husband who tried to call her commented that the operator was rather rude every time he called. When we asked for an ice bucket for our champagne, it took over 3 phone calls and 1/2 hour for us to get it. Free coffee in the morning and free wine in the evening. Good location, quiet (we got a high floor) but yet close enough to walk to Times Square. Bar Basque had great food, nice ambience and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: herculepoirot
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much and it's by far the best Kimpton in NYC....by far. They go the extra mile and staff are sincere and helpful. Example: I had a minor problem at check-in, which Omar handled with finesse and patience. Mind you, the room furnishings are starting to show some wear and tear (cheap sofa and drapes) and why is it every Kimpton jacuzzi suite doesn't work? The location is actually pretty good, not so hectic and some of the views streetside are pretty amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last time - but still very good!”
Reviews.Author: Cobaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb and March for 4 nights and 2 nights respectively. Hotel staff very courteous and professional, but slow service in Bar Basque at bar and for meals. A few minor room maintenance issues - light bulbs not working, toiletries not fully replenished - that shouldn't be overlooked in a hotel of this calibre. But - still an enjoyable stay - and will continue to be my preferred hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: t_kelly10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great front desk staff. They are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms are modern, clean, well appointed and a great size for NYC. The bathrooms have very nice amenities and the bathrobes are comfy. The evening dining is nice - casual. Wine list was okay, food was tasty. Service was better on a Thursday night but we felt neglected on the Monday evening meal. Maybe they were short staffed - not sure. Good location and not too noisy. Overall, this is a great find for a NYC hotel. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, but nothing revolutionary.”
Reviews.Author: Janis001
Reviews.Content: I stayed in King room, which is quite small and dark, although it has ceiling window. View was not the best, certainly in New York you can find better, or ask for peace that will be directed to the east, not west, as mine. The bathroom is nice, but it was a problem with drainage basins, which one would not expect such a quality hotel. Evening wine at the reception is fine, but for example Hotel Giraffe offers wine and cheese in a much better quality. I was in New York for the tenth time and the hotel Eventi was disappointing. Yes, it has a great image, the staff is friendly, the place is good. But do not feel extra comfortable, I recommend just a short sleep for a longer stay in NY (2 or more nights), choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend at the Eventi”
Reviews.Author: raydle
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Eventi this past weekend. It's a beautiful hotel. We were there for a girls weekend of dining and shopping and the location was perfect for getting everywhere we needed to go. We shared a room with 2 queen beds and it was a nice size for a NY hotel room. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful. The rainfall showerhead was fantastic. We did grab a glass of wine at the hotel's happy hour. I also explored the fitness center, and though I didn't have time to use it, it looked great, all the equipment was all new. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Would like to give it 4 stars.. But”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirl2020
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby makes a great first impression as does the super friendly front desk service who upgraded me to a suite at no extra charge. The room was phenomenal, spacious and the city view was great. The etro toiletries and cloudlike king bed are amazing. I really enjoyed my stay here, until I woke up at 3am to dying smoke detector batteries in my room. Maintenance aka "engineering" came and fixed them right away, but it was not fun to wake up to a high pitched beeping noise in the middle of the night. I was also excited to use my kimpton rewards $15 minibar credit. I took a 2 small snacks that were clearly under the $15 credit. However, I was billed for two charges of $16 and $17 on two separate days after my stay. These charges were refunded within 48 hours after contacting kimpton. I wish I could rate this hotel higher, but I can't.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travel. Clean, modern and spacious (for NY). Best I've found so far.”
Reviews.Author: SusanM202
Reviews.Content: I am from the Midwest so when I started traveling to NY on business it was shocking to me.....the prices and room sizes were quite a change from what I was used to in Omaha or Chicago where you can get a huge room at a nice hotel for about $200.00 per night. I was suddenly paying several hundred per night for a room about the size of that which a small child might occupy. Some hotels..have to move out of the way to shut the bathroom door. This one isn't like that. Rooms are a little small but as good as it gets in NY. Bathrooms are however full size and luxurious. Windows are clean and not crusted with dirt. You can actually pull the curtains open and look out! This is the only hotel that doesn't hide its windows, at least that I have found. Bar is odd....very modern and quite pretentious, guests and staff alike. Oh well, I'll still stay there because this hotel is a step above others I have visited in NY. Price.....I have given up. Will trade the lofty price to feel comfortable in this harsh and dirty city.

Reviews.Title: “Very customer focused!”
Reviews.Author: GG1429
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a long weekend in NYC at the Eventi. Great customer service, quaint clean room, nice bathroom, and the evening reception on the patio proved to be a great touch!

Reviews.Title: “Usual Kimpton service (ie very good)”
Reviews.Author: chrisb1976
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel, and found it to be up to the usual Kimpton standards for service and comfort. As noted the location is good, however it is sort of neither here nor there (ie not really where you want to be in midtown, but not really in the villages either). Very convenient for Penn Station (5 minute walk with bags) and any subway line to get anywhere else in the city. Not much choice of restaurants nearby, but within 2 miles, there are 1000 restos, so you should be fine. And after a big meal with some wine, a 15 minute walk back is good. The service and welcome were great. We had a problem with a knocking in the pipes in the wall of our room, so they shifted us around to a new one that was a little larger. The room had a comfortable bed, gorgeous shower and nice bathroom - all you need really. Join InTouch to get free internet. The wine hour got a little repetitive, especially after staying at the Vintage Park in Seattle last year where every night it was a different wine. That being said, free wine before heading out on the town is always nice. There is no coffee maker/kettle in the room, but free coffee and tea in the mornings downstairs - coffee is quite good, however, I wish they would give you ceramic mugs rather than just paper cups. Seems an odd place to skimp on a pretty luxe hotel. Final note - it was too cold for us, but make sure you check out the veranda on the 5th floor - beautiful looking spot to sit and relax in the sun for a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of civilization in the concrete jungle”
Reviews.Author: WinsorTraveler
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you I travel on business a lot, and when I can, I stay at a Kimpton hotel. Why? Lots of reasons. Chic decorating. Friendly staff. Good restaurants. Great frequent flyer program, all at prices better than the cardboard cutout competition. Kimpton has made a habit of acquiring properties in "developing" neighborhoods and renovating them. The gyms are fresh, the decor is very hip and their loyalty program offers things like a "raid the mini-bar" coupon so when you get in late and you just feel like a bag of chips and a beer you can have one without explaining it to the expense report police. The Eventi stands out with it's incredibly friendly staff. I am always greeted warmly, welcomed back and my car, bag, reservation, or whatever handled with ease! Very professional staff willing to do whatever it takes to satisfy their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Chatmandu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at the Eventi back in December 2011 to do some shopping and generally soak up the New York Christmas atmosphere on our was back to the UK from trip in Central America. As many people have pointed out the location is fantastic. We've been to NYC several times but have never stayed south of about 46th street before but this location was by far the best one we've had. Easy walking distance to shopping on 5th & 6th avenues, big touristy sites Times Square, Rockefeller etc but also the bars and restaurants in the East/West Villages. The hotel itself is beautiful and on arrival we were greeted by a very friendly member of staff upgraded to from King Room to a Cityview King Room. I know next time I'll pay the difference, the floor to ceiling windows gave a amazing view across the south of the city including the Empire State building (sorry the picture quality of the room views aren't the best.) I'm sure the King Room would have been great but the free upgrade was much appreciated. The room wasn't huge (to be expected in NYC) but was very nice. The bed was very comfortable and the shower in the bathroom was ace. As always with Kimpton the wine hour was great little bonus and the wines we were served were delicious. This was our 5 stay and a Kimpton hotel but was the best yet, highly recommended. One thing the hotel is very close to Penn Station (5 minute walk) and I'd recommend getting the train into the city via Newark airport. I have previously got a taxi and paid $70+ for a very long and tedious drive into the city. The train took less the half the time of the taxi and was $50 cheaper for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: tbtrips
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for our weekend visit to NYC. Close to transportation and within walking distance of decent shopping. The hotel was very modern. Everything was nice which is expected in Kimpton Hotels. The room was small, but decent size for NYC. Although small, the space utilization was excellent. The bed was comfortable and everything was clean. We had dinner at the restaurant in the hotel. Dinner was very tasty, but on the pricey side. The staff was courteous and helpful. This definitely goes on my list!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern comfortable hotel and priced better than most”
Reviews.Author: Tanya0810
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for just about every reason. Location is ideal for shopping around 34 street of if working with the clothing market. The decor inside the room was tres chic contemporary without giving up on comfort. The seconf floor has a great lounge area for drinks, coffee or just to catch up on work. You can find a great self serve/ fast restaurant next door for healthy breakfast and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rinsesd
Reviews.Content: Great location and very central to everything. I lOVE Kimpton hotels and this one didn't disappoint. They offer everything you can imagine complimentary. I love the happy wine hour at 5 too. I didn't eat at the restaurant but we had a few drinks and nibbles at the bar which were good. It's not a hotel I'd recommend if you enjoy lounging around the property. Besides the bar and restaurant, there's not much to see or enjoy. I would recommend it and would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service in a Luxurious Setting”
Reviews.Author: elguapo2011
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Eventi for an overnight business trip to NYC. The hotel was recommended by the group hosting the meetings I was attending. We received a substantial discount off of the rack rates, which in retrospect was a little surprising. I arrived very early on a Wednesday, getting to the hotel at 11:00 AM. I did not expect to get a room that early in the day, but to the credit of the person I spoke to at the front desk they made an attempt to find me one. The hotel had been fully booked the night before and was fully booked the night I stayed. While they couldn't completely check me in that early they got me 90% of the way there and were able to provide me with a room when I came back from lunch at 1:00 PM. I was quite pleased. The lobby is smallish but very comfortable. I was able to return some e-mails and make some calls while I waited on my room to become available. The slightly-too-hip electronica-heavy Muzak was a little loud, but bearable. The room I stayed in was on the 6th floor with a view facing away from 6th Ave. It was nice and quiet, with a window that partially opened. The room was smallish, but very well appointed and attractive. The bed was very comfortable. The flat-screen TV actually showed HD programming (what a concept!), literally a first for me. While the screens are ubiquitous, it seems like it is not a priority among the hotel chains to deliver HD content. The bathroom was nothing short of spectacular with a walk-in shower and beautiful marble tiling. It was impressive (although better water pressure would have been nice.) The closet was very shallow and appeared to be a little bit of an after-thought. The desk was also very small and would not have been conducive to doing a lot of work there. There was a small easy chair in one corner, but as the room was small it did not seem to fit in the overall scheme of things very well. The location cannot be beat. It's just a couple of blocks away from Times Square and as convenient to everything in Midtown Manhattan as any hotel that I've been to in the area. There are plenty of places to ear nearby, including a couple of surprisingly nexpensive options, including a small food court that is next door. This is probably not a great hotel for an extended business stay, but is perfect for tourists wanting a nice place to stay or for a short-stay business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but stay in a suite for the best experience.”
Reviews.Author: JoshC87
Reviews.Content: I loved the suite here, it was very well appointed, the view was a New York City dream, and the bathroom is memorable, all in all, Eventi is the epitome of casual luxury. The only thing is the regular rooms are a bit dull if you don't have a city view or a high floor because the color palette is grey in the rooms. With that said, the suite was gorgeous and I would imagine a city view even in a smaller room would be amazing, our initial low floor, back facing room was not that exciting, I remember a purple painting of a girl with her head between her legs looking sad was in the initial room, bizarre, but the humor wasn't lost on me. I'd absolutely stay again, but prefer Ink48,Kimpton's other new property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Escapists2
Reviews.Content: We are fans of the Kimpton brand and the Eventi lives up to its peers with stylish decor, huge windows overlooking the city, great loyalty program service, and daily wine happy hour. The location is just two blocks from NY Pennsylvania Station making it convenient for Amtrak arrivals. It's also a do-able walk south to the Village, east to the Empire State Building, and north to Times Square. The neighborhood feels safe and there are a number of good restaurants close by. Where it fell short was the design of the lobby (small with NO restrooms!) and the bar (faces a wall which features a video loop of some very funky images.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JEO56
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Eventi for President's Weekend. The location was great as we have a daughter who lives in the West end. We were able to get on street parking which was a big bonus without having to use the garage. Staff was very friendly. Room was on 16th floor with wonderful view of the Empire State building. Room was very clean, small, but extremely comfortable bed and pillows. Bathroom was very well equipped with nice shower, two nozzles, and nice amenities.Complimentary wine reception could have been attended each night we were there, but could only get to it once. This and coffee in the morning are nice additions. Good location and quiet at night. Security is good in evening as we had to show our room key to get on the elevator! Also Pet friendly, as we saw pets, but never heard them!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Chic, Hip and Pet Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrottingagain
Reviews.Content: I so enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was quite small, but felt luxurious and plush. We were up on the 23rd floor, so had the most spectacular view of New York from our room. Being high up, also meant we didn't hear the traffic at all. I loved the position of the hotel as it is within walking distance of Times Square and there are loads of deli's and diners nearby for breakfast. The staff were really friendly and helpful and really efficient. The entire property was immaculately clean, and very tastefully decorated. We enjoyed the complimentary wine (5-6pm) in the lobby, where we got to meet other guests (and their canine companions) We had room service one evening (as it was too cold to go out), the food was absolutely delicious - I don't usually eat burgers & fries, but needed some comfort food after a long day sight seeing in the freezing cold. I can honestly say this was one of the best meals I ate in New York - IN MY BED!

Reviews.Title: “President's Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: rtmcclure14
Reviews.Content: Wonderful weekend in NYC, and Eventi is an excellent boutique hotel. Great location close enouigh to Time Square to walk, but far enough for some peace. Modern and clean rooms, very attentive staff. Best of all, AAA price was a great deal compared to other area hotels, not rated nearly mas high on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view”
Reviews.Author: Sim0nSays
Reviews.Content: We visit NYC a couple of times per year and like to try hotels in varied parts of the city. We were very pleased with our recent 2 night stay at the Eventi. We reserved 2 rooms: one for myself and my husband, and one for my grown son and a friend. The front desk staff was delightful, and we were upgraded to rooms on the 22nd floor (there are 23 floors). Each room was smallish (typical of NYC hotels), but the floor to ceiling windows framed a spectacular view of the city (with the Empire State Building just to the northeast), which opened up the space beautifully. The beds are remarkably comfy! Our bathrooms were generously proportioned, and I loved the large walk in shower with the rain shower heads in the ceiling. We found a nice selection of salad/soup/sandwich restaurants in the area when we needed a quick bite, and Starbucks was just up the street (always a plus). A quick taxi ride or a 15 block walk gets you into the theatre district. We go to the theatre but avoid staying in the Times Square area, so this location was perfect for us. I recommend the Eventi without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huggles77
Reviews.Content: Recently (Feb 2012) spent a night at a beautiful boutique hotel in the Chelsea neighborhood of NY City. Nice corner room on 23rd floor with incredible views of the city. Plush bedding. Modern, contemporary bathroom. We did have some annoying noise in the walls...that took away from giving it a 5 excellent rating. Expensive rates on their website ...got it for $100 less on Yahoo travel. Valet parking without in and outs expensive...try a nearby garage and look for an online coupon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: RRM1020
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights for a family NYC getaway. I am a big fan of Kimpton and this property did not disappoint. Friendly staff and an upgrade was a nice touch. Even my son was happy when he was asked if he wanted a goldfish friend for the stay. We had a unique shaped room with a long hallway upon entering room opening up to a tv room. Then our room was a nice size with rather large bathroom. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: tulanecpt1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for her birthday weekend. We registered for the upgrade options Kimpton send in an email a few days before arrival. When we arrived, we were upgraded to one of the high floor Jacuzzi tub suites. What a great room. Plenty of space to sprawl out in the living room and the bedroom. The bathroom was rather grand with both a tub and walk-in shower. The bathroom amenities were some of the best I have found at this price point of a hotel. The bed was comfortable and sheets were soft. The two best attributes of a hotel bed. Room furnishings were trendy but comfortable. Some places seem to get caught up in the trendiness of the room and forget it should be comfortable. The Eventi figured out how to marry the two. The staff delivered a very nice amenity plate for another guest's anniversary. We assumed they just mixed up the trays and come couple down the hall got my wife's birthday cupcake. That was the only service 'glitch' we encountered the entire stay. The hotel is in a perfect starting location for ventures to any part of the city. The only problem is there are limited restaurants in the immediate area unless you're dying for Korean or fast food. My only request to have made this the perfect weekend getaway hotel would have been better wine at the reception. I learned in college that free beer is the best beer. That doesn't hold true with wine. Overall, great rooms, nice staff, and top notch location. A special thanks to the doorman that hunted down a livery during rush hour so we didn't miss our Le Bernardin reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Chelsea near Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: RitzQueen
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel right near the Empire State Building. For NYC standards, the room was spacious. The bed was very comfortable with nice bedside lights for reading. I would have given it 5 stars but the first room I stayed in (1918) while it had an amazing view with a nice corner window and a king size bed, there was a mold problem coming from one of the bathroom drains. I moved rooms to accommodate a friend meeting me and I needed 2 queen beds and the second room was fine. Also, I ordered room service and the salad was ordinary. On my second night I ate at Eataly, which is easy walking distance, and had a spectacular meal. I will definitely come back to this hotel in the future. It was a 20 minute walk to Times Square and a good choice for someone coming into the city for theatre and shopping. Macy's is close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: TwoMillionMiles86
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Eventi while going to Westminster dog show. The hotel staff were all wonderful -- excellent recommendations on where to dine. Whereas last year we had some difficulty with the on site restaurant, this time the hostess and waiters were helpful and accomodating and the food was top notch. Our room was fantastic and of course the hotel's location is perfect -- easy walk to event, to theatre, shopping etc. We're already looking forward to staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Eventi has gusto”
Reviews.Author: MDTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff with good bar/restaurant recommendations, nice rooms at reasonable price, cold breakfast buffet was a good value for excellent quality--you get to watch the hotel's giant outside LED movie screen show artistic geographical images (moon, Africa, volcanos) while you eat. Overall, very nice stay. Minor quibbles--minimal modulation between hot/cold in showers, free NYT was early edition. A helpful hint is to sign up for free Kimpton members "In Touch" program and you get free internet (perhaps this is why we got the top floor too). The hotel is only a 3 block walk to Penn Station and has good cab service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in the City”
Reviews.Author: JCRinVA
Reviews.Content: Usually stay in mid-town, but glad we switched to this location near Chelsea. Definitely a step up from all the Hilton Garden Inn, etc. in Chelsea. Stylish, but not too pretentious boutique hotel (except for the arm block some private security guy gave my wife trying to enter the elevator, i guess some VIP from fashion week needed their own elevator). Plus: -Fairly new (2 yr), so rooms are clean, smartly furnished w modern amenities and nice wall of windows to view the city -Friendly Staff (especially to small children) -Nice bar downstairs & good burger place next door in Food Parc -Free wine happy hour n welcome cupcakes for kids were nice touches -Stayed in the 1 bedroom suite which although smallish was well designed to use avlble space so didnt feel cramped -Great rainforest shower -Great location near KTown, MSG and NE Edge of Chelsea -What I really liked is not getting nickeled n dimed on WiFi and actually having a decent speed. Negatives: -Just some small stuff like not filling up my TP, n free coffee ending before 9AM & having to pay $50/night to valet (which seems the going rate in NYC)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: bstar3714
Reviews.Content: Clean,no carpets,bug free environment . Free credit towards minibar great way to get water without being a "platinum" . Good location. Complimentary coffee in am and wine after wk all in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean (dog friendly) hotel near Penn Station”
Reviews.Author: MDG02186
Reviews.Content: This is a nice new and clean hotel near Penn Station, which is unusual. Generally, not a great neighborhood so it's hard to find decent hotels in the area. They have a nice wine receiption in the eveining, coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby in the morning. The rooms are nice size, well equipped, and it seems as though they will get you whatever you might have forgotten. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom/shower was fantastic. Nice fitness center - more equipment than you would expect. Staff is very friendly. There were a few dogs staying there which is really nice to see. Cons: They wouldn't deliver my bags to my room unless I was there, which was inconvenient. At the bar, there didn't seem to be any wait staff - we had to go order drinks and bring them back to the table. Depending on where your room is, you might be facing out onto a giant TV screen on an adjacent building that plays bizarre cartoons 24 hours a day. The drapes block the light, but the south facing side has this view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: KDD77
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, modern, sleek, hip, good location, great for our girls weekend (young 50ish girls). Wonderful bed, nice bathroom, floor to ceiling windows. Only thing that they might address is better lighting in the rooms. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do not leave money or valubles with security!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oneilwright248
Reviews.Content: The Eventi Hotel sells itself as a boutique hotel. Unfortunately I had money taken from my purse whilst it was left with security for safe keeping and the hotel did not telephone the police. Instead their hotel security decided to deal with the matter. Which yes you've guest it meant that I am still not had my money returned. The hotel managers delete complaint e mails and you are unable to obtain information about the complaint or insurance procedures. For the money try another hotel. This is not value for money even with the drinks reception in the evening. The restaurant promoted in the information is overpriced ( ten dollars for a bottle of water) and mediocre we went their for Thanks giving and were disappointed. The Kimpton chain of hotels blurb speak about the customer experience but unfortunately my dealings with the company have fell below the standard that I would expect from a large hotel chain and therefore I am unable to recommend this hotel as value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Mayo Gal
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three nights at the Eventi, and we really enjoyed the hotel. Loved the decor - modern and comfortable. It is perfect for those traveling by rail, and Penn Station is an easy walk. It is also very close to many subway lines, and within easy walking distance of many points of interest. We will return.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Brecon Beacons National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Lovely New Year in New York”
Reviews.Author: Amanda042003
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room, a good size for a city room. It was modern and had plenty of amenities. The bed was so comfortable we didn't want to get up! The bathroom was a good size and the shower was fab. The hotel was in a great position and I can highly recommend Bar Seven just around the corner. The wine every evening was a great way to finish a hectic sight seeing day and the white wine was delicious. I would definitely stay here again when visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC Choice”
Reviews.Author: Boomer_from_Boulder
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a City view king on the 20th floor which had superb views. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. The front desk staff was flawless. The location is really quite good as well. This will be our new favorite hotel for Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: Melissa L
Reviews.Content: Great location - near Penn Station, but not on top of it. The rooms are a decent size, and the price is really reasonable for NYC. Nice linens and a nice bathroom with a huge shower. Great service and nice bar area. My friend and I were upgraded to a room with a view of the Empire States Building upon check-in, free of charge. I plan to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite NYC Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: Wachs
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at three of the four Kimptons in Manhattan and we won't need to stay at the other because this is our favorite. Clean, comfortable, modern rooms; welcoming and helpful staff as one might expect from Kimpton; and a perfect location. This is Manhattan so rooms are small and can be expensive, but we found the Eventi to be a great value, too. We had an Executive One Bedroom Suite which gave us a little extra room to stretch out and relax without feeling like we had to spend all our time on the bed. If you can afford the extra expense, I would recommend doing the same. The location couldn't make it any easier as a base for exploring the city. Just one cross-town block and two street blocks from Penn Station makes taking the train a breeze. A similar distance to the 28th Street Stations at Broadway or 7th Ave give you access to the 1, 2, N or R subway lines in five minutes. The attached restaurant, Bar Basque, is also very modern and probably more of a bar than restaurant. A great patio area with a view of the GIANT TV screen on the wall of an adjacent building made for a great way to watch the NFL playoffs. Overall, it is easy for us to recommend this fine hotel and we plan to stay there on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BIKESANDHIKESLA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Conveniently located. The suites are great. get on a high floor. Views are amazing. Beds are super comfy, and sheets are top notch. The bathrooms are the best part. huge soaking tub, perfect fix for after a long day running around. I didn't eat here, nor would i ever. Too many other options. Love the free tea in the lobby in the morning and the wine in the afternoon. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a family”
Reviews.Author: prissyhorse
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Great location for all we wanted to do and see in Manhattan. Superb rooms, comfy beds, huge bathrooms, and outstanding service. The hotel was bustling and busy the entire stay but the service and staff were all terrific. Loved the bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas/Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: mdcoach
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter stayed for 4 nights in December. It was their annual trip for Xmas and my wife's birthday. My wife has insisted I posted a review. Believe me, she has an eye for detail that I would never see. She can be critical of things that would not bother me. She was delighted with this hotel - including the service and the staff. Believe me this is a recommendation indeed. Well done Eventi.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time experience in New York !”
Reviews.Author: paulpeople
Reviews.Content: We just got back after spending 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. It was my daughters` first trip to New York, and I was hoping to make it a special one, and from the moment we arrived, everyone we came across ensured that this would be the case. I would like to particularly commend Jocelyn at the front desk, who greeted us on arrival, and bid us farewell on our departure. She was extremely friendly, courteous and professional and went out of her way to see that we were always comfortable and content.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but don't ask for tonic water”
Reviews.Author: WillDaBeest
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we have friends who live in the neighbourhood and we wanted to be close to their apartment when we visited over New Year. It has a slightly dated 80s feel but is a stylish and welcoming hotel, well-placed for exploring Chelsea and midtown. Madison Square Garden is around the corner and Times Square was only a 15-minute walk. We upgraded to the Live suite, 2 large, interconnecting rooms on the top floor looking out at the Empire State Building. Mesmerising view. The pool table in the room was popular with our young son, as was the enormous TV. We were happy with the accommodation although slightly disappointed that neither of our two bathrooms contained a bath, just 2 huge showers. We did, however, have a baffling and annoying experience on New Year's Eve which although rather trivial somewhat took the shine off our stay. Our suite contained two substantial mini-bars stocked with all kinds of booze and snacks - not just beers and miniatures of spirits, but some half-bottles of vodka too. We decided to have vodka and tonics with our friends before we went out to celebrate New Year's Eve. Oddly, there was no tonic, or any other mixer, in the mini-bar. We decided to have beers instead, but there was no bottle opener in the room either. I called the front desk to ask them to bring a bottle opener up and some mixers for the mini-bar, but was told "sorry, we don't do mixers." I asked why not, and whether we were expected to drink the spirits in the mini-bar straight. They apologised and said it was hotel policy not to have mixers in the mini-bar, we would have to order drinks from the bar. I tried to get some vodka and tonics through room service but was again told: We don't serve mixers. I wondered if I was missing something - surely tonic water isn't an unreasonable request in a 4-star hotel. Eventually they somewhat reluctantly agreed to see what they could do and said they would send somebody up. Eventually a guy came to the room with a bottle opener and a tray randomly containing a glass of cranberry juice, covered with cling film, a small bottle of tonic and a bottle of soda water. He was polite but seemed bewildered as to why we would want any of this stuff. We asked if we were the first people ever to ask for mixers in this hotel and he said we were. The mini-bar only had so much space, he said, and we could't expect it to include everything. We had to sign for our tray of mixed mixers, and it was added to our bill. Apart from this odd episode, most of the staff were helpful, especially the guys at the door, and we had a good stay. Room service breakfast was pretty good. There's a 5 Guys burger joint around the corner which I highly recommend, and you can stroll to the beautiful HighLine walkway in 10 minutes or so - a must. We also visited the bar at the nearby Ace Hotel one night - we had considered staying there so were curious to see how it measured up. It's a hip, young and lively place with a drinks list that includes beer cocktails. They were also well-stocked with tonic water. We may stay there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much loved everything about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tbanker
Reviews.Content: Incredibly friendly, competent staff. The view from our room was stupendous with a beautiful sunrise. The bathroom was beautiful. Bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: livin4luvinlife
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply one of the best hotels I've stayed at anywhere let alone NY. The rooms are Sophisticated, Contemporary, Comfortable, Wonderful Beds. Staff and Service was impeccable everyone was helpful and polite. the Bar was fun and trendy. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NY that I have visited”
Reviews.Author: Ville V
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in three hotels in New York: Hilton Times Square, Park Central Hotel and Eventi. In my view, Eventi was the best of these three, though I only stayed for one night. I stayed in the cityview room. The room had a view on the Empire State Building and the Freedom Tower. Room was spacious, especially the bathroom. We had also a free wifi in our room, which was a nice surprise since often times you have to pay for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but bad House music.”
Reviews.Author: hikermikeCO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and I greatly enjoyed the location. The staff was great, the room was very nice and spacious. I can reiterate a lot of things already said about the hotel but want t primarily mention the House Music. As others have previously said, over the weekend the hotel is a party. Upon returning to your room, security makes sure you are a guest, already a bad sign. Now, I don't go to bed too early, especially during my visit over NYE, but the house music blaring past 1am and beyond is unacceptable for a hotel. I was on the 9th floor thinking I had a quiet room, but the music could have been next door. On the 1st night I had to call down for earplugs, it must be a rare request and became a hassle. The next night it just made me mad. A hotel should be about overnight guests first, not whoever their bar and club host. I will definitely not be returning even though I like Kimpton hotels. The music was just so frustrating, I actually enjoy the traffic noise. You never see a white noise machine with House Music...

Reviews.Title: “Almost top-notch”
Reviews.Author: AEK18
Reviews.Content: The location near Penn Station is excellent for those arriving by Amtrak or other trains. Following advice given here on TripAdvisor, I requested a high floor on the quiet side of the hotel, away from 6th Ave, and the room I was given matched my request. With the windows closed it was very quiet. The room was very nice, and the staff helped me out when I needed a small amount of bleach. One day during my stay I had some difficulty getting the room serviced after a late morning. I had to call twice, at 3 pm and 9 pm, and soon after 9 pm the room was quickly put in order. Also, when preparing to check out I discovered that I was charged for minibar items I never consumed. The front desk did remove the charges. Overall, the staff were very helpful and I hope the hiccups were an anomaly, as I will need to come to NYC again to tend to an aging parent and would like to stay at the Eventi without any glitches.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny - Would Recommend to Anyone, and I'm Picky.”
Reviews.Author: ILOVEAOGG
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Great service. Updated, modern decor (although a bit dark for my tastes). Comfortable bed. Great products/toiletries from Etro. Shower was ah-mazing. New, flatscreen tv with many channels. Spectacular views. My friend and I got massages and the masseuse was fantastic. Breakfast was good (go for the menu- not the continental, it's actually cheaper) and there was an ATM onsite. (Nice to not have to schlep in the cold.) We got room service - also excellent. There was a hairdryer, bathrobes, a safe, and a locking cupboard with a key you could take with you. Perfect location - near many subway stops and the doormen will get you a cab. Also, a free wine happy hour. We didn't partake, but we saw many people enjoying it! Minuses: I'm being very picky here. I wish there was an extra hook in the bathroom. We are girls. We use a lot of towels and we had bathrobes too. There was only one hook. Stuff was kind of strewn everywhere by the end, and we wanted to be green and not leave it on the floor for re-washing. We had towels on the towel racks and over the shower. (There's only a shower- no tub.) In addition, the room was on the smallish side, but perfectly adequate for NYC. Having traveled all over the world, I wasn't disappointed about the room size. Finally, we were there for our birthday weekend. I emailed ahead of time explaining this fact and said that my best friend's birthday was the Saturday we were there. A card or happy birthday message - at the very least- would have been nice. A bit disappointed they did nothing. Still, my parents are going to NY in two months and I have referred them to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, extras a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LondonCleverTrevor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable, the room reasonably sized and high enough to be pretty peaceful. I reckon that all those small extras - laundry, breakfast, in-room dining - are ratcheted up too much. A sandwich and fries and a beer one night when the jetlag got to me ended up costing something like fifty dollars, which isn't necessary. Still, we'd probably stay here again - it was in an interesting corner of town, too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn M
Reviews.Content: We were visiting New York for the 3rd time and decided to try out a Kimpton hotel. We booked directly with Kimpton who matched the best price I had found on a 3rd party site and upgraded our room free of charge. I also joined the Kimpton 'In Touch' scheme which meant free wifi in our room and a voucher for the mini bar. Our room was great and had a view of the Empire State building. Bathroom and amenities were good, comfortable bed and well stocked mini bar with an interesting array of goodies! Good location - 10 minutes from Macy's and easy to flag a taxi from outside. We ordered breakfast to our room twice and although pricey ($70 for two) was worth it. Check-in was the only complaint I have, as it took longer than I could see necessary - arriving at Midnight after a long journey I just wanted to get into my room! Other than that our stay at this hotel was great and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The right one”
Reviews.Author: EK88
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 2 adults 4 teen boys at the Eventi from 3rd January for 5 nights. I had extensively researched NY hotels for literally hours at a time...so this had to be the right one! I had requested that we were all on the same floor and as high as possible (having read other guests' reports) and was delighted when we were quickly and efficiently booked into the 22nd floor. My husband and I had chosen to take up an internet offer of an upgrade to an Executive Suite which had a breathtaking view of the ESB - one of my abiding memories of our great trip will be seeing dawn and dusk over the city. The beds were amazingly comfortable and we all slept very well - my husband heard a little noise (cars, people in the street shouting) on Saturday night which I suppose was activity in the club at street level but I slept like a baby. The rooms were v clean and were well maintained during our stay. My only quibble would be that they were rather dark and initially we were endlessly flicking switches to illuminate shady corners - but in time we found the penumbra rather restful. I can't fault the staff - wonderful "can do" approach to all our requests. Prompt room service (b'fast only). I would like to mention in particular Thomas on the door who welcomed us as we arrived and immediately did all he could to help my two eldest boys find cheap tickets for the NY Nix game at Madison Sq Gdns. He and his colleague went out of their way to help out. Omar was efficient, patient (we changed our minds once or twice!) and very helpful in booking and recommending a restaurant for our last night - the San Rocco. We loved all the usual sights - The Frick, Met, Ellis Island Tour, the High Line - but highly recommend the Lower East Side Tenement Museum and interactive tour it organises. All in all I feel very relieved we made the right choice after all those hours trawling tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in nyc for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: stasia3844
Reviews.Content: my stay on january 5-6 was my third time at this hotel, and i like it more every time i stay there. our first visit was new year's eve last year, just after the hotel had opened, and they were still working out some kinks. this most recent stay couldn't have been better. the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, room service was prompt and tasty, and the property was clean and fun to be in. the location is so convenient - close to penn station and madison square garden. there aren't as many desirable places to eat nearby as I would like during a stay in nyc, but you are close to many key subway lines, and it is very easy to get a taxi. i will definitely continue to stay here on my business trips to nyc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 3va
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi Hotel from January 6-9 and had a wonderful time. We got to the hotel at 11am and was fully prepare to just leave our luggage there but they were able to check us in no questions asked. Our room was on the 16th floor with an amazing city view (and the Empire State Building). The bathroom was really spacious with a nice rain shower. The bed was super comfortable like others have mentioned. Service was excellent- twice we asked housekeeping to bring something up for us and both times they were fast and super friendly. Wine hour was a plus too. They made sure that your wine glass nothing goes empty. Location- It was really close to Penn Station and a couple of subway lines. I mean you're not paying for prime real estate in NYC - it's not trendy or lined with restaurants but it's definitely convenient. Overall, great hotel and I would hesitate to recommend it. The hotel contributed to my amazing trip in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal accommodations, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: danmiller3
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Kimpton property. Traditionally I am a Starwood or Marriott guy. I was so impressed. The staff were all extremely nice, helpful and genuinely friendly. The room was extremely large for NYC. Clean, modern and well appointed. Great view of the city. Only downside to room was hallway noise, but I haven't found a hotel yet that has found a solution to banging room doors. Beds were very comfortable and with plenty of pillows. Water pressure for the shower was great and bathroom amenities are also very good. The most pleasant surprise for me was the free wi-fi that actually worked and was of decent speed. If you are a member of their rewards program you get wi-fi for free as well as a minibar credit. Nice touch. Will definitely be a Kimpton loyalist going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Price, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: svact
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi Hotel for my first ever trip to NY City. At 51 I was tenuous about going to NY with all the noise and the people. The hotel was great! Clean comfortable room, great view, nice beds. You really could not hear any street noise and the staff could not have been friendlier. They have a great bar/restaurant on the second floor. The location was in the center of the Theater district, NBC the Rock, and in the other direction SoHo and Chinatown. They had complimentary wine tasting from 5-6 am and coffee/tea in the morning. The bathroom was huge and had a rain forest type shower head. My only complaint is that there was no ice machine so you had to order ice from the front office and felt compelled to tip the person who brought it. We will always go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: janetgeraci
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at your hotel this past weekend January 7, 2012. Unfortunately, we had one issue. My guest and myself each had a car and used your valet services. I contacted valet and asked if one of the fees could be omitted as it would have been over $100.00. I was told one of the vehicle valet fees would be "comped", however, when I checked with my guest, we were both charged. Just a little confused why I was told that it would be taken care of when it was not. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit card statement when you get home!”
Reviews.Author: Severine66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi in June and December 2011 and overall enjoyed it (which is why I went back the second time). The rooms are quite nice, especially the bathrooms, they have lovely views (for an additional cost), and for the most part the staff are very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, both times after I got home I discovered extra charges added to my credit card for additional nights of valet parking and also numerous items from the mini bar, none of which we had consumed. Both times I called the hotel the charges were reversed immediately; however, since I don't live in the US I ended up out of pocket due to fluctuating exchange rates both times. After I explained this the last time I called, the staff member I spoke to was very apologetic and said he would have someone from management contact me to discuss this, but sadly I never heard from anyone. Sorry Eventi (and Kimpton), but there are lots of fantastic hotels in NYC and I will be staying at one of them on my next visit,

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, decent service at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: caspervr
Reviews.Content: I seemed to run into quite a few issues on my business trip to NYC, two of them relating to the hotel. However, Kimpton hotels are known for their friendly service, and this hotel is no exception. I just wish that I wouldn't have had the problems in the first place! First, my co-worker and I arrived at the hotel and they had lost her reservation. She had a confirmation number and everything, but there was nothing they could do because the hotel was at 100% occupancy that night. She ended up staying on the pull-out sofa in my room, and the hotel generously waived the charge for that night. Second, my office shipped several boxes for an event that we were holding on the hotel's terrace, and one of our boxes was lost. It was a huge ordeal to prove to the hotel that we had shipped to the correct location, they signed for the package, and then it was misplaced. It was a big waste of time, but they ended up replacing what we lost in the box. On to the other aspects of the hotel: -The rooms are lovely and the bathrooms are very spacious. The quality of their bath products was appreciated. -If you sign up to be a Kimpton member, you can receive free wifi and $10 free to the mini bar -The downstairs restaurant had a fun wine sampling bar - pay by the ounce instead of glass -Room service was very slow

Reviews.Title: “Midtown doggy weekend success”
Reviews.Author: Doggiebag
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of the staff at the beautiful Eventi hotel in the interesting and authentic garment distric of New York City. You made us both and Hazelnut our Small Munsterlander Pointer feel like honored and pampered guests. We loved the breakfasts in bed, mingling at the wine tasting and hunting squirrels in Madison Square ;) Hopefully, we'll all see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kewt69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 5 nights in September. The room was modern and of minimalistic style, with the most comfortable bed ever! Great view of the Empire State Building and a wonderful base to explore the city that never sleeps. The complimentary wine hour between 5pm and 6pm was the icing on the cake as it was nice to take the weight off our feet after a busy day of sight seeing and enjoy chatting to other hotel residents. My husband and I would return to this hotel in a flash. The complementary wifi was also fantastic and allowed us to keep in touch with our family at home in Scotland without running up a phone bill! Oh one more point, the rooms were lovely and quiet.....for being in the city that doesn't sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful space on 6th Ave”
Reviews.Author: JulieGMelbAust
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got it all , location, luxury, free wine afternoons and great staff I stayed here in June 2011 for 7 nights and felt like one of the family. Rooms were spacious for new york standards with great sized bathrooms. The location on cnr 6th and 30th was close enough to walk to times square and Maceys. They also have an outdoor terrace where on one afternoon the hotel served sangrias to all guests. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “A Great Room in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa C
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Eventi with family and friends in a suite during the best time of year in NYC -- Christmastime. The hotel was beautifully decorated, and the staff was very helpful. The room was a perfect size for three people. I would wholeheartedly recommend staying at the Eventi.

Reviews.Title: “It's the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: Riccardo92
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the defects: the room was way too small to accomodate 4 people, but we stayed out the entire day so it didn t matter that much; the wifi wasn t worth the 10$ per day because of the speed and ee got trapped in the elevator, but we promptly got special assistance from a technician and the security supervisor. All the rest was perfect: it's located in an area full of shops and places to eat and a 10 minutes walk from times square, room were functional with a great view and staff vere highly skilled and very curteous.

Reviews.Title: “i blame it on the Eventi beds”
Reviews.Author: seawave1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a Xmas vacation at the Eventi. The staff making the extra mile to greet and smile at you that you feel like returning somewhere familiar, unlike big hotels that lost the touch with the guests. the room was very comfortable, what was lacking in the room were: bathroom amenities were mediocre. my spouse doesn't have a sensitive skin, but ended up with extremely dry scalp after shampooing with their shampoo. luckily i always bring mine. second is that the closet is uncomfortable- access is not easy if you want to hang your clothes. but the worse is definitely the bed. because of that bed, we overslept and missed a Broadway show. the bed was heavenly. overall speaking - the design, the ambiance, the service, the location, the hot coffee/tea with honey and lemon/chocolate in the mornings made our stay extremely joyful and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: homer227
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, but it isn't quite the nirvana that some people describe. It's great, but they could use a bit more attention to detail. The rooms are nice and the staff are friendly and helpful. Despite a few hiccups, I would stay here again. Our bathroom was pretty dirty when we arrived, which is never a good thing. Tub and shower both had hair and dirt basically everywhere. We left for the day and asked them to clean it, but when we returned at night all we had was turn down service and a still dirty bathroom. It wasn't a big deal to clean it ourselves, but for the price they charge, the room should be clean when you arrive and should certainly be clean after you point out that it wasn't up to par. My only other advice is to avoid room service. I tried twice and had two absolutely awful experiences, including waiting 2 hours for breakfast that was supposed to arrive in 30 minutes. I understand things get backed up, but we were repeatedly told that our food was on the way when it clearly wasn't. Worse, when the food arrived, it was missing part of the order as well as things like milk for coffee. We ordered breakfast at 10:15 and had to get an extended checkout because our food still hadn't arrived until well after the noon checkout time. They comped the meal, but it doesn't really excuse the repeated lies about the status of our order. Bottom line - great hotel, lousy room service, questionable housekeeping (at least in our instance). Nothing is perfect, so I'd definitely stay here again and just avoid room service (which is what you SHOULD do in NYC anyhow, but sometimes it's nice for breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Lesley A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many cities around the world during Christmas time and have to say service is typically lacking, no matter how fabulous the hotel. This past Christmas, my husband, twin 11 month old babies AND our dog, stayed at the Eventi in New York City and were beyond impressed by the service. It was absolutely impeccable, from our late night check in to our frenzied check out. I can go on, but there is no need. I just have to say that the service was so stellar that we were able to overlook cramming two cribs, a dog (who staff treated like Brad Pitt and even took out for a walk when we were gone for a while), and enough baggage for a round the world trip into a smallish room. We'd do it again. Eventi is very high on our list, if not highest at this point. Stay here. Seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TiniTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi right before Christmas. The service was by far the best I have ever received in a hotel! The extremely friendly, helpful staff, specifically Victoria, who helped check us in, and got us set up with everything we needed for a great trip to NYC. The complimentary wine happy house was a great perk. We had a view of the Empire State Building from our room and the location of the hotel was within walking distance to all the Christmas destinations. It is a pet friendly hotel and they even brought a bed for my kitten. It was truly great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Concept: Expect the unexpected”
Reviews.Author: rchavarria86
Reviews.Content: Speachless; well almost :D On my Top 2 Hotels list no question. The outdoor plaza, the restaurant, the roof verdana, my empire state view room, are you kidding me? I love how its close but away from the touristy NY. I've been twice for a Rihanna concert and Halloween. The bell staff are well prepared & smooth. The ART at this hotel let me tell you I work closely with the Smithsonian and the magical door and the cieling piece in the lobby, wow. The look is Gotham City in Batman meets Broadway thats what it gives me lol. Notice the goldfish or skyscrapers in the elevator. Sexy,modern,artsy, and fun. A Kimpton Flagship.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and well located”
Reviews.Author: lzuckerm
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton Hotels, and I'd been wanting to stay at the Eventi for ages during my frequent NYC trips. Unfortunately everyone else must love them, too, because it's frequently sold out! Finally right before the holidays, I got to check it out, and it's just as good as I'd hoped. The hotel's neighborhood is not exciting, but you have easy access to both midtown and downtown. The lobby has a very boutique hotel feel and service was efficient if not overly friendly. Rooms are stylish, comfortable and fairly big by NYC standards. Noise is often a problem at NYC hotels, but I didn't have any trouble sleeping in my 9th floor room. If you're a member of the Kimpton loyalty program, you also get a raid the mini-bar credit, which is a nice perk. NYC hotel prices fluctuate pretty wildly. I got my mid-week room for under $400, which is a pretty good deal compared to what I normally see for mid-range hotels. I'd definitely book the Eventi again for my next business trip!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: Gladimobayla
Reviews.Content: Booked directly on the Eventi website. Easy. The location of the hotel is prime-6th Ave between 29th and 30th. We arrived on a Sunday and were able to easily find street parking with in walking distance of the hotel. There is plenty of garages nearby as well. Upon walking up to the building, not knowing it was the hotel, I said to my friend, "Wow, I wonder what that is?!" We were coming down 29th. It was the Eventi. From that moment on, the experience didn't disappoint. Check in was quick and friendly. We were informed of their concierge services and dinner and events going on in the hotel. Off to the 19th floor. The hotel is very modern. We reserved a cityview deluxe king and opted to pay extra for the early check-in late check out. Not sure if that extra 50 was really worth it though. The room, overall, I thought was a great value for NYC. Very simple, clean modern design and decor. Loved the sliding bathroom door. The heat was a bit noisy so we went without. The room was incredibly quiet!! Which I loved. You looked out the window and saw all of the hustle and bustle of the city but heard absolutely nothing! Water pressure excellent. Hot water sustained. The bed...NO WORDS...it was heaven. Called for ice because we couldn't locate the ice machine and it came in less than 5 minutes. Went to the bar lounge, met very friendly bartenders, servers offering very personable service and conversation-loved that too. Banks, coffee, awesome deli all are within walking distance. I've signed up for the Kimpton In Touch Rewards program and look forward to using the benefits for my next stay at a Kimpton property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the city”
Reviews.Author: Tng8torgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to NYC and the Eventi. Nice, helpful people running a top-notch place. Great neighborhood for shopping, food, subway, and relatively easy walks to many of sites in Midtown and downtown on Manhattan. Rooms were larger than most places and no wait for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Eventi Dec 13-18, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Kungwa S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eventi from 13-18 December. Had a great time. The hotel staff were really nice, always curteous but never 'in your face'. We were given a room on the 22nd floor with great views of the Empire State building. My husband and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and there was a bottle of champagne, chocolates and a bowl of strawberries and blueberries to welcome us in the room - a real treat after a long flight from London. The hotel location was a few blocks away from Macy's (which was cool as there was a sale on with an added 20% off on the weekend we were there). We were also within walking distance of the Clearview Cinema which is where I love to watch the latest movies which aren't out in the UK. The bed was like sleeping in a feather cocoon - it was so difficult dragging ourselves out of it every morning! My husband and I managed to make it to the wine tasting hour most nights which was a real bonus. All in all, a really great hotel. I'll definitely be making the Eveni my New York hotel of choice from now on. Mrs K Small

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel better than park avenue location”
Reviews.Author: Dana1020
Reviews.Content: Another Kimpton winner. Nice room and great staff. On our last night, we failed to get housekeeping service even after two separate requests.
