But the mgr made it good Since we had prepaid through hotels.com he couldn'adjust what I had paid but comped us 2 $26 breakfasts the next a.m. Thank you Kimpton

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value for nyc”
Reviews.Author: geschult
Reviews.Content: Hotel was modern and staff was welcoming. Easy walking distance to all tourist sites and subway. Beds comfortable and nice view of empire state building. Awesome wine hour.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: alan f
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend in Manhattan. I spent three nights at the Eventi and enjoyed every minute of it. The room was modern, clean and very comfortable. The bed was an excellent blend of soft yet firm, and even though I was on the sixth floor, the noise level was very low. I could very faintly hear a subway or two early in the morning but the sound level was irrelevent and kind of reminded me of listening to trains go by at a distance when I was a kid. There is a jumbotron TV screen on the wall of the building facing the hotel's restaurant which played short films almost all the time. Watching them without sound was dreamlike and defilitely enhanced the experience since I had no view to speak of. OK the cons, the oatmeal I had for breakfast was a little cooler than it should have been. Picky, picky. I ate all of it. Also, having just now read the review from a few days before by the person who received birthday champagne and cupcakes, it was my birthday the day I checked in and I got bupkus. Zip. OK, so big deal. Perhaps Kimpton may not want to be starting a precedent here, but then again maybe when I stay there next time I'll point out this review and perhaps score a cookie or something, or a free glass of wine. Oh, wait...

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: lisarose
Reviews.Content: Usually when I visit New York, I sleep on my sister's couch, so this was definetly an upgrade. It was for work, otherwise I wouldn't have been able to stay in such a great location and in such a nice place. The hotel itself seemed pretty new and trendy. The lobby was small, and so was my room, but the beds were very comfy and the bathroom was nice. The room was very quiet, always important when staying in Manhattan. Only had two real complaints: there were no coffee makers in the room (NOT good for an addict like me), and sometimes it was hard to figure out how to use the technology (it was 3 days before we figured out the do not disturb light button). Overall though, really good location, good service, liked the conference rooms, paid wifi in all the rooms, quiet, comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alissa98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night in December, it was a little bit of a splurge for us. The hotel was very clean and up to date. We got there around 1pm and were able to check in early which was nice. We wished we had looked into the parking situation before valeting the car since parking was right around the corner. We were warned that getting our car back would be a long wait, which it was. The room was great; big windows, decent size, LG flatscreen TV, comfy king bed, nice bathroom. I do have to say that we both didn't like that there was no shower door--found it cold in there since the steam couldn't build up. My husband went downstairs around 9/9:30am on a Sunday and it was a zoo to get from the 8th floor to the lobby to grab a coffee. The three elevators were jam packed with ppl all waiting to get to the lobby. Also there was a stairwell blocked off so he couldn't walk down to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Patti M
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a short weekend in NYC and picked this hotel because we found a good price. What a great value an wonderful stay! We arrived very early (9 a.m.) and instead of leaving our bags with the valet, as I had expected, we were immediately checked into our room. The doormen were friendly and the evening wine reception lovely. Also, we came by train and wanted to see the holiday sights, including Macy's, so the location was perfect. Our only gripe, the TV. The sound made it unusable. It was either too quiet, or blaring without changing the volume at all and you couldn't understand what people were saying. Of course, most people don't go to NYC to watch TV in their rooms, but still.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small issues but fault is hard to find”
Reviews.Author: sheraprincessofpowa
Reviews.Content: Needed to book a room in NY for a few days when my place was getting some work done on it. Since I have pets, my first go-to hotel was a Kimpton. And let me start by saying this: most hotels say they are pet-friendly, meaning they allow your pets for an extra charge, non-refundable deposit, along with a list of rules of what you can and cannot do, like leave them alone in the room. The Kimpton is such a refreshing change from all of that. They welcome pets with open arms, no extra charges, no rules. As it was explained to me at the hosted wine/cocktail hour nightly in the lobby, is that the hotel is family friendly, including the fur kids in the family. The concierge also told me that if I had meetings or had to leave my dog in the room, to let her know so she could arrange for someone to come and walk her. Seriously. So refreshing. Am scratching my head reading the reviews about how this is not a good location. Having lived in NY for years and know the city well, I am more than familiar with the landscape, I booked this particular Kimpton because of the area. If you are hemming and hawing about what location is best for your visit, I have to say that this is a great one. The hotel is on the northern tip of the Chelsea neighborhood, a hop skip and jump from Herald Square, Macy's and the great shopping along 34th. It's also about 10 blocks from Times Square, 5 blocks to the Empire State building. There is a major subway stop 3 blocks from the hotel, where you can catch a number of trains that will take you anywhere you want to go...down to Soho and the World Trade Center, and uptown to Central Park and Rockefeller Center. If you walk down 6th Ave 20 blocks you're in the village. AND it's practically around the corner from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, if you have plans to take a train anywhere, and MSG if you're here for a sporting event or concert. True, this hotel is not in the middle of a famous authentic NYC neighborhood, but the pay off is that you can get anywhere fast and easy. Check in was easy and quick. Booked the lowest level King room, and it was a typical small NY hotel room. After settling in, I realized the heat and a/c was not working and the room was getting colder. The maintenance man was there within a few minutes and I left him working on the problem. I went out for dinner, and they left me a note telling me they had to change my room since the problem couldn't be fixed, and then upgraded me to a suite at no charge, for my 'troubles'. Now *that* is how you take care of your guests. The rooms are very nice. Current without being too trendy, and stylish without sacrificing comfort. The bed was very comfortable. One of the nights I stayed happened to be my birthday. When I was checking in and showed my photo ID, the woman at the front desk noticed and wished me a Happy Birthday. Well, on my birthday, they sent me a bottle of champagne along with strawberries and two cupcakes, all complimentary along with a handwritten note saying they hoped I was enjoying my stay while things were getting worked out at my home. The hosted complimentary wine/cocktail hour is also a good bonus. It was so nice to come back to the hotel exhausted after a busy day to get treated to wine and nice conversation. So many hotels could take lessons from Kimpton. They seem to have figured it out.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable hotel bed EVER!”
Reviews.Author: d_hops
Reviews.Content: On a recent shopping weekend in NYC, my mom, grandma and I stayed at Eventi for 2 nights. From start to finish, the staff exemplified sincerity, customer service and friendliness - as well as knowledge of the neighborhood and greater Manhattan. The room was quite spacious, the shower fabulous, and the view out the western-facing windows fantastic. The beds are incredibly, ridiculously comfortable. After long days of walking and shopping, it was an amazing experience to sink into the cocoon of sheets and just float away. Outside noise was not an issue. Highlights in the neighborhood include Macy's and Kleinfeld (only 10 blocks away), among dozens of other shops and restaurants. I'd like to offer special credit to Eugenia Simons, who provides a perfect example of the hospitality and professionalism that keeps me a loyal Kimpton Inner Circle member. Kudos to you!

Reviews.Title: “pricey for the experience”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, but compared to the Kimpton in Chicago, exceedingly average. Staff told us the hotel was on the Macy's Parade route. It wasn't. They advertised free Continental breakfast. There wasn't. They advertised free hot toddies. There weren't. Staff keep trying to recommend the $20 cabs rather than Yellow Cabs for $6 fares. Location was ok and the hotel had nice decor, but overall, this hotel was extremely overrated compared to the Allegro Kimpton in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Well Trained Staff - Premier One Bedroom Suite”
Reviews.Author: flifish
Reviews.Content: As always for a Kimpton Hotel, the staff is trained to make your stay as perfect as possible and they will go out of their way to get anything you may want or need and it's done with a smile. Just what you need after a long flight. My reviews error on the critical side. Overall, you should know the hotel was comfortable, staff wonderful, location handy, but was unusually noisy. Location nice especially if you want to branch out from the Central Park -Times Square areas. This is just a short 3-4 minute walk to Macy's Herald Square and subway. Walking back and forth to Times Square is doable but it would be a long trek. Maybe walk there and return by subway or cab. Arrival: The bellman was on watch and collected our bags from the car upon arrival. The hotel desk staff was helpful and offered to send someone out to purchase a neck pillow for me. I didn't take them up on it but the offer to buy the pillow was thoughtful and above the call of duty. To the room: The hotel is a little dark from lobby and into the rooms. It's decorated in warm dark colors and also dimmed lighting used. Those damn new lightbulbs are awful. Our rooms appeared well kept, clean, even the remotes looked clean. Over all, they need more light shed in the sitting room, bedroom and bathroom. I am not a fan of feeling like I'm in a bar all the time. The one bedroom premier suite seemed a little cramped but had a large marble bathroom with, hallelujah, plenty of counter space and storage. A full size tub with a separate large shower with both a rain head and a regular shower head. It made up for the slightly cramped suite. I have to remind myself that it is NYC and spaciousness isn't easy to find at any price. The sitting room has a chair and a small sized sofa with a flat screen television (tv in br also) with a real door separating the sitting area from the bedroom. But there is a slight feeling that you are dodging furniture to move around more so if both people try to move simultaneously. One double doored closet is provided in each of the two rooms with a motion sensor light in each. The bedroom is snug fitting as well, it's a more than a little cramped if two people are trying to maneuver at the same time. Sound: Here is where i get really critical. I don't live in a city or even a town. I'm accustomed to quiet and it is difficult for me to sleep in the city. As long as it's a constant hum i'm not too troubled but I always ask for the quiet room. The front desk clerk didn't take this to heart. This hotel sits next to a plaza that is part of the hotel property and it is made available to the general public. First blush, that is great!! However, they allow skateboarders. Okay during the day and early evening, fine. However the skateboarders are there at night, late night to 1AM maybe later. The clerk put us plaza side on the 6th floor which one would think would be the quiet side of the hotel. It sounded like people wheeling suitcases over cobblestones and echoed between the canyon of the two buildings. You could hear their voices, but is was the wheel noise that did me in. The staff was amazingly accommodating and understanding. They insisted they were wrong to put us in a 6th floor room and moved us to the 20th floor the next day. They explained they make the plaza public, but I think they did ask the skateboarders to leave that night. I wasn't thrilled about changing rooms but did so for the sleep. However, even on the 20th floor while dozing at around midnight the next night.... here come the skateboarders again. Even on the 20th floor you can hear them drop the board, roll across the concrete, and then hear them land on every jump. It wasn't as loud as the 6th floor room but it made it slightly difficult to get to sleep. When you're paying 6-700 for a room ... So to sum up, NYC has a lot of hotels. While this is a good one because of lighting, and noise on the plaza I would probably find another place unless I wanted to be near Macy's, Penn Station, or Market Square Arena. Again, kudos to the staff they are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: McCready82
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel so much, everything about it is fantastic, the only thing I would change would be the location. Let me first say there is nothing really wrong with where it is but I prefer other hotel locations over this (Ink48). The food court next door is brilliant, I could lose a whole day in there sampling the different cusines! The staff are very nice and the rooms are some of the nicest I have stayed in. We had a suite looking out towards the Empire State building and we got this by booking a deluxe room directly through Kimpton and then using their upgrade package so it worked out cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaemicha
Reviews.Content: Last Christmas I fell in love with the 'W' but when they upped their rates, I had to shop around and, with some help, I found the Eventi and Wow! I loved it! It's about $100.00 a night less than the W, located a few blocks from Macy's, MSG (where I went to see a concert), close to Bryant Park and Times Square. And, this is the oddest part. I had a corner room and got the best nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. Go there! It's about a year old and everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this hotel during a business trip in late October. The hotel was centrally located to other destination spots in NYC. My room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful. Another highlight of my visit was Omar at the front desk. He was so incredibly helpful and made sure that my stay at the Eventi was a great experience. I was so impressed with this hotel that I am coming back again next week!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: rolf_the_viking
Reviews.Content: Eventi is a new comfortable hotel in NYC. Location is good, walking distance to many places. Rooms are clean and comfortable/cosy. Bathrooms feel very clean and modern, shower was a bit tricky to wrangle to the perfect temp. Free Wifi in the rooms, finally a hotel that understands that Internet connection is part of the room. Nice touch with the open winebar during afternoons. The hotel has a nice bar and a great outdoors patio. Pets are allowed that is a Kimpton speciality.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice spot- its a Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomay
Reviews.Content: Want a really nice room NOT in the middle of everything? You can't go wrong here. CLEAN, EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE BEDS, BEATIFUL BATH. Hey this is NYC and you will pay through the nose for anything nice. Service was pleasant and helpful, did not make use of spa or gym- but did partake in included wine reception in evening. Would stay again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location and service that goes beyond.”
Reviews.Author: Generansom
Reviews.Content: We spent a holiday weekend to do the Christmas in new York thing. The staff was great, it felt like we knew the font desk staff. Omar made us dinner reservations, was funny and helpful. Victoria the next night made us reservations, and had drinks delivered to our table off site none the less. We had a great view of the empire state building from our window, and had a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “great fins in NYC”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Terrific new Kimpton, rooms have great wall to ceiling windows, good size for NYC, lobby is happening if not a bit loud, not the most convenient location, but good value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently delivers!”
Reviews.Author: Cglasb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Eventi more than 4 times and I am never disapointed. I travel for business and I appreciate they are fast and efficient at checking me in and recognize not everyone is a tourist with loads of time. The rooms are spotless and very comfortable. I admit, I am a Kimpton member and do get some nice benefits, but I feel the staff is extremely nice to everyone regardless of status. The BEST feature about this place is that the windows are practically sound proof. For anyone who knows NYC, not hearing constant taxi honking and city sirens, if you are not used to it, is a real blessing. Sleep like baby every time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location..price..and staff”
Reviews.Author: yvontario
Reviews.Content: About ten blocks from time square..but doesn't seem that far since we walked a lot ...to restaurants ..theatre or a five dollar cab ride...complimentary wine hour and sangria was a nice touch and we had two queen beds in the room...security checked us before entering each time and front desk very helpful..nice rooftop patio and bar...no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KREWgirl
Reviews.Content: The basics: Rooms here are small, but no smaller than an average New York City hotel room. Space is used well and the bathroom is quite spacious. The shower is huge and glorious. Room and bath could use brighter lighting. As a new hotel (only 14 months at our visit) it is clean and up to date. Service was outstanding. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and made us feel welcome -- chatted with our kids, showed interest in our visit, etc. They were extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations and directions, and even called the restaurant for us on the spot to make a reservation. When we returned hours later, they really wanted to know if we'd enjoyed the restaurant. Beds were VERY comfortable -- plenty of pillows and nice bedding. Room service was quite good, although the menu is more limited than I'd like, especially for late night (after 10) dining. Didn't use the hotel restaurant or fitness center. Be sure to sign up for the Kimpton loyalty club for some free/extra amenities. No charge to sign up but you get free wi-fi and free valet parking Love this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for it's Price Category”
Reviews.Author: RussFilice
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the heart of NYC for it's price category. The hotel is geared toward the business traveler and definitely has the feel of such. I like the place and would stay again. The staff is great and they all try to make each guests stay special. A can't beat hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “No reason to stay here...”
Reviews.Author: prestonhalperin
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting NYC and decide to stay at Eventi, you better have a very good reason to be staying at 30th Street and 6th Avenue. It is one of the worst areas to stay in Manhattan compared to pretty much anyplace else (upper Westside, upper east side, mid-town, Times Square, the Village, lower Manhattan, you name it). We stayed there because we were in town to see a game at Madison Square Garden and though it would be easy to walk back to the hotel after the game. Wrong decision. There was no where to even have a drink after the game. The hotel operates its only bar/restaurant as a night club for kids who wait in line to get in late at night. Even if you wanted to be there, its very loud and there are no seats available. The hotel that has no interest in catering to its guests, but instead prefers the revenue from operating its night club. As far as the hotel itself goes, its fine. The rooms are a bit small, the bathroom is very nice. However, for this price you can choose one of the many beautiful areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntiemame333
Reviews.Content: Elegant, pleasing decor, courteous and helpful staff, great location, spacious room...everthing you need in a hotel. I would stay here any time while in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and accommodating, good value”
Reviews.Author: dgourmac
Reviews.Content: Good midtown location, very helpful staff. Clean, modern, but not austere room, very good bed, quiet. Will return here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Eventi!”
Reviews.Author: eric_et_steph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eventi from november 20th thrue 24th. We had a wonderfull stay! Our room 1207 was super. A little on the small side but perfect for a couples get away. Room and hotel in general where super clean and well kept. Staff was friendly and helpfull. Wine hour from 5p.m. to 6p.m. was a nice touch. Hotel is close to Time Square wich we loved! We will definatly be staying at the Eventi for our next trip! We highly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “"So relaxing!"”
Reviews.Author: John U
Reviews.Content: The Eventi Hotel is a wonderful hotel situated in New York City. The staff there are so lovely and special which makes your stay so much more enjoyable. I got a gift when I first arrived at the Eventi hotel a "I love New York" T-shirt! The hotel is so clean and spotless it's amazing!!! When I first arrived at my room I was blown away by its decor being so beautifull with wall paper of New York city. The beds were so comfortable as well it seemed more than reality! Once I had explored my room I decided to explore the Hotel finding a beautifull patio. You could even go out there at certain times and get a free couple of glasses of wine whilst getting the most overwhelming view of New York City. It made my first time in New York something to remember for the rest of my life so I hope it will that effect on you as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: VickyE2006
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern, yet warm and welcoming hotel. The rooms are large and quiet and every hotel staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. The evening wine hour was nice. This hotel exceeded all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Girls weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreBetty11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy walking distance from Penn station even with bags, and close to Herald square. We were there for a girls weekend and were very happy with the Eventi. Four adult women stayed in a room with two queen beds and we had enough room. We felt safe in the hotel and the surrounding neighborhood. The staff is friendly and we were sent 2 complimentary bottles of wine when we arrived. The room was really nice. No coffee maker in the room but there was free coffee & tea in the lobby every morning. The front desk staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants. The second floor bar was a fun place to spend our first evening. Each of us said that we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Stay at Eventi = A Fabulous Time in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGirl1982
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Eventi hotel in NYC was absolutely fabulous! The hotel is centrally located and provides easy access to all areas of the city -- it was the perfect place for my travel needs. The property is a trendy boutique hotel that combines modern and chic decor with a zen-like vibe. I found it to be both buzzing and relaxing at the same time -- plus the views of the skyline are unforgettable! I recommend a room on the 20th floor! The staff at the Eventi were incredibly accommodating and efficient. Upon my departure from New York I left my cell phone in the hotel room and the security staff went to great measures to locate it and return it to me in a timely manner. I highly recommend a stay at the Eventi -- you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi Hotel while on business in New York, and I was so happy with the wonderful hospitality of the staff, the ambiance of the hotel, and the wine hour (this was a great surprise)! The room I stayed in was really comfortable and clean. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a great place to stay in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Eventi: Experience NYC the right way”
Reviews.Author: Natalie L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eventi Hotel over Halloween and was thoroughly delighted with their hospitality and fun, festive spirit. The staff displayed a jack-o-lantern contest and were in costume during their daily complimentary wine hour. It was a hoot! They also projected the movie Beetle Juice on the building next door for all to watch from their bar and lounge. The rooms are incredibly spacious and comfortable, and the modern design was very fitting. The hotel is just blocks from Harold Square, and is within walking distance of some of Manhattan's most notable landmarks. A must-stay - this hotel is where to be.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie K
Reviews.Content: This was such a fun hotel --- super helpful staff, happening wine hour, hip-feel, just fabulous. The rooms are modern and clean. Mine had an unbelievable view of the city and the Empire State Building. Absolutely loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “My new FAVORITE hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: city2country
Reviews.Content: I spent a quick weekend here for a concert. It is a few blocks from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, which made the location perfect! Check-in was quick and very friendly, as was check-out. Loved the room and the comfy beds. The bathroom was done is marble. Everything was spotless. We even enjoyed the elevators because they had a flat screen TV with fish swimming around to look at, instead of watching the #'s light up on each floor. I highly, highly, recommend this place, and am almost looking for an excuse to go back to NYC just to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: Rmarbut
Reviews.Content: I booked the Eventi for my birthday trip. When we checked in it was very early due to arriving on a redeye flight and I was not expecting to be able to get into our room for a few hours. To our surprise, and relief, we were able to check in right away and get some sleep. The bigger surprise was when we walked into the room and they had upgraded us to a one bedroom suite because it was my birthday. The room was spacious and well decorated. After some sleep we made it out to explore and upon return there was another surprise of champagne and chocolates accompanied by a nice birthday card from the hotel. I really have to thank the Eventi for helping make this a great birthday trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ar0undth3world
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this location with my mom and had a wonderful time. They had an amazing Halloween party at there bar which was unexpected, which they gave my friends and I VIP access for. The lobby is nice and makes a great meeting locations if you have friends or coworkers in the city. They serve wine daily and coffee/water in the morning. I had a great time and appreciated the location between Times Square and Chelsea in the heart of the shopping district. Also close to Penn Station/MSG. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room, friendly and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: Mariaarn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eventi on a recent business trip and had a great stay. The location is perfect right bang in the middle of manhattan so you would expect tiny cupboard rooms but mine was very large with an amazing over sized bathroom full of etro travel size toiletries. The bed was super comfortable and they serve a lovely breakfast. But more importantly the staff were just fabulous, really friendly and helpful, they sorted me out with directions and handy tips and made me feel so welcome and well looked after. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Up until 3am”
Reviews.Author: MaD64
Reviews.Content: First, the pros....the hotel is very modern and nicely furnished. Rooms, beds comfortable. Bathrooms are marble with rainhead shower. The cons.....we didn't care for the location. It was too busy. We prefer the 50s on the east side because it is quiter, more residential and still in walking distance to the theatre. The biggest con was that there is a club on the second floor of the hotel and we heard the music from midnight until 3am up on the 10th floor. When you stay in the city for one night so that you don't have to drive home after a Broadway play, you want to go to sleep before 3am. We should have just driven home. Very disappointed in our experience at this "luxury" Kimpton hotel. Luxuryhotel and club music just don't go together. Kimpton should figure out which market it wants...the people who want to go clubbing or the people willing to drop $400-$500 per night on a room.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation & striking design in NYC”
Reviews.Author: AtTheBackOfThePlane
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to the Eventi, I just completed a 10 day stay in a 'Cityview' room. The room was well sized for NY and the bathroom was very well appointed with a wonderful shower. I picked the hotel based on price and location and wasn't disappointed as it is very well situated for Penn Station & the Flatiron & Chelsea districts The hotel overall was stylish, especially the Bar & Restaurant area, and in great condition with friendly, welcoming staff. It's also very good to get free WiFi service on joining the Kimpton InTouch programme. Two areas disappointed me somewhat. I was staggered at the cost of a laundry bill - it would have been almost as cheap to have bought new clothes. Additionally service in the restaurant was often very slow both at breakfast & dinner. These quibbles, notwithstanding, the Eventi delivered a very good guest experience and made an extended business trip to NY both comfortable and pleasant. I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: binowest
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, nice modern vibe. They provide everything you could need for your stay. The property has a nice restaurant and bar/club on site. The staff were very accomodating. I loved all of the extra touches like the orchids in the lobby and freshly scented air when you walked in the door, along with the light techno music and softer lighting. They really create a comfortable get away experience for you here. We were just blocks from the Empire State Building. Up on the 10th floor and facing south, we got great views of the lights at night, including directly facing the ESB. It's a brisk, short walk to Macy's and other shopping, Bryant Park, Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pwrstr
Reviews.Content: The Eventi Hotel is wonderful, upscale boutique hotel in heart of Manhattan. Eventi is close to public transportation and within walking distance of the Meatpacking District, Greenwich Village, Times Square and, of course, Chelsea - the neighborhood where the hotel is located. The room, bed, bathroom, view and service were all superb. The hotel restaurant and bar and fun and trendy, but a bit on the pricey side. All in all, Eventi is a great experience and wonderful option for travelers seeking a boutique hotel in the center of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, average room”
Reviews.Author: fieldmom
Reviews.Content: I met my college daughter here for the weekend, and, as I requested, they gave me a high floor. We had the smallest room on the 21st floor with 2 feet on each side of the bed and another 3 feet at the foot of the bed. The bathroom was almost as large as the bedroom. But the view was spectacular! We looked out on the Empire State Building lit up in orange and blue for the New York Marathon. The bed was so comfortable, and the room was very quiet. The hotel offers a wine hour from 5-6 pm and the wine is pretty horrible, so they could do a little better at choosing a wine that was not so substandard. All in all, however, this is not a bad place to stay, particularly if you are arriving by train as I was. Penn Station is only 3 blocks away. There are not many great restaurants close by, but the price per night was very reasonable compared to other NY hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and View, Service Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Roamer616
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say I'm usually a huge fan of Kimpton hotels and have enjoyed several across the country over the years but hadn't stayed in any of their NY properties until this visit. I booked a special one-year anniversary promotional rate at Eventi for three nights in a King View room. The view did not disappoint: a very large (by NY hotel standards) corner room with an entire wall of windows that felt like you could almost reach out and touch the Empire State Bldg. The room was nicely appointed/decorated but the wood furniture and bathroom door were already badly scratched and in need of repair. I found most of the front desk staff to be polite but just going through the motions when it came to service...there seemed to be a generally disengaged attitude. Despite my calls about the room not having been cleaned, no one bothered to mention until my last night (and there was no operational instruction or literature, either) that the maid service/privacy light system on the door was somehow left on when I checked in and stayed on the whole time. My daily newspaper never arrived once during my stay, even after I called twice to let them know. On my last night, a bottle of wine and some cheese straws were delivered with a note of apology from the manager, which was a nice gesture and acknowledgement of the service issues. It's a very convenient location to many Manhattan attractions, and the small, in-house spa and its staff is comfortable and welcoming for a facial or massage at the end of a day of shopping and sightseeing. With another amazing promotional rate, I would probably give Eventi another try but am inclined to try another Kimpton hotel on my next trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Space; Aloof Staff”
Reviews.Author: cjc04
Reviews.Content: The Eventi is a beautiful space. My room was very nice- quiet, great view, comfortable bed. My only complaint is that the staff was subpar. They were not very helpful (save one doorman) responsive or accommodating. It was pretty unbelievable. Unfortunately, after informing Kimpton and the Eventi of some issues with the Eventi hotel staff, they have not done anything to remedy the situation or even acknowledge any concerns. To be quite honest, my experience with Kimpton and the Eventi (poor customer service) is leading me to re-think my previous adoration with the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea gem”
Reviews.Author: bruceww
Reviews.Content: The Eventi has been my primary NYC hotel since it opened and it has never failed to satisfy. Great location (easy walk to Penn Station, brisk walk to Javits), outstanding staff, good food in house and nearby (FoodParc next door rocks). Good access to EWR and all points west.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan Y
Reviews.Content: Great welcome. We stayed for 5 nights. Courteous, friendly staff including Dwain, Omar and Jocelyn who were well informed and gave us excellent advice. The hotel is right in the centre of Manhattan and you could see the Empire State building from our room! Hotel is within easy walking distance of the subway. The hotel provided a frig and coffee making equipment on request, the hotel being geared mainly for business people. However, there was a mini bar. Excellent restaurant and bar. Free tea and coffe in the morning. Happy Hour complimentary wine from 5-6pm each evening, in good weather held on the terrace which gave amazing views over New York. We had a problem with the bedding which was resolved quickly and efficiently. We could have done with a larger room though due to all our luggage. There is an underground car park beneath the hotel which costs $10 per half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Product, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: mlms1206
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi in September for another business trip. I couldn't even tell you how many times I've stayed here...there's been so many times! This hotel is great from the minute you walk in the door. The staff is friendly and very professional.There's never a wait to check in and the one or two times that I arrived earlier in the day and my room wasn't ready, there's a great lounging area in the lobby with comfy couches and chairs and wifi. In addition, there's a Starbucks right next door if you're looking for a mid-day coffee. The rooms are a good size for NYC. Comfortable bedding, bathroom products are high end (Etro) and floor to ceiling windows. If you get an upgraded room, they have great hardwoods! The bathrooms are very spacious, plenty of counterspace and large showers. Water pressure could be a little better, but nothing that would stop me from coming back! and I always love that I have my favorite snacks waiting for me when I get in my room...Kimpton In Touch is great for that! The bar and restaurant is full of energy. Great lounge seating up there as well. It's a nice place to meet someone for a drink...when I'm by myself, I love going downstairs in the lobby for wine hour! Seriously, where else can you get a glass of complimentary wine every day! And complimentary coffee in the morning on your way out the door! Love it! The location is wonderful too...depending if you have business in midtown or downtown, you are in the right place...it's a straight shot up 6th into midtown and a quick turn back on 7th to head to downtown. Starbucks next door, shopping and plenty of restaurants in walking distance and if you need a taxi, the bellman are fantastic (and so friendly as well!) I really can't say enough about this hotel. When I walk in, I always feel like I'm coming home. It really is a comfortable feelilng hotel and perfect for the business traveler and the leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: PaVistor19460
Reviews.Content: Kimpton hotels seem to be very nice and friendly hotels. We stayed at the Palamar in Philly. This hotel in NYC was just a cool inside and the staff were very friendly. The room was new and the bed was comfortable. This hotel was very clean and the cost per night was good. Room service was great. Free coffee in the morning in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrendanVancouver
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great 6 night stay in New York City at the Eventi and we loved it. The hotel is a great location for walking uptown and downtown and is a cheap cab ride from anywhere. I only wish we had one more night when we got snowed into the Newark Airport when we were trying to get home and our flight was cancelled. The staff at the front desk was super friendly. When we called for ice and when we called because our safe wasn't working they came up right away. The room is a little small but from what I understand about New York this is the standard and it is was only the two enough and it was nice and cozy. The bathroom was modern and spacious this would be the one spot that we had issue. I am not sure if this is a standard for NYC as well but the water pressure in the shower was sooooo weak. I am someone that loves a hot powerful shower in the morning so I would have loved more pressure. As many of the other reviewers have written the beds are awesome and so incredibly comfortable and my request for feather pillows was accommodated. We didn't eat at Bar Basque but I heard other guests talking about and they had good things to say. If you want a good casual place nearby I would suggest Hill Country Chicken by Madison Square Park. I usually stay in these that we are very self-sufficient travelers so we rarely use concierge services but from our experience the service was great. We were on the 11th floor and had a cool view of the Empire State Building and barely heard any street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, stylish room in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: fuzzypinkbunny
Reviews.Content: Reserved this room when it was on sale at SniqueAway.com with the idea that we'd bring the dog to this pet-friendly hotel to roam the city and city parks on a nice fall day. Enter surprise October snowstorm! So we went sans dog and still had a great time despite the weather. Got to the city at about 12:30 p.m. and was able to check in right away (love that!) The friendly front desk staff checked us in quickly and we were in right away. Happy to have an umbrella as an amenity (forgot ours at home!!!) Room was not huge, but not tiny either. Stylish and modern. The bed was VERY comfy and I slept amazingly well. Amazing views of the Empire State Building. Walking distance to Times Square, Madison Square Park/Flatiron district, Herald Square, the Empire State Building -- there's lots to do around this hotel! Helpful doormen hailed us cabs in the worst of the weather which I know is probably not special to the hotel, but I found the doormen to be very friendly and helpful in general. Loved the noon check-out (plenty of time to get breakfast and explore before dealing with check-out.) We were also able to check our bags and keep our car valeted for another couple of hours free-of-charge. Nice perk (though, I guess rightfully so since overnight valet is a pricey $50/night!) Only complaint, for some reason, the knobs to get the shower working were super complicated. I definitely want to go back to this hotel next time we visit NYC -- beautiful property, plus a fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & trendy spot”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyMagpie
Reviews.Content: Just spend 3 nights at the Eventi with two friends. Great location for train travel - rode in from Newark Airport and walked the two blocks there. Hotel suite was fairly big by New York standards and bathroom was huge. The weather was great so we walked from the Eventi to practically everywhere! We ate one meal at the Bar Basque downstairs and it was just okay, but seemed to be a trendy bar scene. Not my favorite NYC hotel, but great location and perfect for three friends

Reviews.Title: “Clean, sleek and funky in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: geardots
Reviews.Content: Located in the Garment District, this hotel will not disappoint in any category. A few easy walking blocks to the Empire State Building and to Times Square and to Penn Station, our party of 4 loved the location. For those who want to do some shopping, there are numerous wholesale jewelry and purse stores (that will in fact sell to the general public) surrounding the hotel. Staff were professional, friendly, and efficient. We booked through SniqueAway and are disappointed that we were not able to take advantage of the free parking coupon offered on TripAdvisor (found only after our return home). Valet Parking for an SUV will cost you $65/day, which according to the staff is what all the hotels charge. Check for the free parking special on TripAdvisor by going to the Eventi website. Quiet hotel but you may want to choose a room as high up as possible. We were on the 15th floor and both our parties were disturbed throughout the night and early morning hours. The first night there were skateboarders using the courtyard area below. On the Sat. evening it was the pounding music from Bar Basque below, which lasted till about 4am. I used ear plugs but the thumping sound could not be obliterated. Enjoyed the wine tasting hour in the early evening and the coffee availability in the mornings down in the lobby. Fruit-infused water was always available also. Nice touch. Bathrooms are roomy, beds are comfy, great reading light at bedside, and very clean. One thing we noticed was how difficult it was to catch a cab outside the hotel. Not sure why this is. On a couple of occasions we gave up and hopped the subway rather than wait for a taxi to get hailed down. Acquaint yourself with how the "gypsy cabs" operate. You can usually get one hailed down but make sure you negotiate your price, otherwise you will undoubtedly get overcharged. The hotel staff will educate you if you are like us and unfamiliar with the operations of these cabs. Pets stay free! Check out the website on what they can offer for your pet. We only encountered 1 small dog so it isn't as though the place is over-run with animals. Take time to find the HighLine (walking distance from the hotel) and stroll along its path. Our 3 nights at the Eventi were terrific, despite the noise level from the bar and courtyard below. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean and attractive”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithoutCharli
Reviews.Content: My traveling companion is a Kimpton hotel regular but it was a first time visit for me. The staff were welcoming and friendly, our room was spotless, and the location (close to Penn Station) was perfect for us. There is no restauarant so you have to either order in or go out for breakfast, but that is hardly a problem when you are in downtown New York City. We had an incredible view. Street noise was remarkably low but we did struggle with a loud air cicrulation system on the first night. We figured out how to turn that off for the second night so it was fine. This is now my NYC hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: dwhitley
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my wifes birthday in NY and stayed at Eventi near midtown. It was our first stay at a Kimpton hotel and were both very impresseed with the hotel and especially the service. I called ahead to inform them of the occaision and they kindly put us on the top floor with an amazing view of the Empire State building. Upon returning from dinner on our first night, we were amazed to see that the concierge had provided a bottle of champagne and two cupcakes. The stay was first rate from beginning to end.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with some annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Eventi, and although we love the location and the hotel is generally very good, there were some nagging issues throughout our stay. When we arrived at 1 pm our room was not yet available, which is understandable. We left our bags and returned after the 3 pm time that was suggested, and our room was still not ready. OK, small inconvenience. Later that evening when we returned after the event that brought us to NYC, we turned on the TV and the sound was uncontrollable, ranging from silent to so loud it would disturb the neighbors. We reported it the next morning, and an engineer was dispatched to fix it. The sound then worked, but now picture reception was sketchy. After check-in, we noticed when we got to our room that the key folder indicated we were staying for one night, so we called the front desk and reconfirmed that it was two nights. However, when we returned to our room the second day, the keys wouldn't work--presumably because they had been programmed for a one-night reservation. So we had to go back to the desk to get our keys reprogrammed. Also, the elevators seem inadequate for the building--we always had a long wait, and the cars were always crowded. Sometimes we would have to wait for a second or third car. Again, no big problems, just a series of niggly annoyances. The hotel is in a great location, especially if you're an Amtrak traveler to Penn Station. Our cozy corner room had an extremely comfortable king bed, and the room was well designed with a fabulous, large bathroom. I like the Kimpton chain, especially their green reputation and their support of The Nature Conservancy, but given that we had a superior experience for a lower rate earlier at the nearby Hotel Indigo, I suspect that is where we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: sea98102traveler
Reviews.Content: we both travel alot and have stayed at our share of Marriott's, W's, Sheraton's, etc. as well as many boutique hotels. The place is very very nice. The rooms is lovely. Well appointed. Terrific bed and lighting. Great layout. Very thoughtful. The bathroom rocks. Marble, roomy, very deluxe. And for the price it's about the best hotel value we've ever experience. Oh, the view is viewy... awesome. From here on out, whenever we go to NYC, there's no question where we're staying.

Reviews.Title: “Not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: balhamred
Reviews.Content: For the price i would expect more but friendly staff. not too great cleaning rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Suman514
Reviews.Content: It's been awhile since my husband and I last stayed at a Kimpton hotel. The Eventi did not disappoint! Check-in staff were quick and efficient. I would like to thank the maintenance man for trying to fix our air conditioning on our first night (our room was really hot). He was courteous and professional, and made sure management knew there was a problem... even at 1am! Thank you! Management was also very courteous in addressing our problems. Our subsequent room was even better than the first (which was also awesome). The bed was comfortable with plenty of space. Washroom was big, nicely done with Etro toiletries. Hotel is about a 10 min walk from the Macy's flagship and about a 15-20min walk to Chelsea and the Meatpacking District. Great location - I would stay here again. Happy travels! I'd also like to add that the event space on the second floor is fabulous. If I ever need to throw a party in New York, I'd definitely throw it at the Eventi. (By the way, I thin the is a bar or club at the hotel. Huge line-ups at night - must be a hot spot!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Event at the Eventi”
Reviews.Author: AGC4
Reviews.Content: I hosted a large birthday party at the Eventi -- we had about 200 people for cocktails and dinner on a Saturday night, and that included a number of out-of-town guests who stayed as guests at the hotel. The hotel staff was superb. They delivered on every promise for the event -- which took place in two different venues in the hotel, and included a sitdown dinner for everyone, and some oddball quirks that we requested for various reasons of tradition -- and they treated our out of town guests wonderfully. People who stayed at the hotel raved especially at the service; they said they were treated :like kings." It was a total pleasure to work with people at Eventi. I would highly recommend Eventi as both a hotel and a party space.

Reviews.Title: “A nice time on Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Andreas K
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel on the 6th Ave and 30th street located in a perfect spot to discover Manhattan. Hotel staff was very helpful, polite and friendly. We had a very nice stay at the Eventi, and minor issue was sorted. Started off with the first night to have room with with connection to another room (closed door in between) but the neighbor was more than loud. By having this door in between the rooms didn't help on the situation, so we where relocated to another room. Unfortunately no staff did help us out. We ended up in a nice room, but smaller room but with a fantastic view. The hotel have all you need and the rooms a nicely decorated, but do need a bit more lighting. No bed bugs and in general good cleaning, when they where around. Did found our room undone by cleaning twice and cleaning did not always fill up toilet articles we used. Maybe the elevator could have room key locked, because anyone could during the day time walk strait in the hotel and take the elevator up to the rooms. Only in the evening the doormen was watching who was using the elevator, which was quiet nice and securing. But great staff around the hotel at all time and location could not be better. Next to a police station and felt to be a very safe neighborhood. We had a fantastic stay in New York and a great time at the Eventi, despite the small mishaps. Definitely coming back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to return trip”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGrl121
Reviews.Content: Initially had difficulty making a reservation as I was using a certificate I had previously purchased. However the reservation agent, think her name was Lorraine, made some calls and with Amanda's help was able to get us a room. When we arrived we we given a King room on the 21st floor with a great view of the Empire State building. Room was tastefully decorated with ample room to move around for the two of us. Loved the location, close to Penn Station, which made it easy to use the subway for transprotation. We had wanted to stay in the Chelsea neighborhood, away from Times Square on this trip and we were happy with the location. Only negative of the trip was the Bar Basque Restaurant, located in the hotel. We went there for tapas and drinks. The drinks were tasty, but the tapas were a disappointment. We tried some of the croquettes, the wild mushroom and the suckling pig. Each plate had 4 bite size pieces, expected a little more for the price, even if it is New York. Couldn't find the pork in the suckling pigs ones and the mushroom ones tatsed like they had cream of mushroom soup in the center, not very appetizing. The atmosphere was nice however and staff friendly. Looking forward to a return trip to further explore the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: KD1956
Reviews.Content: Many of the Eventi's reviews state the same qualities of a stylish hotel with super service and situated in a great location, which is all true. My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Eventi, the staff made us feel like family. All the staff were great but special praise goes to Omar and Victoria for spending extra time with us make sure we had a great stay in New York. Also Stephen McCollum the bellman was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren F
Reviews.Content: Omar and the staff were very helpful and took extra good care of my husband and I. The hotel was centrally located, which was very convenient. We will be staying there again for sure. - Lynne and Aaron

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: Rover10
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in the Chelsea area and Expedia offered a good two night rate on the Eventi. The hotel is a pretty new 24 floor tower. Our room on the 18th offered good Manhattan views and, above all, peace away from the street noise. The peace can be interrupted by fellow guests returning late and letting the room door close with a resounding bang - the doors are fitted with very effective closers (haven't they heard of soft close?). That apart, it should be possible to enjoy a good night's sleep. The Queen/Queen room was fine with very comfortable beds although the bathroom lacks a bath and in its place has a very large walk-in shower. Staff were efficient and pleasant without being outstanding. Maybe the newness of the hotel contributes to what, for us, was a lack of atmosphere and character. For leisure travellers there is the drawback that the area around the Eventi is pretty uninspiring with streets full of wholesale garment and accessory outlets. There is a distinct lack of decent cafes and restaurants in the immediate vicinity and it is some distance to any tourist attractions of note in any direction - to put it succinctly, the Eventi is a very pleasant but not outstanding hotel in a Manhattan desert, If you go I doubt that you will be disappointed, equally you may not be inspired.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lauren R
Reviews.Content: Overall fantastic trip. The staff was excellent-extremely helpful and kind. The location was perfect. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was better than expected. The hotel and room was very clean. The accommodations could not have been better! They had a dog bed and food/water bowls in the room as they were aware we would be traveling with a dog. The view of the Empire State Building was incredible! Everything about Eventi goes far beyond expectations of a high quality hotel! Thank you for making this trip amazing!

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: beachvolleyballer123
Reviews.Content: just wanted to give this hotel and company a big thumbs up for there handling of our stay during the hurricane. The wen above and beyond to even having breakfast lunch and dinner catered in. The rooms are nice and overall it is a cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: Daddybobo
Reviews.Content: The staff was great! Thanks Omar and team, we will be back. From the time we arrived from a hectic trip into the city, everything was great, easy, and helpful. Just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Familygdl
Reviews.Content: We were very much looking forward to our 7 night stay after the reviews on TA (we stayed early Sept). However the hotel did not live up to expectations; hence my ramble below. Good: kimpton in touch program (free wifi; $15 minibar voucher); location (easy access to transport and Macy's/shops, good restaurant options around, convenience stores nearby, food parc downstairs with good outdoor terrace to relax & have a beer) and comfy bed. Bad: service. From the moment we arrived late in the evening the reception was not warm - it felt put on; unlike the other 4 hotels we stayed at during this trip, the eventi staff did not say hello as we came and went even on one night when we arrived home very late and there was only us and the reception person (she never even looked up). The doormen were often chatting between them as we walked through but not to us. We were there 7 nights and were fairly recognisable with a kid in tow - I did not feel welcomed here unlike all other places we stayed at. Housekeeping was poor - I requested the turn down service for the sofa bed - it didn't happen after 2 requests so I gave up. They overlooked doing the room one day and the first response to me when I queried this was to blame me that I'd left the don't disturb on (I hadn't). Toiletries were also rationed. I asked about a laundry and was told the nearest was on 23rd - there is in fact one on the same block (30th/7th). The car to the airport didn't show - did they really book it for us? The photos on the website are a little deceiving - the rooms are smaller than expected and dark. I'm still keen on the Kimpton brand although this one did not meet their usual exccellent standard and particularly the firendliness of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WashParkD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in early September and had a great one night stay! We were celebrating our 10th Anniversary and we were given a room upgrade. When we arrived in the room there was champagne, chocolates and a personal congratulations card from the hotel. The hotel made us feel welcome and appreciated. The rooms are very modern and clean with a high degree of comfort and design. The staff was friendly and the location was great. I stay in hotels 50+ nights a year and this was one of the best stays that I have ever had! This is one of the top 5 hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: deblouise
Reviews.Content: We had lovely stay here location is great room is lovely modern big for being new york. Definitely will be going back here staff were excellent especially kirk. Only stayed 4 nights wish it was longer.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: return06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eventi for our wedding anniversary just to see NY and stay near Times Square. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. A little pricey, but that is comparable to the area you are in. The service was great, the rooms were exquisite, marble shower was great. They even provided us champaign and chocolates for us to celebrate our day! We looked at other hotels, and saw complaints about elevators and possible bed bugs, but none during our visit. The exercise fascility was perfect for what I need to get done daily. Its a definate recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: MacSasha
Reviews.Content: As New York hotels go, this is far from being over-priced and it's modestly comfortable. Beyond that, there is little to recommend it. The bed was comfortable enough, the housekeeping rather patchy (two huge palm prints remained on the window throughout) and the room lighting was rather inadequate. We had booked a suite, their most expensive option - and yet, where one would normally expect to find the complementary spring water stood two bottles priced at $5 and $7. While perfectly tolerable, New York City has far more interesting options which I suggest you explore if utter mediocrity is not your thing.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get in at a decent price, it's worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Arachnphile
Reviews.Content: Typical of a Kimpton, the place was somewhere between fancy and casual, somewhere between expensive and reasonable, and somewhere between upscale and average. Plusses for cleanliness, the service and staff, and the niceties (like the bedding and the pretty bathroom fixtures). Minus for a slightly high price compared to other lower Manhattan places--maybe I just picked a bad time to go. I wasn't thrilled with the location, but I was there for night-time outings to restaurants and bars (it's just a block east of Madison Square Garden).

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend's 30th B-Day Weekend = Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Yanni0324
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for anyone wishing to treat their girlfriend to a special weekend (birthday, engagement, etc.). Allow me to describe why: 1) The staff at the Eventi was both very courteous and friendly. I had alerted them in advance that I would be arriving from Montreal to celebrate my girlfriend's b-day. When we arrived at the front desk, Omar wished my girlfriend a happy birthday before we even exchanged one word. Omar, you are the best. Your timing couldn't have been better! Second, on that same evening, we were greeted in our room by a gentleman who brought two champagne glasses, a box of chocolates, and a nice bottle of bubbly. No, not the cheap kind either. Did I mention that he also brought a beautifully enveloped letter with b-day wishes? Needless to say, this was extremely appreciated. Finally, Omar was kind enough to upgrade us to the 22nd floor overlooking the city...absolute bliss. 2) The hotel's amenities were top-notch (Etro soaps, gels, and hair products; nice gym facilities with the latest cardio machines) as was the complementary wine hour on the terrace, the latter which is on the 5th floor, beautifully furnished and giving gorgeous views of the city (incl. Empire State Bldg). Hipness factor indeed. 3) Location: The hotel is centrally located and every cool neighborhood is easily accessible by foot or subway (on 28th Street). I hope that potential travelers will find this review useful. I will no doubt return to a Kimpton hotel and urge others to do so. You will not regret it! Kimpton InTouch Member 100816601

Reviews.Title: “best part of my trip!”
Reviews.Author: Bikramgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. I recently returned from a 2 night business trip, and quite seriously the Eventi was the best part of my trip. It's gorgeous, impeccably clean, and the staff are very nice. Also the bed was unbelievably comfortable. Go!

Reviews.Title: “Eventi is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay (Sept 15-18). What a beautiful hotel. The room was great, the staff were all very helpful and friendly and the location can't be beat (2 blocks from Penn Station and central to everything). Take a walk over the the High Line (about 4 or 5 blocks) and experience a great urban NYC path/park above the city. Walk a short distance and experience Eataly. Amazing food and dining. Jump on the subway close by and get anywhere quickly or cab it from this central spot. Wine hour on the hotel patio is great. Also, no bedbugs. Very clean. Checked all the reports/sites. Well done Eventi.

Reviews.Title: “What a event to be at Eventi!”
Reviews.Author: Tete C
Reviews.Content: I'm a journalist and TV anchor from Buenos Aires. Due to my work, I usually travel around the world and stay in luxury hotels. This time I was in New York covering Fashion Week, but I never wanted to leave the hotel! I felt so confortable! Now back home I miss that heavenly bed! Decor and service were supreme, I enjoyed all the facilities, from the gym at early hours to the friendly happy hours at your unique terrace. I reccomend to anyone who wants to compensate the craziness of New York with the homy and warm feeling at a hotel, to stay with you guys at Eventy. Thanks to everyone, from room attendants to management, for being my home away from home. Teté Coustarot

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toomanytrainers
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent rooms, great facilities, good gym, especially enjoyed the complimentary early morning Yoga class run by Terrance.

Reviews.Title: “Prime spot.”
Reviews.Author: Raybwf
Reviews.Content: i go stay here often when I am in town on business. Great staff and awesome rooms.

Reviews.Title: “More than pleased would definitely return..”
Reviews.Author: GemmaBusinessFinder
Reviews.Content: Myself and mum visited the hotel for a long weekend at the beginning of September and were really impressed. We chose the hotel because of all the good reviews on Trip Advisor and felt it deserved another good one! The room we had was 1705 a city king room I think its called on the 17th floor it was and the views of the city and the Empire State from the floor to ceiling windows were fantastic! The bed was HUGE and very comfortable and we had plenty of space in the room unlike most NY hotel rooms I understand. Staff were helpful. Location - near to Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens and 2 mins walk from Macys. Great Midtown location. Gym was nice, choice of snacks in minibar great, lovely toiletries too. Liked the water station in reception and free wine tasting every day at 5pm Choosing this hotel really made our stay in NY special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eml012881
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel with a near perfect location in New York. I found it centrally located to most of the restaurants I wanted to try as well as close to the subway. My suite was so comfortable I didn't want to leave! I also have to give the staff a ton of credit, it was a very busy weekend but they were extremely helpful with theatre tickets and recommendations on where to go. I am a loyal Kimpton fan and would quickly jump at the opportunity to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hate to stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: ckf62
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Manhattan. Perfect location, rooms are exceptionally nice and free tea (Mighty Leaf) in the morning. Again, good customer service is imperative and the Eventi provides it. Free internet service if you are a Kimpton member, which is easy to do. Also, love Kimpton's raid the mini-bar for members, saves on a couple of snack purchases.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to mostly just ok”
Reviews.Author: smaactraveler
Reviews.Content: I generally do not leave too many reviews, despite the fact that I do travel quite extensively. I stayed at the Eventi based on a family recommendation and followed up with reading the reviews here. I had a huge concern over the bed bug issues associated with many of the hotels in NYC. for this trip. I had narrowed my choice to either the Four Seasons or the Eventi. I choose the Eventi because of the reviews, and the slight cost difference, as I knew I was pretty much only going to be at the hotel to sleep and change clothing, This was a mother-daughter shopping trip. So the good about the Eventi: valet parking was great, hotel staff was wonderful, both in accommodating our needs, booking theater tickets, recommendations, etc. Parking was free with our rate. The ok: neighborhood was just ok at best. The room, ahhh the room--not what I expected. First, when we entered the room I was really taken back by how beat up our room looked. Chipped and nicked furniture, dingy curtains (they had that greasy feel curtains get when dirty). For a hotel just over a year old, the room was not in great shape. Upon opening the mini bar to place a drink in, we found an old carton of milk, obviously someone bought and left. And when we went to use the bathroom, there were still magazines on the floor in the potty room. I immediately called the front desk, and they did move us. But it did take a little bit better than an hour to make the move. I was pretty annoyed as we had plans to meet someone at a certain time, but wanted to get settled in the room and put away some items that I needed to place securely in our room safe. I was just about to check out (had already called the Four Season who had the availability), when they came and moved us. They did apologize and sent a bottle of wine to the room with a nice note. Booked an executive one bedroom suite--small and VERY DARK. They went way too far in the atmosphere department, and in the evening you can't see a thing in the room. Also, I would have expected their suites to be a bit higher up in the building. The bathroom was ok, potty in a separate room, but the shower is open, so while the bathroom is fine for couples, it isn't great for ladies traveling together. They saw we had three in our party, yet I still had to call downstairs to have them make the sleeper sofa. The second night, when returned to the room late, I expected that it would have been pulled out and ready for us, however it wasn't and we just moved all the pillows from the sofa ourselves and pulled out the bed. Perhaps I expect too much, but for almost $1350 for two nights, I do expect a bit more.(Had I choose to stay at the Four Seasons, the difference would have been another additional $475 for the two nights--wondering if I should have just went with that option) As I said the staff was great, but the rest was ok at best. Not sure I will return here.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice rooms and good price”
Reviews.Author: rosabcn
Reviews.Content: We went in June 2010 with a 6 months old baby and had a very pleasant stay. We were upgraded free to a better room as there were empty rooms. Did not see the room we initially booked, but the upgraded one was very nice and comfortable, with views of the Empire State Building. My only complaints: We found a lost t-shirt behind a chair, from the previous guests, and we were charged from the mini-bar and we haven't take anything, but they solved it immediately I must say. The rest was just about perfect, also the size of the room (beeing a NY hotel). Would return to that place, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A second stay at Eventi - still pretty cool here! (but sporadic mobile phone service)!”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeFrappe
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Eventi, and there so many things to really like about this hotel. I'm a big Kimpton fan anyway, and their service and rooms are very consistent -- and lean toward the high-end. This hotel has very good size and very clean rooms, larger than the norm in NYC. The bathrooms are also clean, spacious and modern, and since this is a relatively new hotel, they feature big, walk in showers and high-end amenities, including a lighted make-up mirror (thank you!!!). I love the desk, free wifi, and stylish decor. This hotel also has an incredibly cool tapas restaurant that feels like you are on a spaceship (really), and a super-sized outdoor deck, which is also a rarity in NYC. It's perfect to bring your wine here during the famous wine / happy hour and enjoy the New York sunset view. One thing I noticed on this second visit....The AT&T mobile signal is NOT good at this hotel. Beware. If you really need cell service while in your room, I would recommend asking at the front desk for a room that has a good signal. (One of the staff told me that one side of the hotel has better service.) I know NYC does not have the best signal, so I'm sure that plays a part. Still, it's not the best situation when you are trying to connect with a client or friend and you can't call them. Otherwise, a great hotel & close to the subway which is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Sexy!!”
Reviews.Author: TokyoJoe
Reviews.Content: Eventi is a Kimpton chain purposed built hotel built about 2-3 years ago, located in Midtown, 6th Avenue, a short 10-12 minute walk to busy Times Square. Upon arrival, check in was quick and efficient. Our double queen room located on the 20th floor offered a nice westerly view of the city. Rooms have a classy feel, a little bit on ths small side, but equipped with minibar, large LCD TV, clock radio with IPOD docking station, safe, floor to ceiling glass windows and super comfy beds. Continental breakfast served on the 2nd floor is just about adequate for our needs. Also tried the futuristic themed Bar Basque on same floor one evening but closes at midnight the night we were there. The free happy wine hour, a Kimpton trademark is a nice touch and served on the 5th floor verandah or lobby. There is also free internet access to check in and print out boarding passes on the 4th floor, normal use offered for a small fee. Did not try the gym but seems well equipped. All staff very friendly and pleasant, so thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. The adjoining FoodParc on the ground flooor is also well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Boutique Hotel for a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: SBLAW
Reviews.Content: We got a great room rate through Magellan Vacations. The room was "large" for NYC standards (325 sq ft). Everything was done nicely in the room. Only complaints: 1. could sometimes hear noises from other rooms 2. because the hotel is small, the staff is also small in number....which means you sometimes have to wait to be helped. 3. shower was not ideal because it is open and without a door. This means no privacy if others want to be in the bathroom at the same time and also can be cold. Positives: 1. staff very nice and helpful 2. located in area that is close to many bars, clubs, nightlife 3. nicely decorated hotel 4. good room rate compared to other hotels 5. wine hour even though we never went 6. very dog friendly...you can bring your dog and there are no charges/fees

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond, excellent :-)”
Reviews.Author: Clisle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi- before during and after hurricane Irene. The service, rooms, staff, food were always excellent. However during the hurricane, things went to another level, it was clear from the start that they had been fully prepared. They were calm and made sure everyone had what they wanted, not just what they need! The staff ended up staying all weekend and couldn't have done any more for you. When I return to New York- I will always stay @ the Eventi xxx

Reviews.Title: “Friendly with relaxed sophistication”
Reviews.Author: California-SLC
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our recent stay at the Eventi. We had chosen this hotel because of its proximity to Penn Station, as we wanted to use the LIRR to go to the US Open matches. The area in which the hotel is located is OK, but not exceptional--some of the streets looked a bit sketchy, but we never felt unsafe even when walking back from Penn Station late at night. It's an easy walk to Penn Station or Herald Square. Although I had mixed feelings about the surroundings, the Eventi itself was wonderful. Every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful, our rooms were clean and well organized, and we loved the complimentary coffee or tea in the morning and the wine reception on the 5th floor veranda. After some busy days watching tennis and sightseeing, Eventi was the perfect place in which to relax and sleep!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Experience Like No Other”
Reviews.Author: GaudiofBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Let me first start out by stating that I do not normally leave hotel reviews on trip advisor, but I was compelled to because of the quality of my stay at Eventi. I was in NYC for a three day business trip and Kimpton hotels were recommended to me by a co-worker. Thank goodness i took her advice. This is one of the most eye appealing hotels there is in New York city. I'm not sure if I've ever stayed in a place that made me feel classy and as comfortable as I would be at home. The staff was extremely helpful every time I asked for anything and they can definitely recommend some of the best restaurants in the area. All of the hotel facilities are on par with the best hotels i've stayed in and they even offer a free nightly happy hour on their veranda which is the perfect way to begin unwinding for the evening. I can't say enough about this hotel and I can't wait for my next business trip to NYC because I'll definitely be staying at Eventi!

Reviews.Title: “The stay exceeded our expectations in most ways . . .”
Reviews.Author: White2tn
Reviews.Content: This was my gay bff and I first experience with a Kimpton Hotel, courtesy of a groupon like deal which gave me two nights including taxes at an exceptional rate. We arrived early and stowed our luggage while we went and explored the city, I found the staff to be very welcoming and accommodating. Eventi, certainly lives up to its 4-star boutique hotel rating with one of the most sumptuous and seductively inviting lobby and common areas I have ever seen in a hotel. Modern, chic, unique, and most importantly functional. When we returned a bit early from exploring we were happy to find that our room was ready an hour early. The attendant gave us a brief orientation to Kimpton properties; the free happy hour, Saturday nightclub (free entrance, front of the line for guests) and hotel amenities which was nice. We had a King room on the 10th floor with floor to ceiling windows looking out over Ave of the Americas. There was ample controls in the room to control the dimness of the lights, it was perfect for us but I would imagine some older or hard of seeing guests might think the rooms to be a tad dark. The rooms were slightly above average in size for Manhattan though equally luxurious and modern, with high thread count sheets, soft mattress cover, and thick comfortable duvets.
