There was a wall-mounted flat screen TV with more channels than typically offered, in particular LOGO a nod to the chain's gay friendliness and HBO. There was the free internet with Kimpton intouch. Eventi had a nice workout room with fresh fruit, complimentary towels, built-in cardio TV, and lots of clean functional equipment. By far the nicest hotel gym I have ever come across. However, the cardio equipment is placed in front of those floor to ceiling windows, and under BRIGHT fluorescent lighting which makes it super hot while working out. The room is air-conditioned but they may want to consider fans pointing at the cardio equipment that guests can use if needed. Staff was friendly but not overbearing. Provided some good brunch recommendations nearby. Complimentary happy hour was to die for. Nice selection of sangria, wine, and beer served in the lobby for an hour. Hotel was walking distance 5 min to subway and Penn Station. Maybe 10 minutes to Times Square ,15 to the theater district. 5 minutes in the other direction got you to the heart of gay Chelsea, with bars, cafes, and boutiques. Property was very safe obviously, first night when returning at a late hour despite the lobby still being buzzing they requested to see our room keys to make sure we were guests. Recognized me the second night so didn't bother which was cool. The only nitpicking I can do is that the iHome clock radio and charger on the nightstand didn't work. Small detail but significant when the hotel sets the bar as high as Eventi does. I was okay with the $0.49 charge per page to print however I thought $6.95 for 15 minutes on the computer in the business center was a bit exorbitant. Eventi has a minibar in the room, which is great, but stuffs it full of their own overpriced products. Therefore there is little to no room for water and things you bring in yourself. Lastly, I heard, MUCH, more road noise from the 10th floor than I would have expected in a hotel this new. Same goes for the shudder of the air-conditioning switching on and off through the night. Neither of these prevented me from sleeping but they were noticeable. I would certainly return, and the hotel wasn't a bad value even without the coupon. I look forward to trying more Kimpton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, very close to the theater district. Room: We were on the 22nd floor. The view was fabulous ($15/day extra for an Empire State Building view). The room was clean and neat. There was a constant rattling noise in the walls, probably from people opening and closing water pipes. Water did not leave the sink. You would not expect this for $300 per night. A good night sleep should be guaranteed. Service: Good but not great. I had to check the bill for improper charges. It took three trips to the front desk to have the bill explained. The staff talked on the phone while speaking with me. The room service was professional, no complains there. Other: There was a complimentary wine served around 6pm in the lobby. Nice touch. There was no coffee machine in the room, and I just learned from other reviews that there was a coffee downstairs? I ordered a room service instead. In summary, I can't see how is this hotel any different from other chain hotels which are rated with three stars. Maybe my expectations were set too high after reading so many good reviews. Another helpful review which I agree with is from Registered_Traveler April/10/2011.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Neighbor”
Reviews.Author: gran208
Reviews.Content: Just out our window was the Empire State Building, a beacon to guide us back each night. The staff was friendly, the rooms impeccably clean and comfortable. The elevators were quiet, smooth and available. The decor was attractive, fresh and inviting. The location is convenient for traveling around the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: When my wife turned 50, I wanted to show her a special weekend in NYC. I originally chose Eventi because of the midtown location, and because of the reputation of the spa. We got more than we had hoped for. Omar at the front desk checked me in. When I told him about my desire for a special weekend, he helped direct me to a luxurious 1 bedroom suite on the 19th floor with a fantastic view towards the east and the Empire State Building. The marble bathroom with jacuzzi was functioning artwork. The lighting was adjustable to create the desired mood in any of the rooms. Omar even sent up a complimentary bottle of wine for the birthday girl. The following morning, my wife was pampered at the spa. The spa treatment was excellent. It's easy to spend a lot of money in NYC, it's nice to get something special at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Terina M
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying there. The hotel was FANTASTIC!!!! and we will be back next year. Some of the best sleep I've had while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous customer service during hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: Pam6411
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were very grateful for the service provided during hurricane Irene. They provided free meals for two days for all their guests, other hotels were not doing this as we talked to other friends staying during the same time period. We were also impressed with how prepared they were and keeping us all informed on what the emergency plans were. Disaster aside, the rooms were very nice, great bathroom and modern decor. The location is perfect, very close to Penn station, easy walking distance to Times Square or Greenwich Village. We walked all over, north to Central Park, and south down to Little Italy. Kimpton hotels always offer premium service and this location gets high marks from us.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the Eventi!”
Reviews.Author: sunny-singh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and it coincided with Hurricane Irene. The hotel and staff were brilliant. As it was our room was lovely and had a view of the Empire State Building. The hotel were excellent during the hurricance putting on free breakfast, lunch and dinner for all staying there. I would return for sure whenever i am next in New York

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton- you have me hooked”
Reviews.Author: feex_1
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in a Kimpton and we're hooked. We chose the rate which included parking and found it to be an EXCELLENT value for NYC. If you do, make sure you pull up to valet and not into the garage. Otherwise you may spend an hour getting around the block to valet. Service was great. The staff at the front desk were helpful and pleasant as was the valet driver. He really took the edge off after the aforementioned hour drive around the block. A few days before the stay we received an email offering a room upgrade for very reasonable prices, if available, at check in. The room was on an upper floor and had a beautiful view. Most importantly- NO bedbugs. The beds were sublime. We had no issues with noise or any complaints for our stay but a couple we were traveling with did have some issues with noise in the room next to them. Apparently they could hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mdsport61
Reviews.Content: My family and I did a 3 day trip to NYC. I have stayed at Kimpton brand hotels in the past. This one opened not too long ago, so I thought I'd give it a try. First, the staff is extremely customer oriented & friendly. Second, free wine from 5-6 on the terrace. Third, clean and spacious. Typical pricing for NYC, but the experience is fantastic. High value...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: LKG_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this hotel for ourselves and our guests during our wedding weekend - which also happened to be when Hurricane Irene hit New York. We could not have imagined how great the hotel would be in light of everything. Although the restaurant/bar had to be closed due to a lack of deliveries, the hotel itself was incredibly accommodating, had food, drinks, everything, ready for all the guests throughout the two days that the city was basically shut down. The sales team and all of the staff were super helpful, and were able to give people late check outs or extra nights if their flights/trains were canceled, etc. And on top of it, the rooms were great. The beds were super comfortable and the bathrooms are fantastic. I couldn't have picked a better hotel and will definitely be a huge fan of the Kimpton Hotels from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: eilefour
Reviews.Content: We loved the Eventi Hotel in New York. Everything about it was first class. The location was great, the rooms were nice, the beds were comfortable. The staff was very helpful and everything was just right. I highly recommend this hotel for visitors to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent address in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: usagerdumonde77
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights. The hotel is conveniently located. The staff was really friendly and gave us complimentary champagne and chocolates on our arrival since I had mentionned it was our anniversary. They also have a daily complimentary wine tasting at 5 PM. The rooms are not big (it's NY) but well decorated and the marble bathroom was great. We had a top floor room with view of the Empire State Building and the city which was worth the price. It's not cheap but you get a very good value for your money and this is a great address to stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: AI0n
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from everywhere in Midtown, excellent service and comfortable quiet rooms. Great for couples or business people looking for a place to stay while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cobaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2011. Every staff member - from reception/check in, doorman, room service staff - were extremely professional and courteous. I really enjoyed the drinks in the lounge area in the afternoon - it was a nice way to unwind and meet new people. Great location. Great facilities. Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: Edsmum984
Reviews.Content: We had a blast here. As we wanted one of our rooms to be a twin for our boys, they were upgraded to a suite and they haven't shut up about it since! Outstanding position on 6th Avenue, with views of the Empire State and a short walk to the subway (and from Penn Station, where we arrived from DC). The staff were without fail fantastic. We ate in Bar Basque, feeling very Wiltshire amongst a rather glam New York crowd, and the waiter couldn't have been more welcoming. This meal is one of the highlights of our whole trip, just for the experience although the food was also fabulous. New York is exhausting and exhilarating at the same time, and every time we fell through the lobby door we immediately felt relaxed. The rooms were great and the beds blissfully comfortable. Our corner room overlooked 6th Avenue and the Empire State so had great views. This was our last stop on a long and busy trip and was a great end to our holiday. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great amenities, Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: YYZDesign
Reviews.Content: The Eventi is the second Kimpton hotel that we have stayed at. The first was 70 Park Ave, which is a slightly different style of hotel, but no less friendly, with great amenities. The room we stayed in at the Eventi was the King with city view. The washroom was a nice marble floored and tiled room. The only issue was that the floor was quite slippery. Due to the design of the shower, which is open to the rest of the bathroom, water tends to get pretty much all over the bathroom if you are a messy showerer! The rooms were clean beds were well appointed with nice linens, double curtains, individual climate control (a little noisy) and the lighting was variable and well done. Otherwise everything worked, and there were nice italian bath products provided. All the basic amenities were provided, including robes and a generous closet, safe and fridge. There is nowhere other than the bed and one chair to sit, so this definitely isn't a room to be hanging out in, but New York is not a place to hang out in your hotel room anyway! The location at 6th ave and 35th street is a few blocks from Penn Station and not far from any subway or bus. Shopping is limited around the area but since it's Manhattan nothing is very far away. The FoodParc restaurant on the ground floor is very handy and has a great variety of different types of cuisine at reasonable prices. There are lots of other food options in the area. The in hotel Spanish BarBasque restaurant is excellent as well. One of the best in hotel restaurants that we have experienced. There was a summer prix fixe menu on when we were there in August which was excellent value. Some may find the prices high, but the food was delicious and well prepared with decent portion sizes. The staff was very friendly and helpful with our 2 year old too! We didn't use the business centre or the fitness centre so we can't attest to the amenities there. I would definitely recommend the Kimpton to anyone, especially those looking for a premium hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - family friendly, fun, beautiful, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: hankpop
Reviews.Content: I was just at the Eventi with my family and we all had a great time. My 6 year old declared it to be a very family-friendly hotel. They had special backpacks and coloring books for my kids at check-in and kid-sized bathrobes in the room. The Eventi has a big screen (about one story tall) in the courtyard behind the hotel and Tuesday night was movie night. We all watched E.T. for free in the warm summer air. I can also recommend the spa. Shawnta gave me an amazing massage that got all the kinks out of my neck. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. Kurt showed us around our room and one of the concierges, Nika, gave us a special pass that allowed us to jump to the front of the ticket line and get a special gift (which was three big postcards) at the Empire State Building. The beds were super comfortable. The HD TV was great. I loved the floor to ceiling window. The rain shower head in the bathroom was awesome. There's a free wine hour from 5-6 and (when the weather is good) it is on the 5th floor veranda, which is a beautiful, comfortable, and fun place to hang out. There's also Sangria and lemonade, if you don't want wine. The "Food Parc" next door is good. They have super big pancakes, which made the kids happy at breakfast. It's is sort of like a fancy food court and sort of like a cafeteria. It's casual and the food is healthy, yummy and quick, which makes for a welcome change from eating slices of pizza on the go. I've got nothing bad to say and I'd go back in a heartbeat. I'm a Kimpton fan and this might be my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: Sheri12
Reviews.Content: Dear Shannon and Thomas, The Eventi makes its guests feel like family, and its staff exemplify professionalism. I can't thank you enough! You and the hotel staff have taken such good care of me. I just adore Jocelyn, Caitlyn, Colby, and Dwayne. They are superb. Great examples of Kimpton customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Muzzmania
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, contemporary surroundings and clean. Minimalist style and reasonably priced for a New York midtown/flower district hotel. Close to subways and Penn Station. Cheap 'Foodparc' for breakfast next door also. We even had a bed-bug check by a hotel beagle!....which didn't reveal any bugs. If I had to say anything, a minor irritation was that the service was sooooo attentive, even when we put the 'do not disturb' light on, we had a number of housekeeping knocks, phone calls and turn-down service requests from hotel staff. All good though. Highly recommended and will be looking to stay in other Kimpton hotels in future.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and will definitely be back next time in New York”
Reviews.Author: Bcychui
Reviews.Content: City view King room deluxe was smaller than I thought but overall cleanliness is very good and bed is very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Kitkatos123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. Kimpton hotels are known for top-notch service and the Eventi does not disappoint. The customer service here is, simply put, outstanding. Every staff member goes out of his or her way to ensure an excellent stay. They greet you at the door, at the desk and at the elevator, which adds a level of security as well that is reassuring. Wine reception is a lovely treat and we loved sitting with our wine on the verandah with a view of the Empire State Building. Very civilized! The rooms are gorgeous with cool, modern touches, great art and a sweet shower. First class all around. Location is perfect. We walked to Times Square, Greenwich Village and Chelsea Market, no problem. We will stay here again and we will recommend it to everyone we know traveling to NYC. Become an Kimpton member and enjoy the perks. Like them on Facebook for other bonuses. Love the Eventi and love the Kimpton chain!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but very clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great walking area and close to the empire state building. Clean rooms and a great bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but not Great staff"”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eventi for our first trip to New York..7 nights...First impression, very clean. We were told that the manager inspects all the rooms on a regular basis and I think I might have even seen "her" one day on our floor. I should mention that the bed was very very comfortable. I believe it had a feather top mattress topper which we are now looking into purchasing. I particularly liked the spacious bathroom, it was a nice surprise. So overall, the hotel is nice, in a fairly good neighbourhood, a short walk from times square and all kinds of stores. The only negative was one particular staff member which I found rude and cocky. (I think his name was Francisco or something to that effect). Gets a tip but doesn't even help my husband with our bags to the car. Maybe he thought he wasn't given enough... I know it's New York but c'moooooon...do they need a tip for cracking a smile or opening a door too?? what the heck...that got on my nerves and sort of ruined it for me. But hey that just may be our experience....for the most part the other staff members were nice and accomodating so if you're thinking of staying here....you'll have a nice time. just ignore the few "cocky" new yorkers that you may encounter...and yes there are a lot of them. have fun

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: mtnwanderers
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and loved everything about this hotel! The service was excellent, including good tips for restaurants and getting around, a specialty chocolates gift, and very friendly staff. Loved the wine hour and opportunity to sit on the roof top patio as well as the modern, hip feel to the place! We enjoyed a corner room with city views and were very impressed with the amazing shower, comfortable bed, and free wifi. Great central location and easy to walk to many areas, plus close to the subway and Penn Station for transport to Newark Airport by train; the public transportation options were easy. Highly recommend this hotel! Tip: Breslin at the Ace Hotel just a block away has an amazing breakfast menu!

Reviews.Title: “EVENTI IN NEW YORK IS THE BEST !!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul123C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi in August 2011 for 2 nights before flying back to the UK (after our cruise holiday to Bermuda). We booked the hotel based upon comments on Trip Advisor and this hotel should have a 100% excellent rating. We booked 2 double rooms (2 queen beds in each room) and we were located on the 22nd floor ( Brilliant views). The hotel location is great ( Near enough to Broadway, Attractions etc) but without the street noise from other hotels we have stayed at in the past. All the staff were excellent (advice on where to go, restaurants to eat in, front desk assistance plus the ease of the booking our airport transfer - You must use TRIBECA if you need a car transfer- Julian Peralta was such a nice man !!!) The wine tasting session on the balcony on the fifth floor is great - sipping wine whilst admiring the view in New York is something I will remember. Both rooms were spotless and the beds were SO COMFORTABLE !!! Brilliant bathrooms as well. This hotel is the BEST IN NEW YORK. Thanks Eventi.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: EddieP1706
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've felt compelled to write a review. I stayed at the Eventi for 5 nights earlier this month. After my experience there, I don't think I'll be able to stay anywhere else when I'm in NYC. The entire staff was warm, professional, and friendly. I had a few special requests, and they were accommodated immediately - in a cheerful and pleasant manner. The room was incredible - I had a City View King room - and the view was spectacular! Bathroom was huge. The location is perfect as well - far enough away from the Times Square crowds, but only a short walk away. The subway is also a few steps away. I'm a Kimpton InTouch member, so I got free WiFi - and it was the fastest WiFi I've experienced in any hotel. The fitness center was small but never crowded. I can't think of any complaints - other than the fact that my stay was too brief!

Reviews.Title: “The high-life in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Rooners
Reviews.Content: We used to live in NY, and we came back to visit after a year and chose this hotel based on a family recommendation. And what can I say...we loved it! The customer service was great right off the bat- they did everything they could to accomodate our needs. We needed an early check in- and we only had to wait an hour before they cleaned and readied the room for us. We needed a crib for our baby, and there was one waiting for us when we got in. We wanted nice views, and we got to stay on the 21st floor. One really useful feature for new parents- don't take my word on it, but I think the rooms might have some noise control. Our baby was bawling about 30% of the time and we were terrified that we'd land up on another reviewer's bad review. But when you step out and shut the (heavy) door, you hear it so faintly that it wouldn't be a bother at all. Also, people, AMAZING location. I know that midtown is touristy, but it's getting better. There's stumptown coffee on 29th and Broadway, and 7subs next to it. There's Birch coffee on 27th and Madison, and Wine30 on 30th and Madison. But also, theres the abundant subway lines in the Herald square station, like 2 blocks away! We thought we'd have to cab it a lot with our 6 month old, but subways are so close that they were easier!- Just a tip, if you have an infant, get a baby carrier.. a bjorn, and ergo, and Angelpack, what ever suits you. It's SO much easier not having a stroller when you have to deal with stairs everywhere. Back to the hotel- they have an AM coffee service which I have not tried, but I bet it's great! Also, there is a gorgeous veranda on the 5th floor, which I wish we knew about earlier. Such beautiful views. And the bed... oh the bed! I think it was the most comfortable thing I ever put myself on. It feels too soft and squishy at first and you're a bit skeptical, but when you wake up in the morning, you are so well rested. They even ask you for your preference of pillow- hard, soft, firm, blah blah. I've said enough. Go. (Oh- use your AAA card for booking discounts)

Reviews.Title: “This is now our go-to place whenever we visit NYC”
Reviews.Author: bigjpearl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AWESOME!!! I went with my wife, our oldest child (5-year old boy) and my my mother and stayed for 5 days. The rooms are spacious (by NY standards), CLEAN and modern. The staff was unbelievably friendly...accomodated most every need. The best was how sweet they were to our little boy. When we got to our room, they had bought a toy for him (a train...his very favorite). Unbelievable!!!! The location is good...just south of Times Square and right near the Empire State Building. We hit Times Square most everyday we were there. If you're a coffee snob like me, make sure you hit a place down the street called Stumptown (in the Ace Hotel). Excellent!!! Discard any negative reviews of this place...it is truly a wonderful place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel! My New- New York Must Stay At Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: Great newer hotel in the city. Decorated super chic and trendy. Loved the decor in the rooms. All the hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We walked into this hotel without a reservation because we didn't like the hotel we booked. They could of really got us on price, but instead they were super accommodating and because we they didn't have a room right away, it was 11 am, they upgraded us no charge. They have a free happy hour wine social every night between 4-6 in this really cool roof top lounge area... Great Sangria! In a word.. FABULOUS! It's my new "must" place to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Christina075
Reviews.Content: New and clean hotel in central manhattan, lots of metro stops near make it easy to go to the HIgh LIne or central park. Penn station allows you further a field. Bed very comfortable. I booked corner room via booking.com but when I got there I was in normal king but I explained and they upgraded me back to deluxe. Get eventi membership, which is free on line so you get free Internet and raid the mini bar. Don't open water in room or have breakfast as very expensive. Movies are charged for and a bit crackley but just tell front desk. I ate at Penelope brunch bar a few blocks away which was fab. It is in the business district so you do have to walk away from hotel to find nice restaurants etc. Room service dreadful as they got order wrong and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: ellengallagher
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to NYC, we were fortunate to spend the weekend in a lovely suite at the Eventi. This Kimpton property is absolutely gorgeous. In addition to hosting a truly relaxing, early evening cocktail hour (weather permitting on the 5th floor veranda), the Eventi maintains an immaculate, well-equipped fitness center and spa. We found the on-site staff incredibly gracious and committed to providing outstanding customer service. Thanks, in particular, to Caity Taylor, Dwayne Wilson and Brandon Scamfer who went out of their way to ensure our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “As Kimpton members, we've seen better.”
Reviews.Author: nmanning
Reviews.Content: My husband (a Kimpton member) and I traveled to NYC for a friend's birthday on August 5th and chose the Eventi hotel based upon recommendations and TripAdvisor. Our friends (with whom we were celebrating) were also staying at the same hotel. The hotel, overall, is satisfactory. Certainly, very chic and modern in its décor, very clean and the bed was comfortable. The view is outstanding. The doorman gave us great recommendations for pizza, breakfast, etc. We were, however, disappointed to learn that our friends (non-Kimpton members) were offered an upgrade for a nominal price. As such, they were placed on the 21st floor. Had we been offered the same upgrade opportunity, we certainly would've taken it and paid for it. In turn, we were placed in a room on the 9th floor that was adjoined to the room next door by an an internal door. Why we were given adjoining rooms, I'll never know. We didn't know the couple next door. The walls are paper thin. Needless to say, the couple next door would've been very embarassed to learn that we could hear their entire conversation, music and lovemaking. My husband's originally from New York and we travel to New York 4 to 5 times per year. As such, I'm thinking we may go with another hotel next time we're in town. It's a bummer, we're usually big Kimpton fans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eventi Experiences and would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: mamayagy313
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed July 2-July 8 at the Eventi. The location was wonderful! We were able to either catch taxi, subway or walk wherever we wanted to without any hassle. All the staff was very helpful and nice. We had slight problem with water leak in our original room and was transfered very quickly to a nice king suite with much apologies from everyone. The rooms are nice and modern and the bathrooms are the best I have been in! The rain shower head is awesome. My daughter liked to pretend it was her apartment. Not a lot for a child to do there, but having the food parc next door and a couple of good delis was a big plus as was the veranda. My daughter and I watched the fireworks from there on the 4th of July and the view of the Empire State Building in red, white and blue was very cool too! Really enjoyed watching the hustles and bustle below us on the streets from the serenity of the veranda.

Reviews.Title: “From bad to fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kurt1835
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business and chose this hotel for its location and design. However, my initial experience was not a good one. The hotel had "maintenance" issues and had overbooked. As a result they had to send me to a sister property elsewhere in the city. It was quite nice and they paid for my transportation expenses. They also had informed me that I would be upgraded to a suite for my inconvenience. The next day, I had been told that the previous quest had smoked in the room and it wasn't ready when I returned to check in. This, of course, was no fault of the hotel's. Adriana and her colleague (I forget his name) were extremely gracious and apologetic about the incident. The suite they gave was outstanding. They also sent bottled water and chocolates as a gift. They even went above and beyond when I realized I left my phone charger at home. Adriana's colleague took time out on his break and purchased a new charge on behalf of the hotel. Although my stay started badly, the level of service was outstanding. It's a beautifully designed, modern space. The rooms are extremely comfortable and stylish. A perfect spot for relaxing after a long day in the city. More importantly, is the amount of attention they give their guests. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharkdive1
Reviews.Content: Worth the money. The whole Kimpton group hotels offer a lot for the money. Rooms in general are larger than in other hotels, there is always complimentary coffee available in the morning and there is a wine happy hour in the evening in the lobby. The interior is very stylish, their restaurants offer a small, but very nice selection of food. Hint: sign to the loyality programme and you will get WIFI for free as well as a voucher of USD 15 to raid the mini bar. In addition, continental breakfast is often for free as well. Very, very friendly staff. Rare to find. Very stylish bar and restaurant The only thing we were missing was the pool. SInce it was very hot, an outdoor pool would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome refuge in NYC”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachTripper
Reviews.Content: I had to travel last-minute to NYC to attend a family funeral, and I needed a comfortable refuge from the stress, (and from the August heat, as well). I'd never stayed at a Kimpton hotel, but now I am a convert. The Eventi was, by and large, the best hotel experience I've had in NYC. I was booked in a King room, but was upgraded to a City-view King Deluxe Room at no charge. My view from the 16th floor was beautiful, with the Empire State Building looking magnificent from my floor-to-ceiling windows. The room was modern, but not cold. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the overstuffed pillows allowed me to sleep peacefully. The marble-floored bathroom was large, and the dual shower heads were an extra treat. The room was only about 300 sq. feet, which is larger than most NYC rooms. However, it never felt cramped. Every person with whom I had contact was friendly and professional. I've met some rude workers in some NYC hotels, but the staff at the Eventi went out of their way to make me feel welcome. The hotel has a free wine "happy hour" every day outside on their lovely 5th-floor terrace. While I only was able to attend once, the staff was friendly, and I met some nice guests while sipping wine and taking in the lovely view. If I'm going to quibble, the central-air conditioner was a bit loud in the room. When it was off, the room was so quiet that I never would have known I was in New York City. There was a mistake regarding the honor bar on my bill as I checked out, but when I mentioned it to the front desk, it was rectified immediately without question. When I return to NYC, or anywhere there is a Kimpton hotel, I will make it my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pvbbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We loved the room (a suite), the Frette linens, the rainhead shower, wine on the 5th floor terrace, coffee in the morning, the restaurant. Everything is new. We could walk up to Times Square (15 blocks) and down or across to Gramercy Park and Washington Square Park (about 20 blocks). I hate staying in Times Square and this was very convenient. Note, you have to walk 2-3 blocks to get to major retail, so it is different than staying near Central Park where you can fall out of bed and land in a Zara.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Very Clean and Comfortable! We will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: ATonnReview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eventi Hotel for our anniversary weekend and were extremely happy with the hotel. We called to let the hotel know that we would be arriving late, and they were waiting and so friendly as soon as we arrived. The room was really nice with a view of the Empire state building and was very clean. Bed was really comfortable, and for New York it was a good size room. Evening wine receptions were nice, but not open long. It would have been nice to be able to stay out on the patio at night. Only complaint was that the patio wasn't open at night and it was quite small. If you want a seat, arrive at the start of the reception. The other down fall is that there is nothing to eat after 10. For a city that never sleeps ... get your snack before you go back to the hotel! Overall, it was a really great stay and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmn
Reviews.Content: Love the Kimpton hotels and this one did not disappoint! Great location and helpful staff. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Eventi!”
Reviews.Author: rye_a
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Northern New Jersey for two weeks and my wife flew to NYC to meet me for the weekend. Based upon a colleague's recommendation we decided to stay at the Eventi, and we are so happy that we did! Every interaction that we had with the hotel's staff, from to the valet to the doormen to the front desk, was pleasant and professional. We booked a room on a high floor, and when we walked in we were awe-struck. The rooms are not huge (although the bathroom are big and well designed), but the beds face floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the city. Day and night, the view was stunning. The rooms were incredibly clean and well kept with modern decor. Other nice features to the hotel are free internet, wine hour and a mini bar credit ($15 in NYC) for Kimpton's frequent visitor members (I didn't even bat an eye when I heard my wife break the seal on a $15 can of cashews). The location is central and allows for walking all over the city (we walked 20 miles in 2 1/2 days), and is easy to find. All in all we could not have been happier with our stay at the Eventi and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and modern stay in mid-town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: vacationer1975
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying here for 7 nights in late July. The place is ultra clean and the service and the staff our great. We booked on expedia and got an upgrade to a room with a great view of the Empire State building and surrounding mid-town Manhattan (2109). Free internet if you sign up (for free) with the Kimpton hotel website (no problem). They hotel had a great happy hour between 5-7 pm every day with free sangria and wine and lemonade for my pregnant wife. Other little touches were nice as well such as the strawberry infused water that was always available in the lobby after a hot day in the sun. There was also a quasi-fast food place called FoodParc right next door (I think affiliated with the hotel) that was fantastic for breakfast (great quality food at a reasonable price) and always got things started for us everyday. Only down side was the lack of a pool (which is understandable I guess) but there was no sauna/steam room or anything like that which would have been great after a long day at the museums! The fitness center was small but pretty good (enough free weights and cardio to get a good workout if you were so inclined). The bar of the hotel is on the second floor (Bar Basque) which is a pretty pumping club on the weekends. It is not the kind of old-school bar in the lobby that some people might be used to. This is a modern hotel with a modern vibe and although it might not be for all tastes it definitely fit the bill for my wife and I. It's close to everything and only a $10 cab ride to everything. Good times.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2cruise98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the new Eventi Hotel over the past weekend. We were only staying for one night. The hotel was beautiful! The hotel was also within walking distance to a mall and Times Square. I would go back! Only draw back was that staying on the 21st floor we did not have any cell phone service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieKLN
Reviews.Content: Such a lovely property. Was more than expected. The staff are extremely helpful and welcoming. We stayed in room 709. The rooms are a bit small but was enough space for the 2 of us. The AC worked at all times was chilly during the night. Washrooms were so pretty, and clean. How ever the rain shower head is low on pressure. The beds were a bit soft how ever your so tired from walking at the end of the night you seem to pass out any ways. Mini fridge was stocked with drinks kinda pricey, there are lots of vendors outside that sell drinks for less. We got a view of the Empire State building which was a bonus. We did hear a bit of noise at night but nothing to crazy just a bit of honking. You do get free coffee/tea during the morning at the lobby and wine during the evening. What hotel does that now a days? Ice is only on 5th floor, how ever they will delivery it to you if needed. If you do sign up as a member on there website you can get free internet during your stay. =) This hotel is close enough of a walk to the subway just 2 blocks. mini blocks though when it comes to NYC. Must of took us about 15mins max to walk to Times square. So much to see and look at so it was a good choice of location. There is a hope on hope off city tour I believe its just a bit under $50 which is a good deal you get it for the whole day and there are multi stops and pick ups. We did a tour of the Central Park VIA those bike guys. The thing is it cost $95 for an hour and its just a tour around the park we got to stop off a few times and take pics but you dont see much. But if your lazy its worth it, the park is way to huge to walk on its own in a day. If you are driving, its such a short distance from the Lincoln Tunnel so you don't have to experience all the crazy NY driving. How ever valet parking is $50 a night. We did have a little confusion and didn't get our valet slip. Because of all the trouble we had to go to the garage and speak to the attendant there after 30 mins of sorting things out making sure we weren't lying and it was our car. But when checking out the valet staff recognized us and apologize for all the confusion and took a night off our bill which was extremely kind of him. Didn't expect that coming. Great customer service. Over all we did have a wonderful stay at the Eventi and would come back for another stay there some time in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: galvirgo
Reviews.Content: Just spent a wonderful weekend in New York City and stayed at the Eventi. I love Kimpton hotels and this one lived up to my experience in all others I have stayed in. Staff is friendly, bed was very comfortable and the shower was heavenly with a choice of standard shower head and a rainfall shower head. Location was a short walk to Union Square as well as to Eately.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: Sneakers23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first couples break away from the kids. I had previously stayed at the Eventi with girlfriends and found the hotel to be impeccable. Great rate, centrally located and our room had a wonderful view of the Empire State building. The rooms are very large in size relative to most in NYC. Easy access to the subway and walking distance of midtown, uptown and downtown. The concierge was wonderful handling all of our questions and booking our limo back to the airport. Free wireless and treats with the Intouch program was appreciated. Loved the wine hour and so did my husband. The only room for improvement would be the onsite restaurant which is still plagued by very slow service and an inconsistent menu. Would stay here again in a heartbeat, and have recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great welcome to New York”
Reviews.Author: Drjohnlondon
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and genuinely helpful staff, a cool and modern atmosphere, very central for Broadway/Theatre district (10 mins walk)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mother/Daughter NY holiday”
Reviews.Author: Zannish
Reviews.Content: Arrived about 11 am and was told room was not ready but were happy to upgrade my daughter and I to a superior king room on the 21st floor, corner room with a perfect view of the Empire State building. We loved the fact that so many attractions were close by and 2 subway lines close by. The staff at Eventi were very friendly and helpful. Wine time on the terrace was an excellent idea, coming from Australia we were able to mingle with American and OS travelers and talk about our travel adventures. Food Parc next door was excellent for breakfast and we loved the outdoor eating area. We also ate there for dinner one night. Overall an excellent experience and have already recommended this hotel to few people who are headed for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Please stop telling everyone about it!!”
Reviews.Author: SadTravellingOnMyOwn
Reviews.Content: Because if you don't It will be impossible to get a room next time you are in NYC! And how can you not love a hotel that has doggie bowls at the door? Very smart, very "hip" deor, just altogether.... very nice. Had an executive suite which was big enough for me and my bags, great bathroom, very comfortable bed and although it was super hot weather wise, windows that could actually open. What didn't I like? Security. It was disconcerting in a new hotel that the elevator bank is directly accessible to anyone off the street and so are all the guest room floors as key access to guest floors hasn't been installed and as a lone traveller, I did not like this at all. My only other gripe would be that although free coffee is on offer in the foyer in the morning, I'd have much preferred a coffee maker in my room especially as I normally wake at 5 and my first requirement in the morning is strong coffee!,. Other than that, everyone else's reviews says it all. But could we please stop talking about it because otherwise, my next reservation will no doubt be impossible!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Stormchaser40
Reviews.Content: We originally wanted to stay at The Muse as we had stayed there on a previous visit and is the sister hotel of the Eventi but unfortunately they were fully booked, how glad we were that the reservationist suggested the Eventi. When we stayed the hotel had only been open a couple of months and there were areas still being worked on but this in no way affected our stay. As the hotel was only recently open we managed to get in on a very reasonable opening offer rate, we're so glad we did as I doubt we would be able to afford to stay there once they are fully operational and only offering published rates. We have been to NYC a couple of times before but this trip was special as we were taking our two teenage sons with us for their first trip to the 'Big Apple'. The Eventi location and style was spot on for us. The decor is extremely stylish and the bedroom was lovely, we booked a suite which comprised a bedroom with lounge that had a sofabed for the boys. Beds were extremely comfortable, which you need after a day sightseeing! We ate in the restaurant on their fixed price menu, food was very good indeed and also good value for money. The roof top terrace is great, each evening they host a wine reception which is a brilliant way to start the evening. When we next visit NYC we will certainly be hoping to stay at the Eventi again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel wasn't expected much”
Reviews.Author: Senator1977
Reviews.Content: 7 nights in November 2010 King Deluxe Room with 1 King Bed fast check in and check out Room: Not really big but really not an issue. Super comfortable king size bed. Clean, Quiet and nice view. Lighting is good. Clean room. TV is big and has HD program. Nice. Bathroom: big compare to the rest of the room. Design is too cold, could have worked out something as this is not really welcoming (all white, no windows...). Everything worked fine (hot water, flushing....) Internet connection is one of the fastest i have ever experienced (download 5mega/second) and it is FREE, if you register to Kimpton in Touch never tried breakfast or lounge as in NYC u can find everything outside. Location is perfect for work. Going to meeting on foot is a great pleasure. Lot of shops Duane Reade and deli around. Overall, great hotel for business. Really impersonal, don't expect a word from anyone unless u ask something. At least this is my own experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: *Mark*J*L*
Reviews.Content: Eventi is a little away from the noise of Times Square and the cool of Greenwich and SoHo but everything you're likely to need in Manhattan is only a short walk or cab ride away. The facilities are great and the rooms are a good size. The bar and restaurant are achingly hip with great food and drinks (there's even a gin & tonic list!). The staff is excellent and people go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. I really like this place!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Another Kimpton success!”
Reviews.Author: travelinbug7
Reviews.Content: Being a Kimpton in-touch member, I try to stay at Kimpton hotels whenever possible. The Eventi did not disappoint. The location is central to just about everything. You can get literally everywhere by walking or taking the subways. The lobby area is subdued and sophisticated, but a tiny bit on the small side (but then again, it is New York). On arrival, we were upgraded to a suite with a nice view. The room was spacious, even by non-NY standards, and nicely done in a clean, modern decor. The bed was comfy and bathrooms were spacious. Toiletries were by Etro and smelled divine. The countertop space in the bathroom was lacking but we made do. The workout facility is nice and spacious with plenty of equipment for use. We were treated to a bottle of white wine and a box of chocolates for our anniversary--very nice touch. The daily wine hour is also pleasant--a great way to unwind and relax from a day of walking around the city. Would definitely return here for future NY trips.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: When we went to Eventi Kimpton Hotel in New York, we had high expectations, especially that the price of the room was quite high and we must say that it did not meet our expectations. It's just not good enough. The location is okay-ish (6th avenue and 30th street, not the best, and quite north of Chelsea, but hey, that's ok). The room is without cachet, just plain boring, half correctly cleaned. The service ranges from really bad (check in, check out, concierge, breakfast) to okay (doorman, cleaning staff). Breakfast is stupidly expensive and limited in choice and quality and is served in a horrible veranda that would depress the happiest camper on earth. The veranda is extremely cold, even if it's 40C/100F outside, which is ridiculous. Gym centre is okay, but for 4 persons only, otherwise it's overcrowded. Room service is completely random (room some times not made before 6pm after 3 calls to reception, shower curtains missing plastic half, drains stinking). Frankly, we're not going back. People told us this is a new hotel and we were expecting something better. Anyway, to be forgotten and it's not the daily free wine tasting on the terrace that will balance the negative side.

Reviews.Title: “The service and style you would expect form a Kimpton -- except for the stinky shampoo”
Reviews.Author: ejohnius
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Kimptons if possible because I know what I'm going to get with that brand. The bed will be comfortable. The hotel will be very clean. The staff is kind. The decor will be fashionable and fun. And, I thought, until I stayed at Eventi, that the toiletries would be good enough that you don't need to be saddled with your own shampoo and conditioner. Wow, was I wrong. Thank musky stuff at Eventi might be a "fashionable" choice because the bottles match the room but it made me sick to my stomach. It STINKS. I threw it out and went walking to the nearest drug store that night to buy something else. It's a minor complaint considering the value (and the view!) of the hotel. My only other gripe: Breakfast! It really would be lovely to have an easily accessible meal in the morning, but it's NYC. There's a Starbucks 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in the city. Of all the boutique hotels I have been in throughout Manhattan, this ranks as one of the best. The staff is great throughout. From the concierge, front desk staff, housekeeping, to management, everyone is friendly and professional. So rare to find in the city,,,,trust me. The vibe of the hotel really appeals to me. Its the Kimpton feel, and if you have never stayed in other Kimptons, you really should. The rooms are always well laid out, plenty of nice amenities, reasonably priced, and cleaned. Some people have commented that this was not in a great location, but I disagree. You are only a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building, a short walk from Rockefeller and Park, close to the Shake Shack in Madison Park, and near Bar Breton and Bloom's Deli, 2 of my favorite gluten free restaurants in Manhattan. The hotel is well lit (not like the super dark W hotels) and just has a nice comfy vibe without trying too hard. Give it a try! And,,,make sure you join the Kimpton In Touch program, as you get the internet for free :)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Eventi!”
Reviews.Author: mattaduncan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend around my birthday. THE BEST location in NYC. Close to everything, and also close to subway stations. I hardly ever write reviews, but this place really impressed me. The hotel is only a year old. Clean, modern, and very professional staff! If your looking for a great hotel at a reasonable price, STAY HERE! I will def. be staying here again! Check out Foodparc downstairs great cheap food! Also nearby is Eataly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbbCalif
Reviews.Content: Room: very comfortable bed, enormous bathroom, views of Empire State Building. Staff: excellent, knowledgeable, courteous and very helpful. Location: 1 block to starbucks for early morning coffee, 2 blocks to subway Herald Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in so many ways!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2080
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to NYC for a shopping get away weekend and had a great time staying at Eventi. We got a great deal online for a Executive One Bedroom Suite. Upon Check in, we were early so our room was not ready, they gladly stored our luggage so that we could enjoy the afternoon. We went for lunch and for a walk in Central Park, grabbed some Broadway show tickets and headed back to the hotel to check in and freshen up for the night. We arrived back at the hotel during wine hour, which is great. You have your choice or either red or white wine, after a long day of travel and after noon out it was a great treat to come back to. Check in took a bit longer than expected, they had someone inspecting the room to ensure it was clean and do final checks. Arriving at 5pm we thought this would have been completed...no big deal. The suite was perfect, a nice sitting area with separate bedroom and a great big bathroom with separate tub and open shower with dual shower heads, the rain shower head was quite nice! One issue my sister had with taking a bath (Which I never did try out the tub), it took at least 20-25 minutes to fill the bath and once it was filled the water wasn't as warm as she would have liked. They were going to send someone up to check on a few occasions, so a message was left for maintenance to check. Our room was stocked and always cleaned well. We tried the food parc a few mornings for breakfast. Great prices and the portions were perfect. The coffee was o.k...there is a starbucks just down the block if that's more to your liking. There is also a great place for coal oven pizza a short walking distance away....it was SOoo good!!! The location of the hotel we found to be very convenient to subway stations and walking distance to many amenities. Macy's flag ship store is a short walk as well as the amazing view of the Empire State building which we had a perfect view of from our hotel window. Madison Sq Gardens and Penn station are also very close. We took the subway and also did a lot of walking....A LOT of walking. So ensure you bring cozy shoes. Taxi's are also easy which we took a few evenings back to the hotel. Overall we had an amazing time at the hotel and in the city. What better way to finish off a long day of sight seeing, shopping etc than with a glass of wine daily!! Perfect in so many ways...

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful respite in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: TnB1882
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor, classy amenities, and a knowledgeable, helpful staff. Do not miss out on the afternoon happy hour out on the patio- it is an experience one could definitely get used to...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Manhattan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcescobar
Reviews.Content: What a great stay! From the friendly welcome of the bellhop to the helpfulness of the front desk to complimentary wine and lemon-infused water in the lobby, a perfectly comfortable and enjoyable stay! We are a family of four and had booked a room with two queen beds. When we arrived they offered us a free upgrade to a suite so that we would be more comfortable. The rooms are clean, clean, clean and extremely comfortable. We loved the beds! We needed help booking tickets to Ellis and Liberty Islands and the front desk took care of everything while we enjoyed the city. No request was denied. If they could do it, they did ... and with pleasure. We truly felt well taken care of and accommodated. One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time is a Charm”
Reviews.Author: CAScott
Reviews.Content: Actually, we've loved all four of the stays we've had at the Eventi in the past year, but the December trip was quite wonderful, with it's hot chocolate and holiday decorations in the lobby, cheery staff, and great views. Originally reviewed in the summer just after the hotel opened, we are glad to report the hotel has continued it's upkeep, the staff is as friendly as ever (do they send out a memo with our dog's picture on it or does everyone REALLY remember his name from stay to stay :-), and the location is pretty fantastic. We return on labor day weekend at the end of August, and look forward to another relaxing stay. In December we tried a late nightcap at the uber-sleek upstairs bar, where I could mortgage my house for a martini, but that is status quo in Manhattan (as it is here in DC). The drinks were phenomenol, the red reverberating color made me think I was in Berlin (as did the techno beat throbbing in the background.) We also loved the little food kiosk place that opened since our first stay. Not fancy, but served it's purpose for a quick snack or salad. We enjoy our new home away from home in Manhattan and hope to find everything in good stead when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Had high expectations, yet surpassed! Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: renatofalzoni
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kimpton hotel in San Francisco. Had such a good time that I decided to book Kimpton for this trip. I wanted something special because it was my 10th anniversary. I chose Eventi because it is more central than Ink 48 (both Kimpton in NYC). Let me tell you! I had the best time ever. You should stay there!!! Every detail was better than expected. The room had great views with floor to ceiling windows. From my room at the 22nd floor on the east side you could see beautiful moonrise and incredible view of the Empire State building. The room has very nice beds and bathroom with cool showers. The service was wonderful. Every single employ was polite, educated and nice. Members of Kimpton “In Touch” program get free Internet and U$ 15 of the minibar. And because I mentioned at reservation that it was my Anniversary we were welcomed with sparkling wine and strawberry. We asked the concierge where we could rent some bikes and what a surprise: the hotel has free bikes for its guests (with helmets and locks, one bike had bad brakes but I am sure it will be repaired). So my wife and me biked across the Brooklyn Bridge. A U$ 100 value for free. The hotel has (as all Kimpton do) Wine Tasting hour from 5pm to 6pm at the terrace. A nice opportunity to meet some of the other guests while drinking some nice wine. Although I try to stay at different hotels to know new places, it will be hard to stay anywhere else the next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angiebeans03
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful in every aspect of the word!! It was centrally located (2 blocks from Madison Square Garden & 3 1/2 from Times Square), the beds were very comfortable, the rooms were very large, and the staff was incredibly helpful. Every time I called down to the front desk or concierge they handled my inquiries with great urgency and treated me as though I was their only guest. Amazing job everyone on the Eventi staff. We'll definitely be staying here when we return to NYC in the winter. Thanks again:)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, professional.”
Reviews.Author: davetron5000
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Hotels have a reputation for having small rooms, but this one had a pretty decently-sized room and a HUGE bathroom. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't gigantic, but it had plenty of room for my Wife and I to stay for 3 nights. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful; we stayed here for our honeymoon and were greeted with a chilling bottle of champagne and some fresh fruit. Very nice. The room itself was very modern, clean, and well appointed. It had floor-to-cieling windows and a great view of the city. The hotel has a large balcony area on the 5th/6th floor which is surprisingly relaxing and a great feature when you are tired of a zillion crazy New Yorkers. The location is pretty convenient to a lot of places, including subway lines. The price is decent for NYC; we've certainly paid more and gotten way less, but it's not super cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MITripGirl
Reviews.Content: Definitely enjoyed staying here. Was in a great location for walking-many stores, including Macy's - was only a short walk away. Room was a good size and very clean. Bathroom was large. Had great service from the hotel staff as well. Would definitely stay here again, as well as recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway!”
Reviews.Author: jedgar0314
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Clean, modern and comfortable in every way. Beds and pillows were awesome. Bathrooms great-showers rock. Lobby/Bar/: Fun, clean, modern-great atmosphere. Green Theme: They make excellent efforts to conserve energy, water and recycle. It's subtle and it makes you think. Free wine on the terrace every night, it's relaxing and actually excellent wine. Staff was incredible. Shout out to James in Security and Julien at the Concierge. We were in town for a bachelorette party. Upon arrival we had champagne in our rooms and James took care of us at night. Even sending up OJ and fruit on our last morning. Best bang for your buck. If you have "champagne tastes on a beer budget", stay here. You'll get your fix! I won't stay anywhere else in NYC. Plan to stay at a Kimpton whenever I can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of New York - we will defo be back!”
Reviews.Author: Julie471
Reviews.Content: Don't normally write reviews but felt I had to with the Eventi Kimpton. First off, I am fussy about hotels - really fussy. I like them stylish/boutiquey, clean, quiet and efficient. So I am pleased to say this was a great experience from booking right through to staying at the hotel. Staff on arrival were welcoming and courteous - we were upgraded to a suite - with a nice little voucher to use in the mini bar - a welcome treat after a long journey. On the next night a little surprise arrived - some lovely pink lemonade on ice and boxes of chocolate cookies for the kids - with a handwritten note to say welcome. The room was spacious, extremely clean, nice toiletries and very comfy large bed. View was fantastic. This hotel is a 10 min walk from Times Square - so really convenient. Wine hour in the lobby was fab - we took our drinks to the terrace - amazing views and lovely area to sit out and enjoy New York. We were on the 23rd floor and there was no noise from other rooms or from traffic below - so nice and quiet - we really could relax after a hard day touring the city. The food parc next door is an interesting concept - and the food we had there was excellent - altho it takes a bit of practice to order and there is no wine available - altho there is a beer bar!! The hotel restaurant served up some very interesting dishes - all food was excellent, altho it wasn't as Spanish as I expected - nevertheless we had an excellent night dining there. All in all I cannot stress what an enjoyable experience it was staying at the Eventi - we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: LikesCats3
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! We went for my 50th birthday celebration and it was perfect. We had champagne and chocolate in our room upon arrival, the staff was friendly, we had a great view of the Empire State Building, it was truly a perfect stay. The details: A very comfy room with a great view. Really comfy bed. Friendly, accommodating staff. From the desk staff down to the cleaning staff. The security guard remembered us, we never had to show our key after our first day, the doorman, very tall man, knew all the spots to go to and had helpful information. The location was perfect for everything we did, right in the middle. There is a great rooftop deck that they sometimes serve afternoon wine/sangria on. If I had even one tiny complaint I would say the light in the bathroom wasn't great but that was so minor that it hardly matters. We love New York and like to try different hotels whenever we are there but honestly, I can't imagine staying anywhere else now, thanks Eventi for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Madisson Square Garden”
Reviews.Author: Peacocksj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night a couple of months ago to attend a concert. Hotel service was excellent, room was clean and hotel was lovely! I think this was the perfect choice for us since MSG was right around the corner and the price was reasonable. We went to the bar for a drink earlier in the evening. Great ambiance but service was a little slow. Will definitely be exploring other Kimpton hotels for upcoming travel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: cvillereader
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi for one night in December. The room and bathrrom were clean and the staff was really friendly. The bed was extremely confortable. I enjoyed expolring the public spaces of the hotel. The lobby is quite small, and the hotel seemed pretty full, so during the happy hour there was not a lot of space to sit. Nevertheless, offering free wine is a nice gesture. I didn't find this hotel's location to be as charming as others, and it felt a little more isolated than I would like, but the buidling itself was a nice one to come home to at night.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular view”
Reviews.Author: tugar
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 30th Anniversary with our first trip to NYC. We splurged and spent the first 2 nights @ the Eventi. We booked through SniqueAway @ $245 per night plus tax for Cityview. Our flight was early and we arrived at the Hotel about 9 am and we were checked in at no extra cost even though check in time was 3 pm . The room was extremely nice, plenty large enough for a couple with a very comfortable bed, marble tiled large bathroom with full vanity, huge multihead shower and spectacular floor to ceiling full width of the room windows with a gorgeous view of the city just a few blocks from the Empire State Building. Coffee served in the lobby and often drinks in the evening. We were so busy sightseeing that we didn't take full advantage of the patio or the restaurant. The concierge was very helpful with travel tips. Iron and umbrella available. Within walking distance to many sights. We were glad we splurged for the view!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel near the Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: JMUDuke08
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, well-appointed, near the Empire State Building. Found all of the staff to be very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service and hospitality - We will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: JP732
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I planned a romantic trip to NY, little did she know, I planned on asking her to marry me. I contacted management at the hotel to assist me with arranging the time and setting for this amazing night and they were beyond helpful. Not only did the manager provide me with ideas and places to pop the big question, but she even gave me her personal phone number to check in with her on the details. She personally arranged the room down to the very last detail of what I had requested. I felt as though I was treated as part of their family even though we had never met. The ENTIRE staff at Eventi, not only the manager, made this weekend unforgetable. I 100% reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: zalna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eventi in February. Our room had an amazing view of the Empire State building. We were greeted with Sparkling wine in the room for my birthday, this was a nice and much appreciated touch. The hotel was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see and do. All of the hotel staff was knowledgeable, helpful, and friendly. I have recommended this hotel to friends and will keep recommending it to people going to New York. Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: EMRBrookline
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely weekend stay at the Eventi hotel. The hotel is aesthetically attractive with very professional staff. There is parking on site (which came free with the room package we booked). there is also free Internet, if you are a Kimpton Hotel member (which is free to join). The location is great. We were able to walk to The Jazz Standard for dinner and jazz -- ( only a couple of blocks away.) There was a small parking snafu -- when we arrived there was a street fair on 6th avenue which meant we could not get to the front of the hotel for valet parking -- but we were able to self-park in the adjoining parking garage. The hotel staff was very helpful throughout. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: fcinwi
Reviews.Content: Great place for a weekend visit. The desk staff was incredibly helpful with restaurant recommendations and helping to place reservations, did not seem to mind helping at all. The room was beautiful, comfortable, and the location in Chelsea was preferable to the touristy Times Square - still very central to lots.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: staceye2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in June 2011. The hotel is pretty, clean and modern. The room was very small, which is typical of NYC, but it had a good sized bathroom and enough room in the closet to unpack our suitcases. We had a spectacular view of the city from the floor to ceiling windows. The front desk and valet staff were very friendly and helpful. Although I did not interact with the housekeeping staff, they did a great job. I do not have any major complaints except I did not love the concierge service- my husband and I have been to NYC many times and had already seen the tourist spots. We were looking for something atypical or interesting to do and the concierge did not have any suggestions. I also did not like having to pay for wifi when so many other hotels these days include internet access. We booked through magellen vacations and got a significantly reduced rate. Although the hotel was good and well located, I do not think I would stay here again if I had to pay full 300$ plus rates. However, for what we paid, the hotel was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DanteGlen_NH
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a romantic stay in NYC, this is the place. Beautifully appointed, comfortable and convenient, you will not find an equal. The hotel is right near Chelsea and the art galleries and restaurants, and a short hop to the Theatre District.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business stay”
Reviews.Author: notacamper39
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed staying at the Eventi Hotel. The room was well appointed and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Little things like quality shampoo and conditioner were a nice bonus. The staff were very friendly and service oriented. They werevery helpful when I asked for dinner reservations. I love the wine hour at all Kimpton properties -- It is such a great idea. The breakfast while not included, was quality and well done. The location is good if you are doing business in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nina B
Reviews.Content: Eventi was simply perfect. I can't think of one complaint about the hotel. The location is great, just two blocks from the subway and on sixth avenue. The hotel staff is very friendly, they ask about your day and I would especially like to thank Bobby and Dwayne for their politeness. The room is spacious enough (it was only my husband and I), the bathroom being the highlight as it was big, well-lit and clean. Sure, the price is a little over our usual budget, but we decided to indulge because it was our one-year anniversary. I hope I can stay here again on my next trip to NY! If you're a Kimpton Intouch member, you get free wifi too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Asaptraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this perfectly located hotel not far from the Empire State Building and Herald Square. Perfect spot for shopping and sightseeing. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. Bathrooms were very spacious with beautiful marble. Water pressure could have been a bit stronger. A great place called the FoodParc is right next door for a quick snack and cup of coffee. They serve breakfast as well. Rooms were a nice size and beautifully appointed. Bed was comfortable as well. All in all, a great weekend at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: greenidlady
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize up until now that Kimpton hotels are eco and pet friendly. This hotel is very nice. We stayed for my boyfriend's birthday. We had one other guest traveling with us so we got the executive one bedroom suite. It wasn't cheap, around 600 for the night. But at least it included parking. Everyone at the hotel was super friendly and helpful. They offered free wine in the evening for a hour which was nice. They also had dog food and water for the guest's pets in the lobby (I wish I would have brought my dog now). The hotel itself is very trendy, definately check out the restaurant area even if you don't eat there. I had the breakfast buffet up there, it was around 30 bucks and good. The room itself had a nice comfy bed and big shower. Even though the room and service was great for the price I don't know if I will come to this specific location or not as it is not as close to everything as some of the other kimpton hotels. I'd probably try Ink next time and bring my pet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, interesting neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: MBQ
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding here, and let me say that the Eventi was a great place for an Event. Best part was cocktails following the ceremony on a terrace overlooking the city. With the Empire State Bldg just 4 blocks away, you feel you can almost touch it when its lights go on at dusk. Rooms are fresh and new with great beds and plush white bedding. These days I only like hotel beds that have duvets with covers that are laundered all the time vs.old fashioned bedspreads that get cleaned rarely. Yuck! The decor is contemporary but not edgy. Big glass stall showers and nice lighting. I could live without the the sliding doors and storage space is minimal. Surrounding neighborhood houses wholesale novelties and costume jewelry suppliers. Fun! Walking distance to HiLine and galleries of Chelsea, Chinatown, Little Italy, Broadway theaters, and lots of other cool places. Front desk not too helpful in recommendations. We asked for a casual lunch spot nearby, were sent blocks away instead of right next door where there is a great place with terrific food and seating indoors and out. Did the same thing with other wedding guests we knew. Strange! We had a wedding rate, which was fine, but other rates were a little high. Of course, in N.Y. that's to be expected. I do enjoy exploring diverse neighborhoods there. Usual nice Kimpton amenities like free coffee, tea in the a.m., wine in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “we love kimptons, but”
Reviews.Author: kdks99
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel with all the truly awesome kimpton touches. so were very disappointed by some service issues. when we tried to get suggestions and info from the staff at the desk they were extremely unhelpful and made no effort to help us. we know the restaurant is not operated by kimpton, but we found the desserts and drinks experience awful. after having another perfect dining experience at brabbo (hotel lorien) last weekend the whole restaurant area was an unpleasant surprise. this is a beautiful hotel with great rooms, a fabulous terrace , good gym and lots of great kimpton perks. it's only because we're such kimpton fans that i'm posting this. please fix restaurant issues and help the staff reflect the usually excellent level of guest services at kimptons. kimpton hospitality i realize these are

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern luxury”
Reviews.Author: cwtrade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days on our return from Boston and were pleasantly surprised by this new addition to Chelsea. The room was a bit small but every luxury was provided and the view from a high floor magnificent. We went to one of the complimentary wine receptions before our nite began and it was a most civilized experience. A very dignified looking man approached to ask if we were enjoying our stay and could anything be improved. We lated learned he was the manager. Desk personnel very courteous and helpful when needed and there was evidence of good security around the lobby. Excellent morning coffees and teas provided in lobby were a nice touch and not typical in all NYC hotels. Room furnishings were of good quality and bed very comfortable. The bath and shower were very well fitted with best materials. Would defintely stay again at this convenient comfortable place .

Reviews.Title: “Hip, yet comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingscientists
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay! Good sized rooms, comfortable decor, excellent beds, slept like a dream. Room had terrific view of Empire State building. Only downside was low waterpressure in shower. Free coffee in lobby in AM, free wine party 5-6pm. Room service was good food, but arrived late. Workout facility was decent size, plenty of equipment. Nice open patio on 5th floor. Great spot to sit outside and read. I also went to Foodparc directly next door for take out one night, it was good inexpensive food.

Reviews.Title: “Good addition to the Kimpton brand... but we'd still choose the Muse in NYC”
Reviews.Author: highway_song
Reviews.Content: Well-located for Chelsea, the Flower District, and lower Midtown. Reasonably hip decor. We were upgraded to a suite - very petite, suggesting that standard rooms would be awfully small. Good bathroom but beware the slippery marble floor tile (why do we find this problem over and over again in hotels? Look into tumbled marble, decorators!) Bar Basque offers some fine house cocktails and tapas, but be selective on the latter -- go with the charcuterie, piquillo peppers, fried olives... flatbread pizzas overpriced and mediocre. Also good breakfasts in the dining room - well-prepared omelets, good steel cut oats... menu looked more interesting than buffet. Bar (and most rooms on the back side of the hotel facing away from Empire State Building) have an entertaining view of a large outdoor screen showing art videos. Underground parking easily accessible from the building. Service good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Level”
Reviews.Author: skiptravel
Reviews.Content: I am an American currently living in Pakistan and traveling through NYC. I really enjoy Kimpton hotels and when I saw this property was a new one, I had to book a reservation. Given that my time in NYC was short (and wedged between two very long flights), I wanted to pre-coordinate my trip to your hotel so that it is organized and calm.
