I connected with Kolby Sehldon the concierge and have been most impressed. I travel worldwide and, thus, have the opportunity to deal with a lot of hospitality and hotel staff and it is not easy to impress me. Kolby has done just that. Congratulations for having a talented and responsive (and professional) concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: malatestiano
Reviews.Content: One of the best Kimpon Hotels I visited. Only 4 blocks from Penn Station. I got a room with full view of the Empire State Building. Extremely clean. Wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ohana6
Reviews.Content: great place, staff was friendly without being overly so, rooms were very clean, bathrooms were lovely- a lot of space and the showers were the best. Did not have ice machines so had to call every time you needed ice, which of course leads to having to give out tips for a job I could do myself. There was no price sheet for the food items in the snack bar so beware....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: jillian07
Reviews.Content: Once again, Kimpton Hotels didn't disappoint!! The staff were super friendly and helpful and the location of the Eventi couldn't have been better. Even though the room was very small - to be expected in NYC - the huge windows and good size bathroom were a plus. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “You can't do better for value in mid-town”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCatLady
Reviews.Content: The friendly, well-priced Eventi has a lot to offer. It is new and well-decorated, the rooms and baths are comfortable and well-equipped, and the service is friendly. We had a quiet room, a corner room on the 6th floor. The only thing we heard was an occasional honk and we slept quite well. The bed was comfy and the air conditioner functioned quite well. Free coffee in the morning was good and complimentary wine in the early evening was lovely - good Australian wine on the attractive terrace. There is also always-cold, slightly flavored water available in the lobby. When the room was not cleaned as scheduled, a phone call took care of the problem within 10 minutes. Mistakes can happen - what sets a place apart is how they deal with them. This hotel knows how to do that. And last but not least, the Food Park next door is a great, inexpensive source for all sorts of breakfasts. The Basque restaurant upstairs served us an excellent meal one night before we walked to the theater. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff. Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: sarbek
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Eventi in a King Deluxe room. We booked through Magellan Travel and will use this service again! Great rates! Arrived at hotel in cab. Greeted immediately by a porter who showed us to the front desk, offered us water etc. Check-in was very quick. The man who did the check-in took the time to give us info about the hotel, where things were located. The front desk staff is very knowledgeable. Give them a bit of info on what you want, what type of meal you are looking for and you won't be disappointed with their suggestions. We called the concierge a few weeks in advance to get some top NYC restaurant ideas and we are so happy we did. The suggestions met our needs and wishes perfectly. Room is lovely. Modern but comfortable decor. The only thing that needs to be looked at is the lighting in the bathroom. It is terrible for putting on makeup! The bed was so comfortable! Great view. Loved the in-room robes! Only ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, but it was very good. I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent chain - ideal location but one disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MaxC74
Reviews.Content: Short leisure trip from London to NYC. Decided to stay at Eventi as we have used Kimpton hotels before (great service and one of very few to have a LGBT policy). Very smart city hotel and perfect location for exploring Manhattan. Room was excellent, comfortable and without fault. What I love about Kimpton hotels (as well as the excellent service and zero attitude) are the simple yet thoughtful things, like having a iron/board and an umbrella in your room (sadly it rained for most of the time we were there). The wine hour and morning coffee at reception were also welcomed. The one thing that let us down is the bar. This hotel features an uber-modern bar/restaurant rather than a traditional hotel bar and it's not IMHO particularly 'accessible' for the hotels guests. The first evening we arrived, we sat down to relax at the bar and ordered a glass of wine but were told that the seating was reserved after 10pm , so we only had about 30 minutes before we would have to 'move on'. I felt a bit disappointed, particularly as we'd only just arrived from London, being tired, we didn't want to venture out of the hotel but had to retreat to our room instead. Not particularly welcoming and no mention of this was made by reception. On another occasion, we headed to the bar only to find it closed for a private function. On our last day, we had an evening flight back to London so we had to vacate our room at midday. Whilst reception were happy to look after our bags (they weren't able to provide a late check out) we had to walk the streets of Manhattan for a couple of hours, but we kept ourselves entertained. Mid afternoon it was raining heavily so we thought we'd head back to the hotel to have a drink in the bar for a hour or two before heading off to JFK. Problem: the bar doesn't open until 4pm - great! So we had to make use of the FoodParc where we at least managed to get a beer (eventually. Good luck trying to use FoodParc, a very modern but odd concept. we eventually worked out what we were supposed to do * see below *). Then we found a couple of chairs on the third floor to sit on until it was time to go to the airport. The good thing about Kimpton is that they serve you well when you want help, otherwise they generally leave you alone. There's no pretentiousness, just quality service however whilst I understand that some people prefer a more utilitarian approach, I wouldn't mind a little more warmth and feeling that my hotel was more than just 'a base'. (note for all Europeans, there aren't many bars in the area so don't expect any kind of cafe culture that we are used to, it kinda makes you feel like you're an alcoholic "where can I get a drink around here?") PS. FoodParc - to save you looking like a complete idiot (like we did) here's what its about. FoodParc is an eat/drink zone with a few different eateries/kitchens/counters/zones whatever you wanna call them (3Bs, Fornetti, Red Farm Stand, The Press and BeerParc) all with different menus. It's confusing because it's not clear quite what you do or where you order. You'll see banks of computer touch screens but no instructions on what to do. So: Go up to a touch screen - they have the menus for all the eateries. Browse the menus and choose what you want to eat/drink (a bit like shopping online). Your order can include items from ANY of the eateries (as I found out after I had ordered! At first it looks like you only have the option to get items from one menu, but if you continue, you will get the opportunity to add items from the other menus) You swipe your credit card Computer gives you a printed receipt with an order number Check TV screens above your head for order progress When it's ready, go and collect your order from the appropriate 'vendor' Take a seat and eat (there's a load of raked seating out of sight at the rear) (For those of you in the UK, think Argos!)

Reviews.Title: “The same every time...Great”
Reviews.Author: RMTCA
Reviews.Content: This is not an inexpensive hotel but it continues to provide an excellent stay. From the greeting at the door, the check in, to the clean , well designed room - it is all there. I have stayed here 3 times in 9 months and it has met or exceeded my expectations every time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought it would be.IT WAS MUCH MUCH BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: topbanana11217
Reviews.Content: I was in doubt, a 'Boutique' hotel, well okay, we will manage, for the wedding party BUT it was SUPER, all the staff from front desk to room service and restaurant gave us a stay well worth remembering..I don't do 'reviews; but this hotel is well worth a HUGE mention. Thanking all the staff for their undivided attention at all times of the day and night. Both British and American family were all extremely satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdovea
Reviews.Content: Beautiful spacious well appointed room. Spotlessly clean hotel with excellent service. Travelled with a small group and each any every one in the group was more then satisfied. We plan to book again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Location...The Eventi has it all!”
Reviews.Author: LowCountryIslander
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Eventi over a holiday weekend in May and could not have been a better experience. We arrived at the hotel about 2pm and our room wasn't ready yet, but it was not trouble to store our bags with the bellman and trot off to Eataly for a little shopping spree. We arrived back at the hotel at 3:30pm and had not trouble getting our room key and having our bags delivered to our room. The room we stayed in was on the 19th floor and fortunately for us there is no highrise building next door, so we had a pleasant view of the surround area. The room and bathroom were immaculately clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and I really appreciated not only the walk in shower, but the 2 shower heads, one a rainfall shower head attached to the ceiling and the other attached to the wall. The bath amenities were more than the typical trial size and they supplied, body wash, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. The closet, although fairly small had everything we needed including a safe, 2 bathrobes and a suitcase stand. As a Kimpton In Touch member I was able to access free wi-fi and had the NY Times delivered daily. The location on 6th Ave at 30th Street was great, within walking distance of Herald Square and lots of subway connections from that stop, and still within reasonable walking distance to the theater district and the Chelsea Neighborhood. We didn't try the on-property restaurant or the associated food court with a good variety of breakfast and lunch options availabe, but would on future visitis. I would not hesitate to stay at the Eventi again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fun”
Reviews.Author: KF3000
Reviews.Content: My family and I did an overnight in NYC and got a very good deal at Eventi. Although they had overbooked and didn't have the room we'd reserved, they did give us 2 rooms instead. The rooms were great - a little small, but that's normal in NYC, and for what we paid (about $230) it was a great deal. The rooftop terrace on the 5th floor was a good place for coffee and to take in the view. Foodparc next door, which belongs to Eventi, is a fun place to eat with kids, you order your food at touchpad kiosks and pick up. The food was ok, nothing great, but prices were reasonable. The service staff in the hotel was friendly, but seemed a little distracted when there were large crowds in the lobby. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: axeld018
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated in New York (which matters much given how you walk in the city), this hotel far exceeded our expectations : very comfortable and vast rooms (with a view of the Empire state in our room), excellent service, splendid restaurant etc ... Let's hope this new hotel will not raise its prices too much in the years to come

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: iheartparis
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Kimpton Hotel, and it will definitely not be my last. I stumbled upon a great deal at the Eventi on accident and went ahead and booked figuring I could cancel if plans changed. Thankfully, they did not and I was able to experience the best hotel I’ve stayed at in NYC. My first suggestion is to sign up for their loyalty program, InTouch. Its free, they don’t crowd your inbox with emails and they send you promotions and discount offers. As an InTouch member, one of the staff members emailed me 2 days prior to my stay to welcome me as well as provide me with some information that might be useful during my stay. Upon arrival, the front desk had a handwritten welcome note for me from a member of the concierge. Check in was quick and painless and Jocelyn was lovely. She quickly went over the features of the hotel as well as acknowledging me as an InTouch member. Another big benefit to being an InTouch member, the “Raid the Minibar” credit you get, $15 in NYC. I didn’t think that would go very far, but I managed to get 2 bags of chips, a bag of gummy bears and a king size Snickers with my credit. I was very pleased and surprised to see I had been upgraded to a high room floor with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. The room was somewhat small, as 90% of them are in NYC, but the hotel does offer suites for those looking for more space. The bathroom, on the other hand, was huge and offered plenty of space to spread out your toiletries. The bed was incredibly comfortable and had a few different types of pillows to choose from. There was a nice sized area for a laptop and space to lay out anything you may have brought. In the closet I found ample hangers as well as shelving space to store clothing and luggage. They provided 2 bathrobes that could be used during my stay as well as an umbrella that I could borrow if the weather turned. The best part of the room is the floor to ceiling windows that offer a panoramic view. I’m sure the views are wonderful even if you’re not in a city view room. I’ve read some complaints about having to show your room key at night prior to getting on the elevator. I have no problem with this and welcome any additional security measure a hotel takes. The security guard was very nice and remembered me throughout the duration of my stay. The evening wine hour is a nice touch, and apparently a signature of all Kimpton hotels, which featured a red and white wine as well as Sangria. They give you a very generous glass and don’t mind if you take it up to your room. They also have a complimentary coffee and tea service in the morning. Unfortunately, I never woke up early enough to partake. The room was very quiet and I never had any trouble with noise. There’s a button you can press before you go to sleep that alerts housekeeping that you’re not ready. I never had anyone knock on my door and disturb me; instead the one day I left after housekeeping had stopped by, they left a note advising me to let the front desk know I was ready to have my room cleaned. I also had the NY Times delivered to my door daily and it was always there when I woke up, even on the weekend. The only negative about the room was the air conditioning. It has an “eco mode” option, but I could never get my room cooler than 80 degrees. I didn’t say anything, and it’s very likely there’s an easy fix for this. I also was never sweating to death either, so I brushed it off as no big deal. The location is away from the insane noise and hustle and bustle of Times Square, but still closes enough to walk if you please. Otherwise there are major subway lines a block over. The hotel is also very near Harold Square and the giant Macy’s store. The best part was how close it is to Penn Station. I had flown in from Newark and was very happy to see I wouldn’t have to drag my luggage on an off the subway once I got off my train. I didn’t get a chance to eat at Bar Basque or partake in room service, but I will say that FoodParc is a fun place to stop for lunch and offers numerous food options. They also now have BeerParc for and afternoon treat. Check out was quick and easy as well and they had no problem storing my luggage for me until my later flight. Overall, the Eventi made a fantastic impression on me. I am staying at Ink48 in a month and can only hope that it lives up to its sister hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: momsbroke
Reviews.Content: Had heard about this hotel and decided to spend Memorial Day weekend there with my daughter. The service was excellent (room ready by 3pm, no wait) and all the employees were friendly and welcoming. The room looked out onto 6th Avenue and must have been the most soundproof I've ever experienced. Very little siren noise and only rain hitting the window during a big thunderstorm overnight. The Etra amenities were lovely, the shower marble and very modern. Having FoodParc right next door was very convenient. The location of the hotel is also convenient and near all public transportation, but the neighborhood itself, while getting better, is no great thrill. That was the only downside. Our second Kimpton hotel experience and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: HouTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Eventi and can't wait to return. First of all, we upgraded to a city view room and had a splendid view of the Empire State Building from our 22nd floor window. The room was smallish but not cramped and the bathroom was downright luxurious. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A highlight of the day was happy hour from 5 – 6 with complimentary wine. We’d grab two glasses then head to the outside terrace on the 5th floor to give our tired feet a rest before our evening activities. You won’t go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for a Business Stay!”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: I am in this neighborhood for work often. I have tried the Four Points (eh), the DoubleTree (not bad), and the Affinia (steer clear) - but I am going to be staying at the Eventi going forward - no question. PROS: great location (near Penn Station) 630am (free!) morning pilates class - sign up the night before, they give you a wake up/reminder call free internet - if you sign up for Kimpton rewards program, no big deal quiet - I had a room on the 21st floor, no street noise great view wonderful, clean, brand new gym big and beautiful bathroom security - they check to make sure you are a guest before letting you go up the elevator in the evening CONS: bedroom was small - but it's NYC, so what can you do? (There is a full service spa on site, I did not try. Nor did I try the restaurant or room service.) There is a very fun outdoor seating area connected with their "food court" - aka FoodParc - which is a perfect place for a quick snack, or night time frozen yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our first visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Littlejohn
Reviews.Content: We undertook a great deal of research and spoke to many previous visitors to the city - the key advice was "don't spend a fortune on your hotel room as you'll hardly be in it!" Ok, point taken - but I also wanted somewhere that I could at least chill and relax after pounding the pavements for 5 days. We were lucky enough to snag an amazing FaceBook deal which gave us a 40% discount on our stay + an upgrade to an exec suite! What a deal - we were on the 18th floor looking West over Chelsea (if you want to avoid some of the street inevitable noise from 6th avenue request a high floor room at the rear of the building). From the door man, through to the check-in plus all of the many members of the team we met during our stay EVERYONE was warm, genuine, friendly and helpful. The rooms were immaculate and the facilities excellent. We found the location to be really good - 2 blocks to the subway for up town/the Village/or downtown. Reasonably easy to grab a cab and many, many places within walking distance. Unless you are willing to really splurge and stay on Madison or 5th up near the Park, then this is a perfect area from which to explore. Always managed to grab a free coffee in the morning but didn't make the wine hour. The Food Parc next door was good for a take out breakfast. We covered masses of ground in the city - the food/bars which were highlights include Eatly - Italian/American food retailer / restaurant on 23rd Jane in the Village The Cookshop in Chelesa Daniel - 3 Mitchelin stars - unbeatable Lamb's Bar - cocktails The Essex - lower East side for brunch - book and go early Ellen's Stardust Diner - great fun And a special note for Big Apple Greeters. We were lucky enough to be matched with Ross a guy who has a love for his city. We really loved our 3 hours walking round the Village which ended with a wonderful lunch in Tony's for a genuine NYC burger in the East Village. BAG is a wonderful charity and I truly hope that they continue to give more and more visitors a taste of the real NYC. The subway - $29 for a weekly ticket - the best deal we got in our visit. We were all over the place using this ticket - on buses and subway. The system is SO easy to use and as others have said, if you even look slightly lost someone will help you. My OH was gobsmacked when someone stopped me on day 3 and asked for help understanding the subway system! We loved the city - it wont be long till we are back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and unique hotel in the heart of Midtown”
Reviews.Author: michelle_p630
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with some friends. The hotel is a quick walk (5 minutes) from Madison Square Garden and maybe a 10-minute walk from Times Square. The hotel was charming, modern, and the staff was very helpful and attentive. I love the fact that they are pet-friendly and have free wine from 5-6 PM. The rooms are very nice and fairly spacious for NYC standards. There is also a bar next door called Bar Basque. It has a hipster, loungey feel and turns into a dance club after 11 on Saturday nights. They have excellent watermelon raspberry martinis. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Glitter is not gold”
Reviews.Author: SpiroZambini
Reviews.Content: Room looks great. We just wish they had hot water. Seems like there is almost none during the early morning. Went to restaurant and was encouraged to instead go to the lobby for a complimentary breakfast because they were going to have some private events later. Lobby only had coffee or tea. Colleague is staying in another room. They made her change rooms after one night. Seems odd. Front desk person was not that helpful. We had questions but he had his own agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Eventi is a first class hotel - location is it's only problem.”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer365
Reviews.Content: We had a long stay at the Eventi, ten days. The hotel was one of the best we have stayed at with very good service and excellent amenities. we had a corner room on the tenth floor, which was a good spot looking down 6th avenue. The hotel is in Midtown which is a bit of a cultural wilderness so it's a walk or ride to most places of interest. There is a street of Korean restaurants close by and a couple of other good restaurants, plus the FoodParc in the hotel building, which is great for breakfast and casual food. If you want a top ranked hotel at a reasonable price and can put up with having to walk or ride to NY's attractions, the Eventi can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “As always.....top of the heap service from Kimpton.”
Reviews.Author: mk02004
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous inside, really well-situated, and has nice sized rooms for NYC. I was only there for one night this time, but they double upgraded me to a corner room above the 20th floor w/ an unobstructed view of the Empire State Bldg.( ..."Ah, yeah....Winning!!!" ). I was disappointed that the weather was not a little warmer as their outdoor terraces are STUNNING and the wine hour in the lobby was a tad over-subscribed. But I met some very cool people at the wine reception and ended up dining with one of my new pals next door at Bar Basque which was funky ++. The breakfast buffet was a bit better value than the dinner menu, but the decor alone is an experience worth having. All in all - great value. I have yet to be disappointed with a Kimpton (and I'm no push-over).

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kazzyvege
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is a little further down from Times Square - on Avenue of Americas - it is a quick walk to everything and for those of you who are like my husband and don't appreciate crowds - it couldn't be more perfect. Two or three blocks to Times Square and an easy walk to Broadway. The hotel is clean and contemporary and the rooms for the price are fantastic. We have previously stayed in a hotel in Midtown which was more expensive but you couldn't walk side by side in the room it was so small. The bathroom was HUGE, very comfortable beds, we had a view of the Empire State out of the window (which was so much better than the concrete wall and pigeons we had in Midtown) and the hotel has a fantastic Spanish Restaurant in it which was so good we went back twice! It does turn into a nite club after a certain time though so beware! The staff are helpful and friendly and the rooms are cleaned at times convenient to you so as not to cause you trouble by getting in your way. It was a fantastic experience, great hotel and good on Kimpton for providing such a great place in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of the best of Kimpton standards”
Reviews.Author: paulasw
Reviews.Content: I don't know how Kimpton accomplishes this, but their attention to travelers’ detail is unbeatable. I only wish their staff training program was openly available because I would love to replicate the curriculum! The Eventi is a prime example of consummate professionalism and quality of service.. What can I say…. without going into lots of details, Eventi is tops in all that is expected in a top lodging and Kimpton hotels! As for Kimpton, my only regret is that there is not a choice in every state I visit for business and pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, considering NYC standards”
Reviews.Author: emboman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi for one week in May. We booked at this hotel because it was conveniently located near Penn station (allows us to take the train to/from Newark airport without hassling with Taxis) and was close to other interesting areas. We also got a good impression from reading reviews, and we found a relatively good price online (booking.com). We booked their least expensive king bed room, but when we arrived they offered to give us an upgrade to a room on the 20th floor so that we would get a view of the Empire State Building. We accepted, of course, and it turned out that our room was as good as we could have hoped for. We had a room on the north-eastern corner with a view towards the Empire State. The bed was soft and nice, and the room was very quiet and modern. Coffee was available in the lobby every morning, and there was wine available at 5pm every day (we did not try the wine because we were out and about almost all the time). The hotel offers breakfast and other meals in its restaurant, and has spa services available. We used neither. If you join their free loyalty program InTouch, you can get free in-room wireless internet and Newspapers delivered to the room. The wireless connection was stable and good enough for our use (sporadic PDA/cell phone). Room cleanliness was superb, apart from the top shelf of the closet, which was a bit dusty. Although this is a pet friendly hotel, we did not see any sign of dog hairs or smell in our room. During the work week we hardly saw any pets in the hotel, but in the weekend there were some dog owners around. All we met were friendly, though, with small dogs. During the day in the weekend we could hear some dogs in nearby rooms missing their owners, but this was not loud enough to be irritating. We did not notice any noise during the nights. Room A/C was functioning well. Adjustable without being too loud. Bathroom was rather big for New York, with sink, big shower (although with some weird controls), and normal amenities (body wash, shampoo, body lotion, etc.). Plenty of towels. The room also had a free in-room safe and snacks/drinks available for purchase in the minibar, as well as stockings and bathrobes (though a bit expensive). The staff was very friendly to us. We stored our luggage for a few hours on the day of departure without problems, and the doormen got us a taxi when we needed one. Reception staff was welcoming. At night we were sometimes asked for our room card before entering the elevator, which was perfectly OK as a security measure. Negatives: - We missed hangers for jackets near the door. - Not too much space for storing suitcases, although probably at least as good as other hotels in NYC. - Bed comforter was just tucked in between two bedsheets, so it easily got detached from the sheets during the night. Slightly annoying, but hardly anything to worry about. Positives: - Clean, relatively big room. - Flat-screen HD TV with lots of channels. - Very nice bathroom. - Tall building, nice view. - Good airconditioning. - Comfortable King bed. - Safe and Quiet...

Reviews.Title: “Eventi is Eventful”
Reviews.Author: CMCPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Hotels do not disappoint. Everything about the Eventi was great. Staff, room, wine hour, amenities, etc. The location was good because while it was not in the thick of Times Square, it was within walking distance to everything but a little bit quieter. When staying at a hotel the most important thing is cleanliness and it was very clean. In fact, this is the first time that we have ever received a thank you note from the maid after leaving a tip and while we don't travel very often (about 4 times a year), we always leave a tip. We also appreciate the little details such as the cupcakes in celebration of a birthday (the reason for visiting). We strongly recommend staying at The Eventi and will definitely stay again. Kimpton has become our favorite hotel chain. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ADOH
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel- the room was clean and comfortable. We requested a quiet room- which we got. The bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with a wet room shower. The hotel is not situated in the prettiest of areas; however it is located close to many main attractions. We enjoyed the complimentary wine in the lobby on our return from a day’s sightseeing- nice touch! Our deal included breakfast- this was a voucher system used in the food mart next door, which was ok for one or two days- but then got a bit monotonous/limited, so we stopped using the facility and brunched out. The staff were helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever, but head of security was VERY rude to me.”
Reviews.Author: JPeabody
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from April 22-24 (under my son's name). The concierge staff was WONDERFUL and the hotel was beautiful. While I give it a 5-star rating, I must say that the head of security was very rude to me. I wanted a picture of the Empire State Building at night from the Veranda. I arrived at 10:05 p.m. and he said it was closed and to come back the next night before 10 p.m. I did so (arrived at 9 p.m.) and he stood there like the Gestapo saying he wouldn't even unlock the door to allow me to take one quick shot. Said it was closed due to in-climate weather. It wasn't raining at all and the skies were clear and the shot would have been beautiful. All I needed to do was get on the other side of the glass for pictorial aesthetics. He said there was nothing he could do as his supervisor told him to close it. It seems to me with the wonderful service at this hotel, that he could have at least made a call allowing me to get to the other side of the door (with him standing right by me) to take the picture.. REALLY irked me. I was in the hotel business for 15 years (with Cendant) and expected more of a Kimpton hotel. I will say that Dewayne at the front desk was probably the most apt and friendly concierge I have ever encountered. Too bad your security guard did not have customer service in mind. He could have at least called someone to get a "no" for a special request rather than be rude to me and, in essence, flex his muscles. Someone should talk to him about customer service. Other than that one bad experience, I loved the hotel. The trip was a wonderful and thoughtful gift from my son.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, clean, comfortable but quirky staff and location”
Reviews.Author: maltamark
Reviews.Content: The fact that the Eventi is just a few months old (and free of bedbugs!) is a nice treat in New York. The rooms are stylish and contemporary. We stayed in a Premier One Bedroom, which had a wonderful king size bed and spacious bathroom with double vanity and a "wet room." The sitting area was also reasonably comfortable. It all felt very put together and nicely designed. The staff is generally attentive and professional if you ask for something. Otherwise, none of the door men, front desk staff, etc will ever greet you. In fact, they have this policy at night of asking to see your room key before being allowed to use the elevator and, every night I thought, Dude, how can you not remember us? (We stayed 8 nights!). When we arrived, none of the 3 or 4 available doormen helped us with, um, the door much less our bags. Same for hailing taxis. Eight out of 10 times they were of no help. The Bar Basque restaurant/bar is a bit pretentious for my taste and it certainly didn't live up to expectations for breakfast. In fact, we only ate breakfast in the hotel once because they were so slow and such a disaster. The location is a mixed blessing: Geographically, it is close to everything: theater, the heart of Chelsea, the Village, etc. but, inevitably, we were always going somewhere. There's no "there" there at Eventi. It's very industrial old Garment District in the square block or two around the hotel. Once you're in for the evening, there's no where to get a quick drink (other than in the hotel), a snack, etc. other than some dubious corner stores. The lack of neighborhood is not a feeling I like when in New York. Would I stay there again? I'd seriously consider it. Again, it's easy to get around from the Eventi. The hotel is clean and comfortable and a fairly good deal for a 4-star hotel in NY. The management would do well to keep training the staff and setting higher service expectations.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: patrickMontreal
Reviews.Content: Just spent the week end at Eventi Hotel, it is by far the best hotel I visited in NYC. Location is great, the rooms are very beautiful, the view of my rooms 2007 was spectacular, the bed are so confortable, it is hard to get up in the morning. The restaurent Bar Basque in the hotel is also very very nice with a beautiful terrace. They serve wine in the lobby every day between 4 and 6. They gym is great for an hotel gym in the city. I will definitly go back!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TanyaLithonia_Ga
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Eventi early April. The accommodations were nice, beds comfortable, marble bath and shower. The rooms are a bit small, closets were too small for me and my husband. We did have a problem with housekeeping, one day after returning from a day on the town, the rooms hadn't been cleaned. But they addressed that. We were asked by security in the evening to see our room key,which was annoying. My husband thought because we are African-American but I told him, i witnessed others being asked. All In all a beautiful hotel, great location. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, polite front desk staff, problems with housekeeping and security”
Reviews.Author: FlyingProf
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Eventi in New York on a recent trip - I had read the reviews and thought it looked perfect for my needs. The good points about this hotel are that the location is excellent: very convenient for walking and for public transport via metro/train, and the front desk staff are very polite and helpful. However, I could not recommend the hotel due to concerns about their housekeeping and security. I returned to my room in the late afternoon on my second day and immediately noticed that it smelt strongly of cigar smoke (the hotel is supposed to be non-smoking). In addition to which I noticed that someone (the cigar smoker perhaps?) had left a business card and the key to another hotel room. This was unnerving and I called the front desk. The housekeeping manager came to the room and confirmed the smell of smoke and was puzzled by the business card and the room key - the business card appeared to be for an employee of the hotel chain: he took these away to investigate. I asked to change room and was moved to another room a few floors higher. It was the same style, but was not as nice, because rather than a full wall window, my window now had a concrete pillar in the middle. When I opened the wardrobe I found a pair of dirty socks, presumably left by the previous occupant – I took these down to the front desk and handed them in. The front desk clerk was apologetic and asked if I was returning to my room so that they could check that the room had been properly cleaned. I replied that I was going out to eat. I never heard any more about checking the room or the mysterious business card and was relieved to leave the hotel a day later. I shan't be staying with this hotel chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great location, but didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lizlore
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in the Kimpton chain, of which I am a huge fan, having previously stayed in their hotels in Chicago, Washington DC and San Francisco. The Eventi, however, was a disappointment to me. It is not that it is a bad hotel. The design is spectacular, the location (an easy walk from Penn Station, even with luggage) suited me perfectly, and the bed in my room was the most comfortable I had ever had the pleasure of sleeping in. But there were niggles. For example, my room was not serviced one day, something I do not expect from a hotel of this quality (and when I complained, the receptionist not only failed to apologise but even failed to end the phone call she was taking at the same time as talking to me); my room had an adjoining door to the room next door, through which a strong smell of cigarette smoke emerged one evening; the breakfast in the attached restaurant was mediocre and the staff pretentious; and I did not appreciate a security guard demanding to see my door key every evening when I returned to the hotel before I was permitted to proceed to my room. I usually like the Kimpton hotels’ relaxed and unobtrusive nature, and this was lacking from the Eventi where I seemed to be challenged at every turn: before being allowed to return to my room; when giving up on waiting to finally be shown to one of the numerous free tables at breakfast (the waiter chasing after me shouting ‘why are you leaving?’ and then questioning me again when he found me eating breakfast next door at FoodParc, smugly informing me that ‘It’s the same company’). Anyway, as nice as the location and rooms are, I won’t be staying there again: too much hassle, which is exactly what I don’t want from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff - Extraordinary Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelnguyusa
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is exceptional especially the front desk. Having stayed at many hotels in New York City including some of the city's best 5 star properties, the Eventi is truly outstanding. The hotel provides an extraordinary experience not only in it's aesthetically successful modern design but also in it's attention to detail to you the traveler. From the moment I stepped out of my cab, I felt truly welcomed by all of the staff, most importantly by the incredible people who work the front desk. The room also is welcoming and feels alive. Upon opening the door you are greeted with spa like music and lots of natural light streaming through the floor to ceiling windows. The beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in anywhere ! With the hassles of flying and transporting into the City, this type of welcoming attitude by hotel staff wins me over to be loyal to Kimpton Hotels and the Eventi. Thanks guys !

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: bridget138
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! When we arrived we were in a room that connected. We could hear everything that the people next door were saying. Called the front and were moved to a upgraded room right away, no questions asked! We were on the 15th floor, view was great! This hotel made our 4th stay in NYC the best one yet. Staff is awesome! Wine hour, great! Very clean and quiet. I have nothing bad to say about this place, we will be booking all our future stays in NYC at the Eventi. Book this hotel, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel but a bit overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: theoeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi NYC last July for business. I buy a lot from the several wholesalers in the area so it was great from that point of view but besides that there is not much else happening in the area. I stayed there right after it officially opened so there were quite a few renovations. The rooms are absolutely amazing and managed to get upgraded to a room on the 17th floor with a superb view of the Empire State Building and the streets of NY. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bathroom has everything one needs. The rooftop is a really nice place to enjoy happy hours drinks in summer with other guests or coworkers. I would definitely stay at the Eventi again but not at the rate I paid. I was only there for 3 nights and the location was very convenient at that time. Nevertheless the price is too high for the area it is and if you have nothing to do there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but impractical”
Reviews.Author: ktburgess
Reviews.Content: Stayed several nights in an executive suite with husband and teenage daughter. King and sofa beds were comfortable, room was quiet, and bathroom was spacious. Overall look of suite was beautiful and trendy, but the design was impractical: the closet was almost unusable and there were no other storage options in either the bedroom or the sitting area resulting in us living out of suitcases sitting on the floor. Given the rate we were paying, we were also surprised to have to pay for Internet access in the Business Center. The location at 6th + 30th was very convenient to several subway lines, but there was a dearth of nice eateries in the immediate area. Overall, our stay was pleasant, but I probably wouldn't stay at the Eventi again unless I could get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hardware, staff still need lots of training”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_dot
Reviews.Content: The good: Beautiful hotel with large rooms and great facilities! Location is extremely convenient--short walk to the Metro, Theater District, Chelsea. A number of good restaurants in the area too! The hotel upgraded me to the top floor and we got a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. Very quiet in the evening for NYC (sirens are inevitable, but not loud). Minor teething problems: Because it's new, I guess, the shower mixer didn't work properly. Water is either too hot or cold. We were very excited about the look of the shower, but the experience was disappointing. We also had to have our in-room safe replaced as half of the buttons didn't work. Remote control for TV didn't work either as did one of the bedside lamps--probably housekeeping or maintenance failed to check. The disappointment: Hotel staff needs to be better trained in terms of anticipating guests' need and responding to guests. Due to flight delays, we didn't get to the hotel until 1 a.m. There was a front desk person, who wasn't particularly friendly, and a couple security persons present, but no one ever offered to help us with our luggage even when it was obvious that we were struggling through the door. Since 1 am isn't that late in NYC terms, I had expected better service. Friends had mail packages to the hotel for me and they had arrive before I checked in. At other hotels, they would have placed them in the room for me, but I had to go to front desk to retrieve them, which is ok. On Day 1, when I asked for both packages, the front desk could only find one for me. When the USPS confirmed the second package has been delivered days ago, I went back to the front desk on Day 2 and after ten minutes, they were able to locate the second package. Apparently, there was a third one, but front desk never logged it in their system. When I emailed hotel after I had learned about the third one and had return home by then, they said they will look into whether it was possible to ship it back to me internationally and I never heard back. When I learned that a business associate will be in NYC, I emailed hotel and asked if it was possible to send that to a hotel in Soho and hotel didn't even respond. I like the hotel's hardware, but the hassle of dealing with its people makes it wonder if I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel: would have loved it if the service had been better.”
Reviews.Author: Sstella1
Reviews.Content: I’ll try to start and end this with the pluses because for the most part, I did like this hotel. I am a member of the their loyalty programme and emailed in advance to enquire about a room upgrade and coffee facilities and was delighted to get an immediate response confirming my upgrade to a Cityview King and that a coffee machine would be placed in my room. Things were looking good! The location was great for me (close to my office) but I’d say it’s probably a good location for tourists who want to stay Midtown – near Macy’s, Empire State etc. My room had a view of the Empire State which was cool and even rooms that don’t have this view would be bright and have a view of something – which is often not the case in Manhattan. The room was an okay size (for Manhattan), new, clean and had a lovely large shower room. However, when I arrived to check in there was a long wait and the guy who checked me in had a serious attitude problem. It was like he had a script of what he wanted to go through with me and when I asked a question or interrupted him, he was annoyed by this. He made me feel really unwelcome. A guy came up to the desk while I was there to complain because his key card wasn’t working (and apparently this was the second time he had been up to his room and had to come back down again) and the guy at the desk pretty much ignored him except to say that he was serving me and he would have to wait. I appreciate he was trying to be fair to me but he was really rude and just didn’t deal with the situation well. So anyway, I got up to my room and was ready to hit the minibar as I just wanted to flake on the bed and have a beer, but it was locked with a key and when I turned it – the thing broke off in the lock. I called guest services and was told someone would be up. Nobody came. I called them back to ask and they said there was a delay getting the engineer, so I asked if a beer could be sent up. No beer came. I called back to chase them up and eventually my beer came. But by this time I was pretty annoyed. So by next morning, no engineer had come and I had also realised there was no coffee machine in my room, so I had to call them up before I left for the day to ask them to ensure I could get in my minibar and that a coffee machine was in my room by the end of the day. It was dealt with that day, but I really could have done without the hassle. A couple of other things like this happened during my stay (of 5 nights). In brief: My coffee machine was not serviced (coffee was not replenished and cups weren’t cleaned after first day of use), so I had to raise call up about that. I got up to my room one day to find my keycard wouldn’t let me in and when I went all the way back down (I was on the 21st flr) I got the same rude check in guy again who (by now I realised is obviously fed up of dealing with this issue) abruptly asked for my photo ID so he could reprogramme it and was visibly annoyed that I couldn’t give him any because it was locked in my room(!). Anyway, aside from these things my stay was good. When I complained about something it was eventually dealt with. I got my beer on the first night credited to my bill because of the issue I had. The lady who was on the desk when I checked out was lovely and the room service (food and guy who brought it) were great. I am going to be travelling to NY often so I will probably try the Eventi again again as I am hoping I was just unlucky with the service. But if the service is still off next time it will be struck off my list I’m afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and stay”
Reviews.Author: gecko1273
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely friendly and approachable. While our room was small (this is NYC) it was spotless, elegant and cozy. The location is not bad as there are always taxis available and there is great shopping within a 20 minute walk. I would highly recommend the Eventi!

Reviews.Title: “Good bur far from Great”
Reviews.Author: Cheeseheads
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel with high expectations. We have stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Allegro in Chicago several times and absolutely love it. However, our experience at the Eventi left some room for improvement. For starters, the lobby is tiny. As others have said, there was really no room to sit and drink your coffee in the morning. This leads us to a huge disappointment for us – there was no coffee maker in the room. My husband and I love a piping hot cup of coffee in the morning while getting ready for the day. What a hassle to get your clothes on and go down 18 floors to stand in line and bring two small cups back up 18 floors. Several times when we got downstairs they were out of coffee so we had to wait. Finally on the last day right before checkout we mentioned to the front desk about how we really would have liked a coffee maker and he said oh, we can bring one up for you. How would we know we could get a coffee maker – there was no sign in the room? There was a sign saying we could get a curling iron or toothbrush, but nothing about a coffee maker. And, we could not have called for one if we wanted to because guess what – our phone did not work for the entire stay. We brought this up to the front desk and they sent someone up who said he would have to do some major work and would come back the next day, but he never did. And we did not have the energy to futz with it when we were there to enjoy the city. One other thing that we really missed was having a concierge – especially in New York City. The front desk folks seemed put out if you asked for a restaurant recommendation. They did not have a book of menus or other materials that would have helped us plan our days. Also, due to a glitch in the reservation system, you have to make two separate reservations is there is a sale going on for a portion of our stay. Thus, our room keys did not work after the first night and we had to get them reprogrammed. On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The floors to ceiling windows were nice. The complimentary internet for Kimpton in Touch Members is a must. We did have one beer, one coke, and 1 bag of pretzels with the “raid the mini bar” $15 coupon for In Touch members. We were only able to enjoy the wine hour one night out of four since it was only offered from 5pm to 6pm. We arrived on the first night right after it closed and thought they might have offered us a glass of wine since we just missed it but even though we mentioned it, they said come back tomorrow. I think a two hour time period would offer more of an opportunity to enjoy a glass depending on your schedule, or simply have a bottle in the room since the lobby is so small there really is not a lot of space to drink it. Overall, we had a nice time at the Eventi Hotel despite the little inconveniences but would most likely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Designed to disappoint....”
Reviews.Author: Registered_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Kimpton chain. Because of that, I came to Eventi with high expectations. While this is a fine hotel in a great location, it really misses the mark in a lot of little ways that add up in a frustrating whole. Specifically, there appears to be no thought of the guest in the design of the hotel. For example, want to turn on the light by your bed? Spend five minutes searching for a switch and call down to the desk to be told that there is a quarter-inch micro rocker switch placed directly where nobody can see it. I have decades of lamp experience, this is my first time being baffled. Want to empty your sink? Spend five minutes searching around and under the sink and call down to the front desk to be told the way to release the stopper that housecleaning left plugged is to reach through the water to press in the trap. Want light in your closet?Read the directions to wave your hand to trip it. Too bad that you can only read the directions with the light on. Have a black wall? Let's stick a black wall switch on it at an unfamiliar height. Nobody will ever find it! Want your room cleaned? Turns out that the button on the wall next to the closet which shows somebody sleeping should be turned off. Maybe the hotel wants to provoke us to challenge everything we thought comfortable in hotel/lighting/plumbing design? Perhaps the thing I found most disappointing was the shower. While it is pretty to have only half sectioned off with a glass wall, when you have low water pressure and at best lukewarm water, you spend the whole time shivering where the water is not hitting. Incredibly, the shower which has one handle below the other, has a bottom handle so long it can only go 90 of the 180 degrees it was designed to go and bumps into the handle above. Is every shower like the one in room 2315? Add to all of these little nits the fact that at the end of every single 10 minute ride down to the lobby to get a cup of coffee over three days, I found the hotel had run out of coffee and I had to wait while they ran their way too small thermos someplace to be refilled. While the lobby is very nice, whoever created the coffee service area did not leave a space for people to add milk/sugar to their coffee off on the side. The result is a line of people waiting for every person in front to finish doctoring their coffee before clearing the space for someone else to get coffee. Again, this is not a bad hotel. It is just a lot of bad design decisions that add up to a disappointment. Definitely no match for other Kimptons I've visited!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Eventi”
Reviews.Author: socon1217
Reviews.Content: I'll concur with many of the reviews posted here and say that the Eventi really is a find! I've had great experience with the various Kimpton hotels across the country and this one is as good as any of them. The hotel is very clean. The shower in the bathroom was like being at a spa (with a rain showerhead up at the ceiling to boot!). The room is a wee bit dark, but floor to ceiling windows allow you to open the drapes for plenty of natural light to come in. And what a view of the Empire State Building from the room! Location is its only (very slight) problem. At 30th and 6th, it's pretty close to Madison Square Garden and Macy's, and that's about it. There is very little in the area. The good news is that there are plenty of subway stops very nearby, allowing you to be elsewhere in Manhattan in a matter of minutes. Also, I suggest joining the Kimpton InTouch program -- Kimpton's free "frequent guest" program. Upon checking in, I was told that I had free wireless and presented with a $15 coupon to raid the mini-bar. A really nice touch from this terrific hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: kmcobb11
Reviews.Content: We've been traveling to NY for years and have found NY hotels to be hit or miss - this hotel was terrific! Wonderful staff, very clean (high rating for an avowed clean freak) and comfortable. The king bed was comfortable and a view from our room of the Empire State Building. We've been looking for a "go to" hotel and we think we've found it. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and very efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wine in the evening, coffee in the morning, spotless modern facilities and very efficient service. Cafe / deli next door is worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Chic New York away from tourist traps with everything on your doorstep...”
Reviews.Author: DagmarUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an amazing find. We had our wedding anniversary for the weekend in ny from the UK. We were given a fantastic suite on 22nd floor with a view of the empire state. The room was clean, comfy, trendy and with a bedroom locked away from the main corridor very peaceful. For Brits travelling to ny, this hotel is literally 5 min from Penn station which is a direct train ride from Newark airport. Forget the 100 dollar taxi ride and queuing all the way to Manhattan. Everything is nearby including some great bars, restaurants, Macys, Greenwich village, the meatpacking district, Time Square and empire state. I rarely walk into a hotel room and find no issues. This was simply beautiful and the staff were so friendly and helpful. Loved every minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmi8
Reviews.Content: When I first stayed here the hotel had only been open maybe 6mos? Now it's in the top 20 of New York hotels. Amazing and kind of sad that it's no longer a hidden gem for me. Rooms are chic, modern, comfortable, beds are large with amazing pillows. Everything is brand new and lovely. It's close to Madison Sq. Garden and the N/R subway lines (which will pretty much get you where you need to go downtown or uptown, as well as having Chelsea and Midtown. Which means lots of food and shopping options within walking distance. However I've heard not the greatest location for those looking to be closer to the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Obstacles overcome!”
Reviews.Author: cootmom
Reviews.Content: This was my first booking through Snique Away. Eventi is usually about $450/night and my stay was more than 50% off. The hotel is on the edge of Chelsea and a block or two from an entire street of Korean restaurants, what fun. The staff was wonderful. The hotel is nicely decorated. There was a wine tasting in the lobby. I had a King Room, much larger than almost any boutique hotel except the Roger Williams (still my favorite). The bed, bathroom, lovely bathrobes, everything was of excellent quality. BUT: the room key was a major fail - it didn't work every time I needed to get into my room. And OK, while I was sitting in the lobby waiting for someone to let me into my room a steady leak came from the restaurant above onto an adjacent lobby chair. BUT: the staff made it all right with a substantial gift certificate for my next stay for all the troubles. I would never pay $450/night. But I truly enjoyed my Eventi stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant new boutique hotel, great location, rooms, service”
Reviews.Author: JohnDMiami
Reviews.Content: This new hotel rocks! It's one of the best hotels you can stay at in NY without spending a small fortune. Rooms are chic, modern, comfortable, beds are large and comfy. Great views. And it's close to Madison Sq. Garden and the trains, as well as having Chelsea and Midtown on your doorstep. The staff are friendly and helpful, the restaurant is very elegant and stylish with excellent food and drink options. Finally, all this can be had for rates competitive with Holiday Inn Express and Holiday Inn, and far less than most higher end hotels in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Best NYC Hotel? Has To Be Close!”
Reviews.Author: Geordielass2
Reviews.Content: I wanted a Hotel that was close to Madisson Square Garden; Penn Station; 34th Street; Empire State; Macy's and the Subway. It had to be clean, stylish and quiet. The Eventi delivered it all by the truckload! All the staff and I mean all the staff did a great job and were very courteous and helpful which made me wonder if they were from out-of-town and not real New Yorkers! The beds are the equal best I have ever slept in anywhere in the world. Definitely on the softer side, but not the sort that collapse in the middle. Another plus was the great big windows that are all double glazed so outside noise was kept to an absolute minimum. Didn't even here the regular Ambulance or FDNYC vehicles going along 6th Ave. It was also great to be able to drop back in during the day for a 'freshen-up' and to drop off the shopping. Free Coffee in the mornings from the Lobby was a bonus as was the complimentary wine in the early evening. There is also an undercover parking garage around the corner if you have to bring your car into NYC! Downside? None really except that the rooms don't have a lot of storage space. It is adequate, but still had to use the suitcase to store some things. Also, the empty building site nearby is a bit of a pain, but we couldn't see it from our room. Is it perfect? No, there are always a few things that are not like home, but I will not be booking another Hotel in NYC for a long time to come.

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed.”
Reviews.Author: plewis46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a two day getaway at the Eventi. Everything was wonderful. We loved the location, the room, the lounge areas on the 3rd and 4th floors, but most of all we loved the service. Every single employee we encountered was a pleasure to deal with. Even a little mix up at check-in (I arrived first and the reservation was in my wife's name) was handled professionally. Just a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: 1TravelR001
Reviews.Content: Comfortable & excellent service. The room was quiet and the beds were very comfortable. All of the staff were extremely polite, helpful and efficient. We have travelled all over the world and we have to say that this hotel ranks right up there. We have stayed at the Kimpton in San Fran so we had high expectations for our stay in New York. We were thrilled. Make sure you try the Bar Basque on the 5th floor. We had dinner there this evening and we were amazed at the food quality and service. Great job Eventi! We will book again here without hesitation on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: hknudsen_24
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at Eventi and had a fabulous stay. We were in town for a special occasion and greatly appreciated the front desk staff moving us up to a higher floor with a better view. Loved the floor-to-ceiling windows for a great view of the Empire State Building. Room was super comfortable and spacious for NYC. It's a quick walk to two different subway stops, which made it easy to get around. Eventi will definitely be my first choice for our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice For a Midtown Location”
Reviews.Author: kenika91
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eventi on March 4-9. Smooth check-in. Upgraded to a high floor - 22nd floor to be exact. Room was the largest I've ever stayed in while in Manhattan. Views were outstanding. Complete Flatiron skyline view and an impressive view of The Empire State Building. Room itself - very very spacious. Bathrooms - all marble with terrific bath supplies. The maid service is top notch. The location was good. This was the first time I stayed in Midtown - earlier trips to the city have taken me to Soho, The Meatpacking District, and The Upper West Side. Dining at Bar Basque was cool. Went for drinks and light pupus before a night on the town. Definetly a "scene" kind of place. The little cafe next door is like a place from the future. Very sleek, clean, and efficent. Went there once for coffee and a bagel. The hotel is very close to all of Midtown - including Herald Square, MSG, and the Subway stop is a few block up Broadway. Little tip - if you're looking for a great dining experience, head to the ACE hotel a couple of blocks down Broadway and dine and the oyster place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysandrea
Reviews.Content: Great stay! When booking my room I was asked if i had any speical request, I jokingly replied that we would like a red carpet rolled out and a bag of money on the bed. To my surprise they actually had a red carpet rolled out in our suite as well as bags of chocolate coins! The staff was incredible, very helpful and friendly. Recommended great resturants, and palces to hangout. Room was very clean, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great time perfect location wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: TwoMillionMiles86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eventi while going to Westminster Dog show. Have stayed at other Kimpton hotels so expected the nice boutique, dog friendly, wine tasting experience and was not at all disappointed! Splurged on a city view corner room which was very cool with floor to ceiling windows. Front desk staff were most helpful with dinner reservations. Location is perfect for MSG but also walking to midtown and broadway. Some problems getting in at the restaurant but hotel staff solved that very quickly and then had outstanding service. All in all a great time. This is THE place to stay and we're already planning to return.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at a great hotel with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: fjy_nyc
Reviews.Content: The Eventi Kimpton is a gorgeous hotel my boyfriend and I stayed at after a friend told me they had a good time. Everything was so clean and modern, They had little snacks and lemon water at the lobby for those waiting or just relaxing reading the paper. The doormen and everyone there were very friendly and held the doors open for you. If you had a question or looked confused they would come to you and ask if you needed assistance. We received a free upgrade to the top floor which was the 23rd floor. We had a beautiful view of the Epmire State Building and the skyline of NYC. The room was different from any others I had been in at a hotel because the bed faces the floor to ceiling windows. Waking up and overlooking NYC at day and night was great. The bathroom was nice too. The room is a little small but it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “A gem near Madison Square Garden during Westminster Dog Show”
Reviews.Author: Savy4
Reviews.Content: Recently went to NYC for the Westminster Dog Show stayed at Eventi for it's closeness to Madison Square Garden. They are pet friendly ( as are all Klimpton hotels) was impressed with friendlyness of staff; decor of hotel and comfort of the bed. Although New York is infamous for the size of their hotel rooms; I was more then satisfied with our room's size and amenities. Wine hour every evening and they even remember your name when you attend; and they say New Yorkers can be rude_not at Eventi!

Reviews.Title: “you feel like a secure customer ..”
Reviews.Author: macmiller09
Reviews.Content: we had a great time, not knowing this new hotel at all. i was positive surprised from the friendliness, openness and support of staff at all. we stayed over new year, 5 nights and for me a hotel of must choice in NYC. on story to share, we felt very very good and as secured customer when one day we forgot the cam batterie in the room, while entering the room (was open due to cleaning), the cleaning lady asked kind, may i ask you to come out the room and check if this is your room. even she knew me from days before, i felt wowed, they take care about you and customers belongings ..

Reviews.Title: “a modern funky gem in New York”
Reviews.Author: leopoldmelborne
Reviews.Content: after staying on 43rd Street near TImes Square for 3 nights and then a couple of nights with friends in Union Square we decided to stay in a good Hotel last 2 nights of our trip to NYC before we flew out to London. Only found this Hotel by google and got good deal online and we were most pleasantly surprised when we got there. Got upgraded to a suite on high floors. Magnificent views and great size rooms.Very new and therefore very modern. We didn't eat at Hotel restaurant although it was busy as was the bar with locals and guests to that is always a good sign.If you do not like bright in your face color of red bar area is not for you but we loved it. On 6th Avenue cnr West 30th so quite central to everything without being in the thick of it. All in all great value for money for a modern somewhat funky 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel for work and fun”
Reviews.Author: MSTX123
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Like all Kimpton hotels, it's a very unique property. This one is in a great location for my business meetings plus it's centrally located for whatever I'm doing after business hours. I usually like to walk in New York, but this hotel is close to subway stop just in case it's raining or I'm going far. The service is great here. Last time I stayed I came down with a horrible cold. The bellman, in the middle of the night, offered to go get me some medicine. Although I still wasn't totally well, I was able to sleep through the night and make it to my business meeting the next day. My trip was a success. The gym is great too. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not a trendy hotel guy, but I still really enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, quite, and compfortable with good service. It might not be the trendiest hotel you'll ever see, but it's very cool. I would recomend it for weekday business stay or a fun weekend.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nytwind
Reviews.Content: We had a suite at the Eventi hotel for the Westminster dog show. The location was superb....less than a 5 minute walk to MSG. Pets were accepted and it was wonderful to see a Great Dane in the lobby which meant no silly size restrictions on dogs. The hotel was spotless and the staff exceedingly gracious and helpful. The suite was lovely and very well appointed.The marble bathroom was magnificently large with a whirlpool tub, separate shower, double sinks and a separate, enclosed toilet area. The major downfalls consisted of not nearly enough closet and storage space and there should be better lighting. We found it difficult to see our clothing in the closet area, one could not read by the lighting in the living area and although the lighting in the bedroom was fine for reading in bed, it was a bit dim in the rest of the room. When we mentioned upon check out that a coffee maker would have been nice, we were told that they were available upon request. It would have been better to have been made aware of that fact upon arrival. The attached bar and restaurant "Bar Basque" is not actually owned by the hotel but it was the absolute star of our places to eat and drink. The authentic Basque and Spanish cuisine was superb and the cocktails were inventive and delicious. We often brought people staying at other hotels to join us in the restaurant for drinks and tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Wish home was that nice!”
Reviews.Author: cocodarling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because my friend is part of their Kimpton In Touch program through which you can a night free every seven nights you spend at any Kimpton hotel (now, that's a real deal) and what a treat that was! Wonderful marble lobby and more marble in the hotel, great paintings, flower arrangements, sofa, fire place and the staff: simply delightful, very friendly, helpful. We had requested a double double and were upgraded to a double queen on the highest floor with a great view. Very large room, super comfy bed, loved the design of the bathroom, the size of the Etro amenities and.... The hotel had free hot chocolate in the lobby in the afternoon, followed by free happy hour from 5 to 6 pm and complimentary coffee from 7 to 9am. Although I don't have pets, I don't mind them and I thought the food and water bowls they had in the lobby was a very sweet gesture. What more would you wish for? I immediately signed on to their Kimpton In Touch Program and would advise you to do the same. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Eventi you deserve all your accolades”
Reviews.Author: Keen-for-travelling
Reviews.Content: Fantastic that is how is describe the Eventi! I am a total convert to Kimpton hotels! Such lovely staff. offered us an upgrade which made my little girls holiday, being able to look at the magnificent empire state buidling all lit up at night. This hotel just really knows how to look after its guests. Wonderfully quite in our room, and stylish decor. And a lesson in great guest relations with their "raid the minibar" offer-stroke of genius! Thankyou delightful Eventi!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gonegrrl
Reviews.Content: Took my 24yr son to NYC for his birthday, his first visit, I've been many times. I won't bother looking for any other hotel on my next visit. Every single detail of our stay was outstanding, the staff were warm and gracious and always available. The room was spacious and very well appointed, fist time I've stayed at any hotel and not had to ask for more pillows, there were plenty, the honour bar is well stocked, beds extremely comfortable. You can't beat the location, we walked from Penn Station and felt central to everything we did. Love Love Love the Eventi!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL FOR NYC! (&NYE!)”
Reviews.Author: ezf2010
Reviews.Content: We came to NY for NYE and we were closely located to MSG (our main purpose of the trip). It wasn't far from Times Square either, and it was in a great location. The hotel was clean, professional, and accommodating. It was cool to see that it allowed pets, and was pet friendly...now that I know that, I will bring my dog with me next time I come to NY for leisure! I recommend this hotel........and the place to eat next door (the food parc....YUM!)

Reviews.Title: “what an hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jjdelobelle
Reviews.Content: last week my wife and I wanted to have a drink in our eventi hotel. we went to the bar basque and ordered a drink at 9.45 pm, at 9.55 a girl of the hotel arrived and said "you gotta to leave at 10 pm, we have a private party there and this place is fully booked"....couldn't they have told us before the order !!!!! it is just i grab your money and kick you off they will never see us again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel--trendy, clean, great staff, cool amenities”
Reviews.Author: fun2travel_11
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of my husband's birthday celebration based on reviews and pics I had seen of the hotel, and we were not disappointed! It is one of nicest hotels we have been to and we would definitely stay there again (and in fact we will definitely check out other Kimpton hotels if we ever get a chance to do so). The decor is very trendy and the complimentary beverage stations (hot chocolate, wine, and coffee/tea) are a great touch. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and helpful and went above and beyond to make sure we had a wonderful stay. I can't say enough good things about it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Techno, sheek hotel location. Walk to everything downtown”
Reviews.Author: 12533Travelman56
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. Helpful, cheerful and welcoming staff. A great way to stay in Manhattan without the craziness and prices of midtown. We had a corner room with a view of the Empire State Building, awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Welcome”
Reviews.Author: sitnie
Reviews.Content: Booked room at Eventi with my Kimpton InTouch points. Very gracious staff, warm welcome and personal details (wine and fruit in our room as I had casually mentioned we were coming for a girls' reunion weekend - what a nice surprise!) Room was quiet, comfortable, on a major street and very convenient to subway, Penn Station, Times Square, Chelsea/Flatiron, etc. Nice touch was very large padded headboards which provided extra soundproofing. Bedside reading lights nice (we had 2 queen beds). The only bad things were that they ran out of glasses for the evening wine reception and ran out of hot water, milk, etc. for coffee in the morning. I was surprised that when I mentioned the lack of coffee/tea elements they did not seem overly concerned and did not seem to be doing anything about it. When I mentioned it again, they said they were getting some but I waited 10 minutes in the lobby and none appeared (although there were many staff nearby chatting amongst themselves). They were friendly and nice though -- so maybe it was someone else's job to stock the lobby beverages? All in all - a great place to stay in NYC, friendly, comfortable, with personal service (with exception of drinks!)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible room, great price, excellent location, super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LT_Villa
Reviews.Content: The Eventi was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. Our bed was super comfortable, the room was always clean, and the staff was amazing to deal with. Great value, excellent location, best part of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay - definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: Amy127
Reviews.Content: This is a great property. Room was clean and well-appointed, bed was extremely comfortable, view of the Empire State Building was an added bonus. Staff very friendly and helpful, we will make this our "go to hotel" when visiting Manhattan. Last month we stayed at Fashion 26, which we thought was a nice property. The Eventi outshines Fashion 26. Also, this was my birthday get away, and the staff kindly left a card and a complimentary bottle of champagne in the room. A very nice touch. Stay here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Oh no Please let me out of here”
Reviews.Author: didcrywolf
Reviews.Content: We are HUGE Kimpton fans and we will litteraly rearrange my itinerary to stay in some of their fabulous properties but this has been a disaster from the get-go. I have never written a sour grapes letter AS I FIND THEM TIRESOME but here this is self-medication if not pure vindication. My friend believes nobody can have worst luck than this so bare with me and draw your own conclusions. It started with the reservation. We needed to extend our stay an extra day so a month before the stay date, I sent an email which remained ignored ,2 weeks to stay date, I resent another and I had to get on a tag phone with our NYGF (New York gift Show) reservation agent and the Kimpton agent.. Took 90 minutes to sort things out. WE finally show up. The room is the wrong one. We had asked for a corner room and we got a tiny 1 king. There is no way this is 300 Sq ft... we measured it under 250ft. On the 4th day we will get the right one... tic-toc-tic-toc While the check-in staff was Kimpton nice and efficient things weren't going our way. While on the 22nd floor, we can hear all the sounds of the street and many fire engines over the course of the first two nights. I call for a shoe shine with instruction to have shoes returned at 8AM . They were found at 11 AM when I had already left. At 3:00 AM ( ok I will give them a break) my wife needs water for her medication and we realize thAT WE DON'T have the mini-bar key.
