No big deal, we calll the front desk, so we doze off. 30 minutes later, my wife complains she really wants the water. I call down and within another 15 minutes two diferent bellhops show up with different keys...Intersting hotels where tow bell hops are tied up at 3AM... Are they hopping to it? The following day I come back with a client to watch a sporting event before dinner. AT 4PM the rooms wasn't made. I called downstairs to let them know so we scramble to find a bar to watch the game... No big deal,,, but things add up. While the view is very nice, the bathroom has no shelf space. There is nowhere to put your toiletries. The water pressure on the 22 floor leaves something to be as quick as the 3 elevators that serve the whole 24 floor hotels. Not a place to be in a rush. . Finally we have put up the sound up on the TV because we have been privy to too many conversations of our next door neighbors. While we will return to our top three favorite Kimpton properties in FL, MA, IL, we wouldn't take a free week at the Eventi here ever! DCW When

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmcape
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eventi for 2 nights in January with husband and two girls, ages 9 & 11. From the moment we drove up to the front door, to the moment we checked out, we were helped by friendly, welcoming staff. We arrived early, but they had a room ready for us. Needed help with restaurant choices, found two terrific ones from front desk. The rooms were lovely and clean, great bathrooms and shower, but best of all were the beds. Wonderfully comfortable. Will highly recommend this hotel to friends. Look forward to returning for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- clean, modern, terrific service and hip!”
Reviews.Author: Dan35805
Reviews.Content: Terrific find in Chelsea- near all transportation- Penn Station, PATH trains, subway- walking distance to mid-town, Murray Hill area and theater district. Was in for 2 days of business and had breakfast both days- very good. FFree WiFi for Kimpton InTouch members and wine party each night a nice touch. Bar is hopping at night!

Reviews.Title: “NYC Great Get Away Stay”
Reviews.Author: luannryan
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel to stay at with my two daughters for a girls get a way. Good location very easy access and extremely helpful staff at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “The Eventi makes the W look like a "Motel 6"!”
Reviews.Author: mjorao
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect from the moment we checked in. Upon arriving from a very late flight from Los Angeles, the front desk clerk informed us that the king bed room we requested was not available. Of course we thought the worst instead before we could flinch she apologized and told us she would be upgrading us to a king bed in a junior suite! The service the rest of our stay was equally great! From the friendly doorman to the always smiling housekeepers to the unique and fabulous bar! It is now tops on our list of New York hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton people make the difference”
Reviews.Author: HuskerChuck
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location, but the Kimpton people make the difference. Very warm and welcoming and always willing to help. Great hotel and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy botique hotel in just the right spot for Manhattan travel”
Reviews.Author: SOneil
Reviews.Content: Great service -- very warm and inviting from the trendy furnishings to the pleasant staff. The room service was excellent and my group enjoyed the patio/bar area - especially the wine tasting (free in lobby and for purchase at bar). My room was large (suite) for a NY hotel and the bathroom was magnificent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: babybrooklynbear
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a quick trip into NYC for my husband's 30th birthday and we couldn't have been happier with our stay. We were told that we'd been automatically upgraded to a city-view room and when the concierge found out it was his birthday, he let us know he'd have a bottle of wine sent up to our room, on the house. We stayed on the 15th floor in a corner king room with an great view of the Empire State Building. It was surprisingly quiet in the room for being right in midtown. The pillowtop bed was so comfortable and the extras like the ipod dock were very nice. We couldn't recommend this hotel more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pounchkee
Reviews.Content: Trendy, nicely appointed rooms and lobby! Clean, large bathrooms especially for NYC. Great food court with many choices for a quick bite or drink next door. Fantastic free wine tasting in the evening. Great friendly staff. Have reccomended to friends and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Calm space with a friendly touch - perfect for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: sbt_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was professional, authentic and friendly. The room was kept in top shape over the entire week, with small touches left for me each day in anticipation of things I might want or might run out of. The concierge was so genuinely friendly and went out of her way to help me with instructions and timetables for train travel. And - business travelers will appreciate - the internet service was fast and completely reliable. I didn't have to think about it once after my initial sign-in. All-in-all a great place to stay - one I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: RyanMarin
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed many Kimptions on the west coast and decided to try the Eventi for a business trip. Staff was fantastic - I was upgraded to a nice corner room with a view on the 15th floor due to my Kimpton status. The rooms were clean and functional and the beds were very comfortable with great sheets. The bathrooms were good - most elements were upgraded with the exception of the tile/granite which was slightly dated. The hotel restaurant/bar was adequate - high end and a little sterile. It lacked much energy. Location of the hotel was fine. The redline Lexington subway to mid-town was a 6 block walk which was not convenient in the winter snow. Fantastic wine bar a few blocks away is "Wine 30". I would take this location over the touristy Times Square area any time.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a light sleeper stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: vorsoni
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels but this one, though very trendy and totally a hot spot for its amazing Basque Restaurant, has major issues with noise insulation. I basically did not sleep the first night (though I specifically informed the check-in agent that I had an early TV interview the day after and I needed the quietest room). The agent did not care at all about my request and blatantly lied to me confirming I would get a quiet room. I was between elevators AND an electric panel. Crackling noises came up at midnight from the electric panel, the hotel was full and I could not change rooms. I ended up sleeping in the bathroom on the cold and hard marble to at least catch a few minutes of rest. The day after I was changed to another room....overlooking construction work that went on 24/24!!!! Because of the snow storm that came in the hotel was full and I could not change room. Needless to say I was exhausted after 3 nights in this hotel. The snow storm came in, I was stuck in the city and asked the guest services to extend my stay by 2 nights. I had to deal with non responsive agents who truly did not care that I was a good Kimpton member or not. I was given contradictory information as to whether the hotel was full or not. Had to wait until 3 am to know if I could get a room or not. Of course it ended up being "no". No help was provided to help me relocate to another Kimpton property. As much as the Ink 48 is amazing, this one suffers from the "I don't care attitude" of its employees.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable chic - excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveller23
Reviews.Content: Came into town for a friend's birthday party, and deviated from our normal stay at the W hotel. Loved the classy/trendy decor similar to the W, but with welcoming staff and unpretentious atmosphere. Has a very comfortable feel while with a modern edge. Complimentary coffee in the AM, snacks in afternoon, and wine in evening were great touches. Chelsea is great location, and the concierge recommended 2 excellent places for dinner and drinks. Rooms are small but the bed was the most comfortable ever, and the bathrooms are enormous. I am forever sold on Kimpton hotels going forward...

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: MelissaW
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Kimpton chain. The staff are always remarkably friendly and professional and the hotels are just plain fun. Eventi is in a great location and the view from my room was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of the Kimpton Brand...”
Reviews.Author: MRFTraveler
Reviews.Content: Watch your credit card after dealing with the Eventi. It's hard to know whether the problem is management incompetence or unscrupulous business practices, but the result is the same: a hotel not worthy of the ethical standards that the Kimpton chain aspires to. I recently booked a two-night stay at the Eventi on the Kimpton website, which I cancelled well within the allowable period. I was nevertheless charged for both nights as a no-show. Three calls to the accounting department aimed at correcting the problem went unreturned. As did a call to the manager. And a request through the Kimpton In-Touch service agent. I've never experienced such a profound lack of responsiveness from a supposed four-star hotel. It makes me wary of staying at a Kimpton Hotel again. Caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Sarnia61
Reviews.Content: We had several rooms at the Eventi hotel in December. In the height of the busiest time in New York, the service and staff couldn't have been better or more helpful. Check in was a breeze and we happened to check in during their free happy hour in the lobby so we were able to enjoy a great glass of wine. Free coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon was a great little bonus. The rooms were extremely spacious for NY standards, great bed and linens, flat screen HD TV and plenty of counter top space in the bathrooms. The location in very central - close to Macys and the Empire State Building within a very short walk. I don't often do reviews - I just felt for the money - we all thought the rooms were spacious, comfortable and the service just great.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Luxury Conveniently Located near Pennsylvania Station”
Reviews.Author: kralljosh
Reviews.Content: Our overnight at the Eventi couldn't have been better. It has three things going for it: location, ambiance and an outgoing, professional staff. Traveling as a family of four can be difficult most of the time and more work than fun. Booking a room at the Eventi allowed us to walk from Pennsylvania Station without having to hail a cab to our hotel, even after a major snow storm, without any trouble. We attempted to check in several hours early, expecting only to be allowed to store our luggage, but we were offered an upgraded room, a suite rather than a double queen, so that we could immediately have a home away from home. This was such a pleasant and welcoming surprise for a couple with two children. The kids had a place to change clothes, use the restroom, prepare the fold out couch to crash on later that night and they were impressed by the city views to be seen right from our hotel room. For the adults, there is no better gift when on a family vacation than offering separate sleeping quarters for the children. My wife and I had a restful night's sleep...in private. When I booked the hotel room, the Eventi was not my first choice, although I have stayed at Kimpton Hotels in the past and have had great experiences. I have a list of hotels in my mind that I have never had the opportunity to sample, but when I tried to book these rooms, all of them refused to cater to a family of four. I am so pleased that the Eventi not only offered my family a place to stay but that it was steeped in such luxurious amenities and with a staff from the front desk, to room service, to the concierge, that did everything to make us feel welcome. Our trip to New York was a great success, in large part because of the Eventi staff. Thank you for making our holiday break a truly memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful Kimpton Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jayhawk_obrien
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service. Great location in NYC. In the middle of the blizzard when good service went out the door at shops and restaurants, Eventi was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed - Great”
Reviews.Author: GulliverBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to the states and our second stay at a Kimpton hotel, 7 nights in New York and we were not disappointed. The rooms were of a good size and very clean and comfortable. Its location is great, walking distance to all that you need, subway, times square etc. The staff were truly fantastic and were always more than happy to do that bit extra, they are to be congratulated. Of course you can't go past the Kimpton happy hou,r a must do to meet other travellers (Mark and Beck where are you?). we booked online and the cost for New York was pretty good. We would have not problems recommending this hotel and if our second stay is anything to go by the whole Kimpton chain, again well done Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: victorjm
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my Wife and 2 dogs. We spent 3 nights and were treated well the whole time. Nice restaurant. Nice room. Nice staff. Great Location. My wife enjoyed the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, fantastic location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Sycam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi hotel in November for a girl's trip to NYC and loved every minute. The hotel staff were very accommodating and we got a special request honoured as it was my birthday. When we got to the room there was a handwritten note and some treats to welcome us as well as a banner saying Happy bday which was great. Interior design is fantastic and the bed was the most comfortable I have slept in for a long while. The hotel definitely sells an 'experience' and it lives up to it. Only minor issue was with the service in the restaurant which we tried once for breakfast - but again because they messed up we were not charged. Very classy joint but without the stuffiness. Some great touches as well like the wine tasting which is complimentary. Will be planning a spring break to NY and looking to book to go back again. You must go to this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “I recommend without hesitation!”
Reviews.Author: AnonEeMouse
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with my husband. First impressions as we entered the lobby were of a modern, trendy hotel. On checking in we were told we had been upgraded free of charge, which was a nice surprise. The room we stayed in was on the 22nd floor (this is possibly not a good hotel if you don't like heights!) and had fabulous views across the city from its floor-to-ceiling windows. It was surprisingly spacious, with a king size bed not overly dominating the room. In addition to the bed there was a reading chair, a desk with chair, wardrobe (containing safe) and a sideboard with mini-bar. The bathroom contained a huge shower (big enough for one person to shower comfortably in while the other could sit on a wooden stool in the shower area). The toiletries were nice. The overall decor of the room felt a quite 'masculine' but was non-offensive and obviously new. The location of the hotel was fabulous, just a short walk to Times Square and central enough that we managed to walk pretty much everywhere we wanted to see. I would definitely stay in this hotel if I returned to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Service. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa703VA
Reviews.Content: I am familiar with the Kimpton chain and was excited to discover this new location in NYC. It's a nice, modern and new hotel. We dined at both restaurants and the food was excellent, not just good. The morning coffee and evening wine service made us feel welcome. We were sorry to be out holiday shopping and missed the afternoon hot chocolate! The location is awesome. We spent time uptown in Midtown and Time Square and downtown. A concert in the evening at Madison Sq Garden was only a two blocks away. This central Chelsea location made it easy to walk to all locations. It's worth it to join the Intouch Loyalty program for the extra benefits and to gain points with each stay.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Very Good”
Reviews.Author: consigliare
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth Kimpton Hotel we have stayed at, and we appreciate how well they are run. Even though the pull out sofa(for our children to sleep on) was not made when we got back in our room the first night, a quick phone call was followed by immediate action to rectify the situation. When they apologized for this oversight, you got the feeling that they really meant it. The Eventi is a new hotel. The restaurant was good, but not great, and a little pricey. Location was very good as it is close to the subway. Staff was excellent and helpful. Can't go wrong here and pricing for what we got was very good, especially for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: LemonTheDog
Reviews.Content: The accommodations are nice. The rooms are comfortable. I'll definitely return as I'm a strong advocate for Kimpton Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Southern-style hospitality in NYC”
Reviews.Author: 7and9panthers
Reviews.Content: The entire Eventi staff has been well-trained in the fundamentals of top-notch hospitality, from a friendly initial greeting to a farewell at chekout. The level of quality was uniformly high and seamless, from the Front Desk, Concierge, Room Service, Bellman, and Valet Parking. For this Southerner finding a warm boutique hotel in NYC helped make my trip a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, The Eventi is the BEST!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: npggirl
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived to the time we left we felt like "friends" not guests. The Eventi team was fabulous, welcoming and knowledgable! The hotel was fabulous, modern, super clean and just all-around SUPERB! We went to NY for a concert at Madison Square and the walk time to our location from the Eventi was about 4 minutes tops! What a great location! Thank you Eventi staff! We enjoyed our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend away from kids.”
Reviews.Author: wbillpat99
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel after reading the great reviews. My wife and I loved this place from the moment we entered. The receptionist was nice and very funny. The room had floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. When we had a problem opening the in room safe, security came up and fixed the problem in minutes. Overall a wonderful place to stay we had a great weekend in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Glomawr
Reviews.Content: Took my annual trip to NYC for an educational meeting and some theatre. This was the first year our group had chosen the Eventi as our headquarters. Its not often that you remember the names of hotel staff, but Dwayne, Omar, Erik and TJ made my stay very special and took extra good care of my son and daughter in law who joined me. See you guys next year! I am from a tiny town in remote eastern kentucky but you made me feel like the mayor of Nu Yawk!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eventi”
Reviews.Author: crillon24
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Eventi with my husband while visiting friends in December. Our room was perfect. Best thing about the room is the distance from the door to the bed. There was no hallway noise at all, as a matter of fact, I didn't hear any other guests during our stay, but I saw them in the hallways and in the elevator so I know they were there. Very thoughtful design. Our room was large (I think we upgraded), it was very clean, had a terrific view, a VERY comfy bed, and a great bathroom. Service was great throughout the hotel. Loved the location, it was very convenient to all the places we wanted to go. We were later than planned and our friends waited for us in the bar. They had appetizers and drinks and loved it. Wifi was reliable and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale & brand new - spacious rooms, great staff & amazing restaurant, too.”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeFrappe
Reviews.Content: Wow! I stayed here for 4 nights in November for business, and was so glad I did! My room was large with a nice layout, big closet, desk, flat-screen TV, and pretty view. Incredibly clean, too! Most importantly, the bathroom had a huge walk-in shower, and also featured a make-up mirror and great lighting. (Thank you, Kimpton!!). The lobby, roof terrace and meeting rooms are must-see, (even if you don't have to attend a meeting). Also, my friend and I had drinks at the bar / restaurant, and had a fabulous time. Really impressive with friendly (no attitude) staff! Talk about cutting edge architecture! In addition, the hotel also is adjacent to a very modern "cafe" style restaurant, that's very cool with an interesting atmosphere. As long as you like the Chelsea location, the hotel works just fine - it is also a few blocks from the subway and a few small deli / pizza places for cheap eats. Special thanks to the hotel's night manager, Adnan Ali, who was especially helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TDL67
Reviews.Content: The Eventi was recommended by a friend who works for another Kimpton property in Dallas, and I must say the hotel exceeded my expectations! I was traveling to NYC on business and the location of the hotel made getting to-and-from my meetings very easy. The staff was really top-notch from the doorman, front desk staff to housekeeping, everyone I encountered made my stay a pleasure. My room was spacious, extremely clean and comfortable. Not only will I stay here when I return , I highly recommend it to anyone heading NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: parisis888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on December 2 for the weekend. This is the best hotel we have ever stayed at in New York. I had booked the Premier One Bedroom Suite with 1 King bed. Wow!!! It was everything we hoped for and more. The size of the suite was amazing. The only negative point for us was the location - we didn't always feel safe. But having said that, I think we would still stay here the next we come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable Bed I've Ever Slept In.”
Reviews.Author: Outerhawk
Reviews.Content: The staff and service people at Eventi are the most knowledgeable, up to date and attentive group of people I have ever been with. Every detail was taken into account. But, the best thing of all was the bed. By far twas the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. I would recommend Eventi to friends and family in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pemdoc
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed the moment we walked into the hotel. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Decor was fantastic. Room was beautifully decorated. The bed and linen was comfortable and luxurious. We had to ship some gifts home and the staff went out of their way to help us with boxes, tape, packing. Concierge was very helpful. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. Great hotel, staff and location. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the BEST stay in NY - Just a Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Testify202
Reviews.Content: If you are plannin a visit to NYC and want the perfect location, the perfect hotel, and the perfect, most kind and capable staff, it would be a huge mistake to stay anywhere else. I'm in NY on business monthly and usually stay at another Kimpton Hotel property. My corporate travel agency made a mistake on my reservations so I called the hotel directly, hoping that there would be space. No such luck, so they immediately referred me to the Eventi, a sister hotel. But not only did they refer me, the gentleman actually made the reservation for me while I was on the line with him. I arrived at the hotel to an elegant lobby, and a warm and friendly staff that saw to every detail of my short stay. Everything about this hotel is AMAZING!! The perfect location, just two short blocks to Madison Square Garden, the rooms are very large and extremely comfortable, and again, every member of the staff just incredible! Stay at the Eventi - You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Chic & Contemporary and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Dorette
Reviews.Content: From entering the lobby, guests are met with meet and greet personnel and provided with personable attention. Rooms are lovely, spacious and the beds incredibly comfortable! Whilst the hotel boasts a complimentary lobby service; there was morning coffee provided, but I do feel it would have been nice to have been offered a croissant/danish pastry to complement. There is, however, a Starbucks very close by. On the whole, perhaps we didn't explore the hotel's full amenities on this trip. This hotel has a great location and I would certainly recommend to any first time traveller to the city or indeed to those on business. Both staff and it's clientel were extremely friendly! I would most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaGirl123
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for exploring New York. The hotel is located midtown which is perfect for exploring upper Manhattan or going down to SoHo, Chelsea, and Chinatown. Having a hotel in the middle of Manhattan helps as you don't have to travel as much up and down the borough if you need to change before dinner or drop off all the stuff you bought. There aren't many restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel but there is a great Portuguese restaurant attached to Eventi. The hotel has a happy hour every day 5pm to 6pm and they offer free wine. There is also free tea and coffee offered every morning. The rooms are spacious by New York standards. The bed is very comfortable and linens are soft. The bathrooms are modern and have all the amenities. I really enjoyed the shower head attached to the ceiling. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hesitant to return”
Reviews.Author: Workerbee3
Reviews.Content: We got a great " soft opening" rate but I would never pay close to the standard rate to stay here. Our A/C was annoying and possibly broken, it would cycle on and off repeatedly. The closet light was on a motion sensor/timer so if you didn't get your clothes promptly it was a bit of a black hole. No coffee in room, you had to go to the lobby at appointed times, and they ran out both mornings we were there. Room was luxuriously appointed and decent sized, but the small things would make us hesitant to return at such exorbitant rates. Relatively convenient to subway lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: curlymama
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NYC and had a wonderful stay at the Eventi. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. Great location and the restaurant was wonderful and very convenient. Coffee in the lobby in the am as well as happy hour every night from 5-6. They are even pet friendly! I will definitely stay here again. I got a great rate by calling the hotel directly and asking about their specials.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new Kimpton Property”
Reviews.Author: patman35
Reviews.Content: Kimpton has done it again with another truly well-organized and top-notch facility. Rooms were clean and well-appointed, and I enjoyed the spa-like design in the very contemporary bathrooms. Staff as helpful and welcoming as at any other Kimpton property I've visited (many) and I will definitely consider staying here again when I am in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Addition to the Kimpton Family”
Reviews.Author: KimptonFan
Reviews.Content: This new hotel was everything I expect from a Kimpton Hotel---warm, elegant, welcoming, and worth every penny. The attentive but unobtrusive service essures that solo travelers feel comfortable and secure. This is now a personal favorite of mine.

Reviews.Title: “We were blown away by the good service.”
Reviews.Author: robeenos
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a trip to NYC for his 40th birthday. I decided on a Kimpton hotel because we are Kimpton InTouch members and the rate I found at the last-minute was really good. I mentioned the 40th birthday in my reservation, and also that we would be on a redeye. When we arrived at 9am, our room was ready by 11am during the busy Thanksgiving weekend. Everyone was so friendly and the place was bustling. Once getting into our room, the thing that struck us was the view of Manhattan from the floor-to-ceiling windows. It was so cool! And the beds were beyond comfortable! Later that night we were told there was a delivery for us, and waiting in our room was a bottle of champagne, snacks, and a birthday card for my husband from the hotel. It was a special little touch that really blew us away. It was such a thoughtful detail that compelled me to write this review. I couldn't say enough nice things about our stay. It was nice that a few days after we got back there was a good review in the LA Times about the hotel as well! Our first Kimpton hotel experience was in Seattle earlier this year and we've really been blown away by their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fabulous location, great price”
Reviews.Author: bonkin11
Reviews.Content: the eventi is new and in a terrific location in nyc. i got a great deal online and stayed there for $200 including breakfast. the restaurant is very cool and the food was really good. i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with great location for everything in NY.”
Reviews.Author: everythingfabulous
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The fitness room and business center were very well appointed and the services both offered were wonderful. How often do you have nice big windows that look out on a green space and large projection screen? The corridors were thoughtfully appointed and with ample light. Every service person was friendly and helpful and the complimentary wine and coffee every day were an extra added bonus. Great location to the trains for everything that we wanted to do. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “I like the hotel. it's new with a good bathroom and a beautiful decoration.”
Reviews.Author: MariaAmeliaBrasilia
Reviews.Content: The room is not so big, but for NY I think is OK. The location its not so bad, but area is not so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Bunker_Babe_and_Dude
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED this hotel. It was new and smelt like it! The room was hip and contempory. The bed was luxurious. The shower was hot and strong. The heater in the room worked great, so the room was nice and toasty - just the way we like it! The hotel itself is located close to almost everthing of interest in New York (shopping/restaurants etc ...) - which was convenient. More importantly' - it was the service that impressed us the most. We arrived in the wee hours of the morning. The bell-boy rushed out to get our bags from the shuttle. We were immediately given a room despite check-in being much later in the afternoon. We were also allowed to check out a little later than usual. The staff was just super accomodating! Thank you Eventi! All said - we were on our way to Europe so we did not stay long - but the short stay at the Eventi was a visit we will not forget. We certainly will return and recommend the hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “I Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: MLFCDT
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The staff were fantastic. Everyone greeted you with a smile and always willing to help. We had a beautiful suite on the top floor with a view of the city. The location is perfect, easy to get to everywhere. On my next trip to NYC, this will be the place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal treatment from attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: lucjkytraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi over Thanksgiving weekend with my extended family. I agree with all of the glowing reviews of the facilities and accommodations stated in the earlier reviews. I would like to add one experience that captures the spirit of this new hotel, trying its hardest to make it in New York. After dinner on Thanksgiving, my family, including 3 young children and a teenager, was enjoying dessert in the lounge next to one of the banquet rooms. The staff saw us and brought up a cart with a pumpkin pie and sparkling cider for us. This gracious act made us feel especially welcomed and comfortable in the hotel. In addition, the breakfast buffet, which was included in our room price was excellent. I have regularly stayed in another NYC hotel, but they have never shown any appreication for my loyalty. In contrast, the Eventi not only accommodated my requests but anticipated them, as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: TD60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a wonderful Thanksgiving weekend at the Eventi, an upscale boutique hotel in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan. Our corner City View Deluxe King Room was quite spacious by NYC standards with a full, floor to ceiling window overlooking Sixth Avenue, the NYC skyline to the east, and the Empire State Building. The room was nicely decorated in a contemporary theme with a very comfortable king-size bed. The modern marble, bathroom was also quite large for NYC. The huge, two-person, glass-enclosed shower featured a rain showerhead and a teak wood bench. My wife really appreciated the plush bathrobes and Etro bath products too. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. The Eventi is centrally located near the many interesting shops and eateries of Flatiron, Madison Square Park, Gramercy Park, and Union Square Park. The hotel is also within walking distance of several Michelin 1-Star restaurants. On Friday night we had an amazing Italian dinner at “A Voce” near Madison Square Park. After shopping on Saturday, we had a delicious late lunch at the nearby Gramercy Tavern. I highly recommend dining at one or both of these fine restaurants during your stay at the Eventi. The Eventi’s exceptional service was the most notable aspect of our stay. The front desk staff, wine reception hosts, and bellmen were gracious, accommodating, professional, and friendly. The housekeeping staff was also exceptional. Overall, this was a great stay in a great location. We’ll definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoniaBee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi for three nights, and enjoyed my stay overall. The hotel was modern and clean and had decent room service. The bathrooms were great, equipped with huge double headed showers. The bed was also great. It had nice bedding and was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I also enjoyed the free wine reception each evening. The only negative to this hotel was the location. It was described to be in mid-town, but was really in between mid-town and Chelsea. This location made it nearly impossible to catch a cab in the morning, all of the cabs were full before they reached the hotel. Also, if you are not used to the noise of the city I would recommend a room on the backside of the hotel, as the room facing the street were quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “An Anniversary to Remember!”
Reviews.Author: pattytony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent visitors to NY and decided to try a different area of the City on our most recent trip in November. Although I was a bit hesitant at first to veer from our more familiar stomping grounds nearer Central Park, all my reluctance flew out the window the moment we stepped foot in Eventi. The entire staff, beginning with the doorman, were extremely accommodating and welcoming. Upon check-in, we were happily surprised by the news that we were being upgraded! We went out for the afternoon and when we returned around 6:00pm, we opened our hotel room door and were met with rose petals lavishly strewn on the carpets and the bed, a bottle of champagne chilling in a bucket, strawberries with chocolates, and a hand-written note from the hotel manager. Apparently when Eventi's reservationists ask, "Are you celebrating a special occasion?", they actually pay attention! Eventi's careful attention to its guests and its obvious desire to please their customers created a very romantic atmosphere! The room was appointed beautifully. Both the bedding and the pillows were luxurious and made us not want to leave! The room was also equipped with wi-fi, well-placed electrical outlets (no awkward fumbling behind the nightstands), great reading lights on either side of the bed, and a bathroom to die for -- large walk-in shower with rain-shower heads as well as regular shower head. The toiletries and bath towels were also of high quality. We took advantage of another perk of Eventi's -- the complimentary wine cocktail hour held in their welcoming lobby each day from 5:00-6:00pm. Great way to unwind from the day before heading out again in the evening! We highly recommend you try this boutique hotel on your next visit to NYC -- better yet, plan a visit to NYC just to stay at Eventi!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton scores again!”
Reviews.Author: SempreItalia
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay the night in the City before leaving for a trip to Phoenix. The decision to stay at Eventi was the right one. We booked a one bedroom suite and were accommodated with early check in. I dropped the luggage and returned the car back home. When we returned an hour later we were greeted with a very nice "it's wonderful to see you again". In-house car service to the airport was perfect as was the overall experience. The room was phenominal with a very large bathroom which included both a whirpool tub and a dual head shower, huge bed, sitting area and two LCD TVs. If you're looking for a good spot in NYC don't think twice about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: MSamar0472
Reviews.Content: Staff is absolutely amazing! Everyone is so friendly and so accomodating! When they say pet friendly they really mean it - the staff is all over my 10-mos old English bulldog and a bed, dishes, treats and toys were waiting in the room when we arrived. My friends booked online and didn't realize that they didn't get an email confirmation - apparently it did not go through properly and there was no record of it. The hotel was sold out but the front office manager, Nika, really went above and beyond and saved my friend's birthday and when she heard it was his birthday, sent up a bucket of beer with a handwritten note apologizing for the inconvenience (which was not even the hotel's fault). On top of the wonderful staff and service, the hotel itself and the rooms are modern, sleek, very comfortable and immaculately clean. The location is great. The wine reception is a very nice added touch. I don't think you will find a better hotel for the price, which I think is very reasonable for NYC and a bargain for this level of quality. I've been back once already and will return many, many more times!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: kruemel78
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the Eventi for a quick Thanksgiving getaway. The staff could not have been more welcoming and kind. Our room, a one bedroom suite was absolutely gorgeous and well thought through. From the placement of the electric outlets to the layout of the suite, to all amenites, we could not have been more pleased with our accommodations. What a nice surprise to have our favorite treads waiting in our room. Fruit, cheese and red wine, sooo yummy. It looks like the manager Victor paid close attention to our Kimpton In Touch preferences and his handwritten welcome letter was extremely kind. I was very impressed with the service we received at all times, for example: We forgot our toothbrushes and called the front desk to request them. Our request was fulfilled within a couple of minutes but this is what most people would expect at a topnotch Hotel like the Eventi. What stood out for me were the small details such as the follow up call I received after the toothbrush was delivered. The lady who called us back verified that we received the item and asked if there is anything else we might need. Every employee we encountered was nice and professional but there were a few people who really stood out. I already mentioned the manager Victor but in addition I need to thank Adnan at the front desk for going above and beyond during our entire stay. It was also a pleasure to meet Stefanie at the front desk and the bartender, I believe his name is Jose, was great. A must stay when you are in NY. Thank you for a perfect stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Area”
Reviews.Author: lilturbo
Reviews.Content: I often stay in this area as it is close to work and have now stayed at most higher end hotels in the area in an attempt to find my favorite. Eventi has now become my go to hotel for a stay in mid town. I highly suggest the small upgrade fee for the corner rooms which do feel more spacious and the desk in these rooms looks out the window which is my preference. They are also incredibly well laid out and street noise is quieter than many other hotels. I love the design! My only complaints, though minor would be: 1) The noise from the air conditioner units can sometimes be louder than many other hotels, seems strange as they are new 2) I would not consider the curtains to be blackout drapes and they do let light through 3) There is simply too much paper signage in the rooms, most of which ironically talk about their environmental efforts

Reviews.Title: “Could be great with a little tweaking”
Reviews.Author: WesternSkies
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is excellent. We had a City View Deluxe King Room on the 14th Floor with a good view of the Empire State Building. The room, which was very clean, comfortable and quiet, was as big as could be expected for New York City, although lacking in closet space. The bathroom was very nice; it had a two headed shower which was much appreciated. The staff were friendly and helpful The location is a mixed bag - close to nothing, but convenient to everything. It is near Penn Station and within easy walking distance to Times Square and within moderate walking distance to Central Park and the museums nearby. Some criticism is, however, in order. First, I was surprised that at about 10:00 a.m. one morning, a note was slipped under the door telling us that because our do not disturb light was on when housekeeping came by, we would have to notify the front desk if we wanted our room cleaned. I felt like my mother was chiding me for oversleeping. At any other hotel, housekeeping simply would have come by later. Second, I see no reason why, at a first rate hotel in New York City, the restaurant, or at least the bar, should not be open through the afternoon. It is offputting to be told, rather bursquely, at 3:45 p.m. that "We don't start serving until 4." And I see no reason that the bar should not remain open after midnight on weeknights. If one goes to the opera or theatre on a weeknight and wants a drink at the lounge when returning to the hotel, one is out of luck, especially considering there are no decent bars nearby. Come on folks - this is not the Shady Rest Hotel in Hooterville. New York is the city that never sleeps, after all. Finally, we twice went to breakfast in the restaurant. Both times, the wait for food was way too long, even though the second time we were the only ones in the restaurant. Also, breakfast was served in an admittedly nice atrium area which, however, had marble tables which were cold and sucked the heat out of the food, which was barely warm to begin with because it took so long arriving. The above annoyances were minor, but spell the difference between an excellent hotel and a great one.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service, just niggles”
Reviews.Author: FolkeVet
Reviews.Content: Eventi is a new Hotel with modern design, great attentive staff and a location to explore any part of Manhattan. The good things first: Rooms very clean, service perfect, beds VERY comfy, noise not much of an issue, great views of the city, especially at night from the higher floors (up to 23rd). Great quality Wifi throughout, ipod radio and charger on bedside was also much appreciated. TV quality perfect. Nice touch to get tea/coffee in the morning and wine in the evening; water all day long in lobby. The niggles: aircon quite noisy, shower is just a piddle of water, lighting is very pointy and patchy. Room could do with one bright lamp. Would recommend to all kinds of travellers and will stay there again at next visit. Price is ok for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “The Return of Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Styleye
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this new hotel and fell in love! They treat you like a star. The bathroom had a huge walk in shower with an overhead sunflower head...aaah a little slice of heaven in NYC. Has great cocktails in the bar too!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Chelsea area”
Reviews.Author: meklof
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious for New York, with nice large LCD TV, free wifi and very comfortable beds. The location is only a few blocks away from several subway stops or you can see most of Chelsea and Flat ireon district by fot. The hotel offrers complementary wine hour between 5pm and 6pm every evening. This was very popular both Friday and Saturday night while I was staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Love Eventi!”
Reviews.Author: Gwynne79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a Kimpton hotel and loved it, so I was thrilled to find a cheap deal ($188 plus tax, with breakfast for two included) for a Saturday night. We arrived at around noon and just expected to drop off our bags while we shopped, and were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready,and we had a $15 minibar credit! A nice treat after a long morning getting to the city! The staff seems very nice--the only thing we noticed is that the front desk is very small with no obvious concierge area where we could have gotten a map, shopping recommendations etc. No one offered to bring our bags up to our room, which I thought was a little strange. However, everyone was VERY nice. Our room was amazing, all brand new and clean and modern, with floor-to-ceiling windows and a huge (by new york standards) bathroom with a glassed in shower and nice etro bath products. The big king bed was right by the window, making you feel like you were floating above the city. Very nice. We couldn't stop exclaiming about how nice the room was--everything well thought out and well-designed. The window opens a little bit, and you can tell how nice it is to have sound proofed glass! The hotel is in a strange area, not the kind of place you would stay if you wanted to step outside your door and walk to all of NYC's attractions, but we took cabs everywhere and loved coming back to the clean, modern, and luxurious Eventi. They offer a complimentary wine reception in the evenings, and have a brand new restaurant where we had a delicious breakfast, an incredible terrace where we took tons of photos, and a nice but small gym with a view of an outdoor television. We will certainly return, and I hope it will be soon! Especially with a great deal like the one we were able to find!!

Reviews.Title: “Great in NYC doesn't have to mean pretentious”
Reviews.Author: Primoclass
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently celebrated our 22nd anniversary with a weekend stay at this hotel and it was fantastic. The property opened about 6 months ago, so everything is brand new and clean. The staff were extremely helpul- from getting us early check-in, to the pleasant surprise of Proseco and choclates in the room "wishing us a happy anniversary," to the concierge printing out maps of Soho with descriptions of all the shopping boutiques to late check-out on Sunday. The entire staff was friendly and efficient without an ounce of the pretention common at so many of NYCs boutique type hotels. We had a corner-king, and the room was nicely sized for a NYC hotel- there was planty of closet and drwer space for clothes, the bed was very comfortable, they provided us with a humidifier, the bathroom was immaculate (one small critique- the water pressure in the shower could be a little better). The location- while not in an ideal spot to walk out the door and shop, is nonetheless in an area with great subway access to take you to most anywhere you would like to go. This is the new gem hotel we have been looking for in NYC- I guess we've outgrown some of the trendy boutiques in which we can barely find our room becuase the halls are so dark! We've already recommended this hotel to a number of friends.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Kimpton hotel chain !”
Reviews.Author: JFR1Montreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Eventi hotel in Chelsea. The staff is fabulous, the rooms are perfect and the location is great. I asked the concierge for a limousine pick-up at Laguardia Airport and got a Nice black SUV waiting for us. If you want a trendy hotel in a nice district: go for it! Have a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cold shower”
Reviews.Author: trav08Boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1612 the weekend of November 5 and enjoyed our stay for the most part. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was clean, modern, and in excellent condition. It was also quiet, a rarity in hotels and in New York. The bed was comfortable, and our small suite very spacious for two of us. The closet, however, was extremely small, not even large enough for both of us to hang a weekend's worth of clothing. Add winter coats and most of our clothes had to be put in drawers. Hooks for coats near the entryway would help. While we both liked the large rainwater shower, each of us took a lukewarm shower at some point during the weekend. It seemed as if the hotel had simply run out of hot water. Also, two yogurts took half an hour and two phone calls to receive. Even on a Sunday morning, this shouldn't have taken more than ten minutes. I emailed the hotel about the cold shower issue but never received a reply or apology. I'm not sure they received it, though, as their website threw out a confusing message when I sent my feedback. Hopefully they've heard from other guests about the shower issue and will fix it asap.

Reviews.Title: “Lost my bag - no apology from management”
Reviews.Author: SFjason
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi in October. The room was lovely, and waiting in our room upon check-in were birthday cupcakes and a bottle of champagne. Very nice. The rest of the stay was fine until the day I left. At check out I gave my bags to the bell desk while I enjoyed my last day in the City. When I stopped back at the hotel to pick up my bags, they couldn't find one of them. I had a cab waiting, and spent 10 minutes waiting for them to find it. Finally, they took me into the baggage room to look for the bag myself, but it wasn't there. Clearly it had been stolen. When I got home I got a call from hotel security saying that my bag was not found and that it may take 3 weeks to get a check reimbursing me. I sent an e-mail to security and hotel management asking whether they could credit the amount to my credit card against what I had paid for the stay instead of waiting for a check. I also wrote that the time spent searching for the bag nearly caused me to miss my flight, and that although they agreed to reimburse me, the items in the bag could never be replaced and that I was disappointed. I never received a response. The only way I knew that they had reimbursed me was by checking my credit card statement. No response to my e-mail, no apology. To me, that is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikecurl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 great nights here - just what I wanted. The hotel is new so everything is very clean and sparkly. Room was very comfortable - good desk, free wifi with loyalty programme, ipod dock, flatscreen tx etc Gym was very good and has a great view of a very large outdoor tv screen - not sure if this is part of the hotel or not. Contintental breakfast at $20 was very good value. Couldn't have done better for the price. Booked directly with the hotel after seeing them showing availability on some of the usual sites.

Reviews.Title: “Chic modern hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cafinlayson
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York recently with my mum for a long weekend and did a lot of research prior to booking the Eventi. On arrival (late from the UK) the staff were fantastic - quick check in and a lovely quiet room on the top floor. The location was perfect for us with less than 5 minutes walk to Macy's and easy access to all the gorgeous parts of the lower west side (Chelsea, Greenwich etc) - we walked everywhere. The room itself was great, clean, modern and comfortable with two good doubles, a spacious bathroom and a stunning view. Coffee in the morning and wine in the evening were nice touches and as we were there over Halloween there was lots going on including a pumpkin carving competition between the staff. The only criticism was that we are both very allergic to feathers and despite asking the hotel to de-feather the room prior to our arrival it took 3 nights and several requests for it to actually happen. That said the staff were extremely apologetic and did offer some compensation which was a welcome gesture. Overall we were both very happy with the hotel and particularly appreciated the attentive staff and very comfy room. I would definitely go back but next time would ask for a room on the east side of the building in order to enjoy the incredible view of the Empire State building.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: jpratt72
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Kimpton hotels before. So I knew this would be good. I specifically chose this particular hotel because it was new. In fact I made my reservation long before it opened. The room was amazing...the view was amazing (could see the top of the EMpire State building). The wine reception every afternoon was awesome! The outdoor area where we could enjoy the wine with other guests was amazing. The service and employees were all very friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect. Just a short walk from an underground and not too far from Times Square. If you haven't experienced a Kimpton yet...you are missing out!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoyPlaysKeys
Reviews.Content: Being sick of large-chain hotels who ignore their customers, I'm thrilled to have found the Kimpton chain. This company appears to truly appreciate their customers. Eventi, in Chelsea, is no exception. My travel companions and I were warmly greeted and attended to throughout our three day stay. The rooms are luxurious and the beds exceptionally comfortable. Eventi's location in Chelsea is perfect to access just about any neighborhood in the city. I was impressed that the hotel staff poured the wine during wine hour, and happily engaged in conversation with their guests. Don't pass up Eventi; it's an excellent option in a city full of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: cynsati0n
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal through the eventi website, and stayed at this great hotel for a "holiday inn" price. We loved the beds the most. They were so comfortable, just lying down after a day of sightseeing was enough to put us asleep! The flat screen tv right in front of the bed was nice. Good channels to browse after a long day. We were treated to a complimentary bottle of champagne and truffles upon arrival, since we made it known that it was our anniversary trip. The new hotel has a few kinks to work out with service, but nothing that was too off putting. When we arrived (15 minutes after 3 pm), we were waiting for about 20 minutes for our room. A man at the front desk asked us to wait while he checked whether our room was ready. It apparently was ready, but he never came to get us though he said he would. A lady had to ask us what we were waiting for before we found out that the room was ready. We also requested to get some ice, but we had to call twice to remind them when it didn't come up. This one bothered me though, I forgot my camera in my room. So after breakfast, we went back to the hotel room, and the cleaning lady was making the bed with the room door propped open. I walked in and grabbed my camera, and left, and all we did was exchange hellos. It could have been anyone walking into our room, and grabbing our stuff. I think there should be more security about this, even just asking me to open the door with my key. I'm not sure if this is a common problem in many hotels. There wasn't a lot of space in the room, but I didn't expect there to be, it's NYC! It was big enough for us for sure, and the bathroom was nicely styled. The etro lotion is my favourite. Too bad they didn't replenish it over our 3 night stay, but I guess the stuff is expensive! The wifi worked perfectly, and it's free if you sign up with the intouch kimpton website. Great comfortable bed, clean rooms, clean bathroom. A little questionable service, but hopefully it's just a new hotel thing and they iron out the kinks.

Reviews.Title: “be careful if you have allergies . . . and expect crisp service”
Reviews.Author: BostonJake
Reviews.Content: As a frequent user of TripAdvisor, and occasional hotel reviewer, I am always leery of long reviews (aka rants). This is kinda long I wanted to explain my low rating. I travel frequently in the US and Europe - spent about 45 nights in hotels over the last 12 months. Eventi has a lot going for it but you should consider my experiences as you weigh your hotel options. I agree with many of the positive points mentioned in other reviews. However, if you have any allergy problems, want to eat in the hotel, or are fans of crisp service and follow through read on. For those of you who have a life and don’t want to read all this, the bottom line for those with allergies is: Eventi (as many Kimpton Hotels) are pet friendly. If you are allergic to pets ask to be on a pet free floor (they have three); and, if you are allergic to feathers (or more accurately the dust mites that live in feathered bedding) ask to have the bedding changed. Or stay in a more allergic person friendly hotel. I booked three rooms (my sister, my daughter, me) for three nights in October. When we checked in my sister mentioned she had seen that Eventi was pet friendly. My daughter, my sister and I are all allergic to cats and some dogs so we asked if we could have rooms that had not been occupied by pets. The front desk person checking us in was very helpful and said that was easy to do. After I had been in my room a couple of hours I noticed I was feeling a little itchy and congested. I checked with the front desk and they assured me I was on a pet free floor. We went out for the evening and came back late. Next morning I woke up very congested, had a blocked ear (which I’ve never had) and had to run to CVS for relief. Chatted with helpful front desk guy about what could be bothering me. Turns out the comforter and many of the pillows are feathered. Bingo - although I am not usually bothered by feathered pillows that seemed like the case here. This is apparently common enough that they quickly dispatched housekeeping to swap out the feather containing bedding with non allergenic material. Seemed to work for me as I didn't have any more significant allergy problems (though wasn’t completely back to normal). This room allergy problem is the first I've had in many years in a hotel though I do usually ask for foam pillows. I should also add that my sister and my daughter have allergy problems occasionally but didn’t have any problems at Eventi. Other than the allergy issues the rooms are nice. Two nits: the HVAC makes a loud rumble when it cycles on and off (may vary by room, didn't bother my sister) and the room lighting leaves dark areas (the obvious location for a suitcase on luggage rack is quite dark at night so I had to use my flashlight to find things.) So that’s the allergy thing, here’s the service thing(s): When we checked in the desk clerk told us about the dining options including that the Bar Basque restaurant had just opened a week earlier for breakfast and dinner and encouraged us to try it. On our last night we were going to the opera and decided to try Bar Basque - I love Spanish food and we thought eating in the hotel would minimize the risk of being late for the opera. (I had to talk my sister into it because she had a bad experience at breakfast there.) When we got off the elevator at the restaurant we were offered a glass of wine off a tray. Didn't take much to figure out the restaurant was hosting a private function and was closed to hotel quests. We had not been notified (how about a sign by the lobby elevators or in the elevators???) (and why do you close a restaurant you just opened??). So we had to scramble to find another option for diner. On our way out the door the friendly doorman asked how we were doing and we told him we were unhappy that the restaurant was closed and we weren't notified in advance. He apologized and offered us a bottle of wine. We said thanks but we needed dinner not wine. He asked us to wait while he went in back of the front desk. After a few minutes (we almost left as we were feeling pressure to eat) he introduced us to the front desk manager who asked how he could help us. Things went downhill from there. Didn't the doorman tell him our problem? We had already spent too much time on this and needed to find dinner. The manager basically indicated the whole thing was our fault as there had been a letter in our room informing us that the restaurant would be closed (I had not seen it, my sister didn’t get one). He was unhelpful so we just walked out the door. The door man apparently thought the manager was going to do something more than offer a bottle of wine as he asked us what happened. I told him: we got a weak apology and an explanation of how we had screwed up! We weren’t trolling for comps, we needed dinner and he wasn’t helpful. OK, so now I’m at the point where only insomniacs are reading this. Anyway, the next day the front desk manager approached me and acknowledged that things had not gone well the night before. He asked how he could make it up to us. I said a sincere apology would help and he did apologize. He said he wanted to do something for us and asked us what he could do. I didn’t have any ideas and he didn't offer up any. When I checked out I asked to speak the hotel manager. (This is putting me to sleep, is that insomniac still reading?) I told him that I had three rooms for three days, wasn’t leaving a happy customer and wanted him to know why. He (Bert?) was very professional, listened well, asked the right questions, and sincerely apologized. He said Eventi wanted us to give them another try. He would make an adjustment to our bill and send us a voucher for a two night stay. I thanked him and said we would consider giving them another try. OK we are near the end! Guess what? Over ten days have elapsed since I checked out. I have yet to receive an “adjustment” to my considerable bill and have not received a voucher. I won’t be giving them another try.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: mo4ever18
Reviews.Content: I forgot to write my review of my trip to NYC in May, but better late than never! I really enjoyed my stay at Kimpton. The hotel opened a couple weeks before my stay in May. Hotel is modern and very styling. Rooms were a decent size and beds were extremely comfy after a long day of activities in NYC. Love the bathroom showers! There were 2 different shower heads. Rooms at Kimpton are a decent size considering it's in NYC. I have stayed in other hotels in NYC and i felt like i was living in my closet. Loved the outdoor balcony, a tasteful area where u can relax on your own or with others. Lobby is a bit small, but it didnt concern me much b/c I wasn't sleeping in the lobby. Staffs were efficient and polite. Good location, you can walk to shops near by, such as Macy's or even take a short cab ride anywhere. Really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to anyone :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie099
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Eventi Hotel the second week of October and it was great. It was in a very good location in Manhattan. The room was a good size for NY, very stylish and the beds super comfortable. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. There was also a beautiful terrace on the 5th floor with great views of the city including the Empire State building. I highly recommend the Kimpton chain of hotels since they offer the complimentary wine hour every night!

Reviews.Title: “Blissful Stay at Eventi”
Reviews.Author: RFBoston
Reviews.Content: We just finished 3 nights at the Eventi and could not have been happier. I try to stay with Kimpton Hotels and am a InTouch member. As mentioned in previous reviews, this is a new property and we didn't experience any glitches. The staff were helpful and friendly. Although the parking in the building isn't cheap, I liked the fact that we could park underground and access the hotel via elevator. The new ultra modern food court is excellent with plenty of choices from four different places. Check out the theater seating dining room in the back! The same restaurant group (China Grill), runs the new Basque inspired restaurant on the second level. Check out the computerized, self serve wine dispensers! Breakfast was nice but not cheap. It overlooks a landscaped courtyard with a big jumbotron screen showing cartoons, sports games and short films. The room was again modern, good sized, and had a very nice marble bathroom. We were on the 6th Ave. side and didn't notice that much noise. The bed was super comfortable. The location is within walking distance to many nice Chelsea restaurants. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Eventi - outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: KatB317
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed Eventi Hotel, super comfortable and well appointed rooms. The entire staff was outstanding in every way offering incredible service, in particular concierge Caroline who assisted with show/tour/restaurant/nightlife recommendations as well as seeing that our experience at the Eventi was a perfect one. I would highly recommend the hotel with it's trendy decor, convenient location and superb staff. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: nosmando
Reviews.Content: Pros- Dark, quiet, relaxing. Wine hour, morning coffee a nice bonus. The doorman actually stood in the middle of the street for several minutes hailing us a cab! Great sheets, toiletries, furniture, AMAZING bathroom. Missed the wine hour once (we thought it was at 6), and they send a bottle of wine to our room. :) Cons- only 1 turndown service out of the 5 nights we stayed. Filled out the Kimpton In-Touch mentioning our pillow preference, my birthday and our 10th anniversary, but i don't think they even read it. We did get the free wireless and $15 minibar voucher. They did NOT have the sympathetic shoulder pillow. Don your good walking shoes, cause it is not very conveniently located. There is good shopping only a couple of blocks away, however. Clean over all, but housekeeping never disposed of dirty dishes, litter or towels/washcloths. I had to call to have them removed, since the living space is very small. NOTICE- The clothing storage is minuscule, so pack light! Didn't like the Food Parc. Food was not very good. Didn't eat at Bar Basque. The Eventi was a great place to retire in peace in the evening or for an afternoon nap. I recommend earplugs. The ac is noisy when it kicks on and off. *photos to come

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokgal
Reviews.Content: We got an awesome opening rate for their rooms with 2 queens - $200 per night. If I could get that rate again, or even up to $100 more for that room at peak time, I would definitely stay there. However, at the current exorbitant rates, I would not. First, the good. The room was fantastic. Spacious, amazingly comfortable beds, wonderful amenities, very quiet night's sleep. We also greatly enjoyed the free wine reception offered every evening on the beautiful terrace (though it would be nice if they offered some food - like cheese and crackers - to go with it). However, the service was appalling as was the knowledge of the staff. We booked two rooms - one of which was not ready until almost 2 hours after check in. Although the manager was nice when we finally got to speak to her, the desk staff was rude. They messed up on a spa booking, the restaurant is exorbitantly priced for lousy service, and a desk staff recommended a diner that was 6-8 blocks walk away that ended up being closed with nothing else around to go to. When we complained, we got an apology, but no comps - no bottle of wine sent up to the room, no offer to discount our room even though check in was so late, etc. Also, the location of this hotel is fine if you don't mind walking (which we don't), but it is definitely not very close to much other than Penn Station. If you do stay here, join the Kimpton hotels membership so you can get free stuff from the minibar (I think it's $15 worth of items). Loved the room, but overall was disappointed. It was a good thing we didn't pay that much or I would have been more miffed about the service.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in the garnment district”
Reviews.Author: dino076
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a great location. Very good room size for newyork since we were a family of 3. the afternoon wine presentation was wonderfull. We requested a car pick up from the airport and were pleasently suprised by a beautiful maserati provided by the hotel. we will definitly come back again..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Books77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great staff. They upgraded us for free for duration of stay. Wine Reception in evening , an excellent touch to cap it all. Overall would definitely return. Also, great location, close to Shopping areas and walking distance to Times square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a little bit out of the way if you're a tourist”
Reviews.Author: j9999
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC every month for business. My business is in the garment district so the event is in a perfect location. If you are a tourist, this might not be the perfect location for you, it is close to penn station and the empire state building but not really close to the theater district and tourist favorites. The nightlife and dining options in event's neighborhood are scarce so If it's your first trip to NYC , I'd opt for something more centrally located such as the kimptons other hotel The Muse. If location is not an issue for you, here's the lowdown on Eventi Check in was fast and efficient. Lobby very hip Room: I had a standard king room which was around $400 a night. It was small but most NYC rooms are tiny. Bed was comfortable. Room was very new and in perfect condition. Had floor to ceiling windows and I could see empire state building from my room. Nice bathroom with large shower and rain shower head. Nice toiletries from etro. It was quiet and nice There is no lobby bar but there is a restaurant somewhere on the property. There is a fitness center and a business center. Next to hotel is a place called foodparc. I think it is owned by the hotel but you can't charge to your room. It's like a gourmet food courtl I has Asian food from there for lunch and it was the most disgusting thing that Ive ever eaten in NYC ( I'm not picky). This city is full of the best food so you may want to keep walking around the corner to pert a manger..a yummy lunch choice. I'd definitely return to eventi if the price was right because of its location but as I said before,there are much more interesting neighborhoods to stay in l

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: EmmettGrace
Reviews.Content: This a a really nice hotel in a great location. The room was a good size for New York which was important because we were 4 women sharing one room! It helped that the bathroom was nice and big. Comfortable beds. Great view. Clean rooms. We also loved the wine service at 5 pm. Really friendly and helpful staff as well. It is a bit expensive but it was perfect for sharing a room with friends and splitting the cost.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel-- still getting the kinks out”
Reviews.Author: ordinarymind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eventi this past weekend and enjoyed our stay. This is a new hotel-- new construction, so unlike some Kimpton projects where they've taken over an older building and done rehab, this is all new. The rooms are very nicely arrayed-- we stayed in an executive king with an awesome view of the Empire State. The bed was great, the bathroom excellent, and all was right with the room itself. The service in the hotel was a little choppy--- our room was not made up, and when we called at 5pm to ask that it be made up, it still was not (and it never got done). The food facilities (restaurant, bar etc.) are still under construction, and the staff seems new and not quite used to running a hotel (or this hotel anyway) yet. Nevertheless, we'd happily return and we'd recommend the Eventi-- we expect this will get better over time. I prefer it to 70 Park (where I stayed) in terms of the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice!”
Reviews.Author: Morryboo
Reviews.Content: Spacious & modern room, big bed & a view of the Empire State Building! The reception staff were friendly & welcoming & the dog bowl & biscuits by the door were a nice touch, wish I had a dog with me to enjoy them! Good location, a few minutes from Times Square but far enough away to not be disturbed by all the "hustle & bustle"! Used the gym a few times, good selection of machines ..... & the veranda on the 5th floor was ace. The only niggle was the air conditioning - it came on with a bit of a thud but it was not loud enough to disturb my sleep. All in all.....very much improved upon my last stay in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Horrible Follow Up”
Reviews.Author: 2travel2shop
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at Eventi in mid-August. It was the business portion of my trip and I had my golden retriever with me as I traveled to the Hamptons afterward for pleasure. The hotel is located very centrally although the immediate area isn't very nice in the evening (especially for dog walking alone and NO grass nearby!). The bellhop and doormen were so kind, always greeting the dog, remembering his name, etc. As with any Kimpton, the happy hour is a nice touch and much appreciated. We had a one bedroom suite that was a pretty good size for NY and we were impressed with the oversized toiletries. (And we feel like we got a great deal on Jetsetter). Unfortunately, 4 weeks after our stay we were still having problems relating to the charges incurred during our stay. My colleague checked in early and used her personal card so that she could get into the room early. When I arrived, I gave them the business card and asked that all charges be put on this card, NOT the colleague's card. There seemed to be no issue. However, upon returning home, we realized that one night of parking had been charged to my colleague's card. No big deal, the company reimbursed her. But THREE WEEKS LATER, she was charged an additional $300 - for parking and other incidentals. She immediately called and the gentleman in accounting told her he needed her to put the problem in writing and he would correct it. She put it in writing that day, I authorized the charges to be charged to the business card, and we never heard back from him. At this point, as these were unforeseen charges and it was a debit/visa, she transferred funds between her accounts in order to cover it and not incur bank fees. We never heard back from the accountant she spoke to so we called the desk and asked to speak to a Manager. After several voicemails, we finally reached a front office manager that could assist us. I filled out the card authorization for the correct card, faxed it back immediately, and she sent an attachment with the new charges and said, since it was after business hours, the credit would go through by the next business day. It took over 5 days for the credit to come through after we reached someone that could process it immediately. Needless to say, this was a frustrating process. Also upon reviewing our bill(s) we found a $223 laundry charge that was not ours. That charge was credited back without question, but it made us realize that in our years of not having trouble we weren't being diligent enough. While the issues with billing were finally resolved, it left a poor impression of this hotel. To have charges show up three weeks after the stay, and incorrect, and to have the burden of them charged to the wrong card (a debit card), and requiring the cardholder to transfer funds, etc, is ridiculous and annoying. We are glad the issue is resolved, mainly due to our persistence, and hope it doesn't happen to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Happy days for all who stay here. Cheers!”
Reviews.Author: kglebelands
Reviews.Content: Very good standard 4 star hotel with all the comforts you'd expect - fluffy robes, daily newspaper, enormous beds,friendly service - and extras you wouldn't normally get - complimentary wine every evening on the terrace, lots of room and light, lifts in the house car. Liked being away from the madness of Time Square. Safe neighbourhood - as two women we had no problem walking back from the West Village at night. There's a great deli right across the road for breakfast on the go. Loved Mandoo restaurant round the corner on W32nd (between 5th & Broadway) for gorgeous Korean dumplings. Will definitely return to NYC and when I do Eventi will be my first choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for celebrations”
Reviews.Author: HanschenKlein
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent preview rate. The room was a bit tight for two adults and two children but fine for a few days. Bathroom was great. Our room didn't have the best view, but we enjoy NYC water towers so that was fine too. There was some construction going on but we didn't hear a thing (from floor 10).
