The veranda is a great venue for all sort of events. The hotel is all new and shiny. Too trendy for our taste, but super if you like that sort of hotel. Staff is very friendly, smiling and helpful. Location is not pretty but as long as you're close to a subway station, you can go anywhere. We even walked from the West Village after dinner. As said, location is not pretty but it is convenient and two blocks from Penn Station. We did not get the goodnight chocolate and the weather report as others did. Had to ask for the Kimpton gift for the kids since they were expecting it and nobody offered it. Maybe that was because of our great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Comforts”
Reviews.Author: fraire
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice brand new Kimpton hotel , on 6th Ave and 30th, away from the hustle and bustle of midtown NYC. We took advantage of their preview rates and booked a double queen room which was a very decent size for a family of 4. The room was on the 19th floor facing back( little to no noise from outside, just one occasion when other hotel guests in the corridor woke us up at 4 a.m) and was decorated in a contemporary elegant feel with subdued, relaxing browns. The beds were very comfortable and the view from the floor- to- ceiling windows pleasant for those who enjoy urban landscapes, as we do.The bathroom was a particular pleasure, and it was devine to step out of the marble walk-in shower into one of the robes provided. All of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly. We too were conspicuously tourists but did not experience any of the coldness that one reviewer has complained of. On the contrary, I found that despite the Eventi being an upmarket hotel, we never felt out of place. A special mention to Kirk,who helped us with our bags and to the ex-Yugoslavian waiter ( I'm sorry to say that I didn't note his name) who made our 'solitary' dining room experience feel very cosy and intimate .The hotel restaurant is not in its fully operational form as yet, but we had a very good meal there and were glad to have the place all to (f)ourselves. We only made the complimentary 5 p.m wine-tasting once in our 5 night stay, and unfortunately the weather was not good enough for us to sit out on the lovely 5th floor terrace that we'd checked out on arrival. It is obviously a very appreciable touch and seems to be popular with many hotel guests. Finally, as Kimpton in Touch members, we took advantage of the free in-room wi-fi to Skype home to France, which was most appreciated, instead of having to shout into a public payphone over the street noise. To sum up, this is an extremely comfortable, relatively well-placed hotel ( we used the 28th street station the most) for which we paid considerably lower prices than the rack rate. If you can get a decent price, then do not hesitate an instant, and if you are not/do not mind paying the full price, it's a great hotel too. I'm sure that it'll even be excellent once the food court and street-level huge screen terrace is up and running. I know we'd love to come back the next time we're in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Sensual hotel that gets all the little details right”
Reviews.Author: Catbody
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in NYC and try to take "staycations" a few times each year to try out new and intriguing hotels in the New York area. We absolutely loved this property! The hotel has a theme of nature and secrets with half wrapped pillars, sensual and varied textures throughout the hotel (velvet sofas, unexpectedly soft carpet, Frette sheets, cabinets whose interiors can be glimpsed through peepholes, etc.) The fitness center was fantastic with unexpected items like medicine balls and unusually good quality and variety of equipment. The fifth floor balconies are pleasant to hang out on, especially with a glass of the free sangria that the hotel provides between 5 and 6. We had a room on the 17th floor and the views of the Empire State Building and morning sunlight were gorgeous. We also easily walked to restaurants in both Grammercy and Chelsea and were near to loads of good shopping (the hotel is building it's own small park next door but the immediate block is a bit sad in appearance). Overall, this was a wonderful experience that we'd love to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: KieranUmanee
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at Hotel Eventi this August 2010. The hotel is situated about a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square, set slightly away from the hussle and large crowds. The area is pretty safe even at night time. The hotel is immaculate and the decor is contemporary and very elegant. The rooms are stunning with large comfortable beds and floor to ceiling windows which provide good views of the city (depending on which way your room faces). Rooms are equipped with hairdryer, bath robes, room socks (although the carpet is so soft you wont really want to use these), iron and ironing board, 32-37 inch HDTV, fully stocked minibar and many other ameniities. Since the hotel is less than a year old, all the furnishings and fittings are very clean and brand new. Rooms are air conditioned and cleaned daily. The rooms have a "do not disturb" button which when pressed, will turn the room number lighted plaque outside of your door from orange to red, and you will not be able to hear the buzzer. We particularly liked the extra added touches and little things which made all the difference. After your room is cleaned, you will find a note on your bed detailing the weather conditions for the day along with a chocolate or two ! Free WiFi is also available throughout the property with excellent signal strength. Staff are very knowledgeable and helpful and very friendly. Each day between 5-6pm, a selection of wine is available to try on the 5th floor Veranda (this may not be a year round routine but was available during our stay). If you would like a guaranteed stay at a wonderfully managed and well kept hotel, then this is the place to go. Prices are expensive but well worth the cost. We would definitely visit this property again in future. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at! Kieran & Sandi

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Modern Clean and Great Position”
Reviews.Author: vic3b
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a 6 night stay with my 20 year old son. We found this hotel to be in a great position and close to the subway. The room was large enough for the two of us to share and never be in each other way. The bathroom is fantastic with a great rain head shower. The staff are very kowledgeable and very helpful. Could not find any faults Love it will stay again

Reviews.Title: “A+ Kimpton Boutique Quality and Service!”
Reviews.Author: mssking
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 5 night stay last week at this new, friendly, clean Kimpton property. I never thought I would take the time to write in this venue, but I wanted to give kudos and thanks to the staff at this hotel. The concierges wear many hats there, and one in particular, Joycelynn, exemplified the service I've come to expect from Kimpton. She gave us friendly, attentive, spot-on advice, directions, and reservations. Everyone at the front desk/concierge area was good, but this women stood out! The hotel property is located near Penn Station as advertised, but access to anywhere was very easy, and the 34th St. B or D trains were a block-and-a-half away. Taxis were abundantly available. The rooms were comfortable, albeit on the small size you would expect for NYC. We did not have a problem with noise (9th Floor). We were on the "back side", but still satisfied. The rain shower and Etro toiletries were nice. The 5th Floor features a modest workout room with excellent, new equipment. The outdoor lounge is located on this floor, too. The gratis wine tasting happened there, except when a private party took precedence (2 out of 5 nights). No worries; the wine just moved downstairs to the lobby. Bottom line: If you are looking for Kimpton boutique quality at a great value in the heart of NYC (a few blocks away from the Empire State Bldg.), than this is your place. Speaking of value, another concierge et al named Brittanni took care of an issue for us. I was very impressed with the way she helped us out. Pros: See above + the friendly, clean vibe of this new Kimpton property. Cons: A suana/spa/hot tub/swimming pool would have been a bonus, but again, no worries since there is plenty else to occupy your time. It's a good sign when our 13 year old says that he definitely wants to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Eventi Delivers..2nd Visit in Two Months”
Reviews.Author: oojybooj
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this brand new hotel was June 7-11, 2010. Eventi delivers excellent service, has a hospitable staff, and exudes all the warmth and generosity of a Kimpton hotel. Upgrades? No problem. Special requests? No problem. During the June stay it was evident that many of the rooms had never been occupied. I'm pleased to say everything functioned well, room service was quick (and delicious). The rooms are well appointed and how can you complain when everything is brand new. Fast forward to today, August 20, 2010. I'm back. Nothing has changed. Service is still impeccable, the hotel amenities and room appointments are modern enough to last for years. Yes the hotel is a tad trendy but Eventi bears the true essence of a huge hotel that maintains it's "boutiquiness" (I made that word up ya know ;-) ) that Kimptons are known for. That said, I believe Eventi will stand the test of time because it belongs to a family of hotels that has the recipe whose indgridients include upscale, warmth, service delivery, security, professionalism, and gratuitous. The hotel is two blocks from subway stations in every direction, 3 blocks from Penn Station, 2 blocks from Herold Square below 30th street. I've finally found a hotel to call home base when I come to NYC. My only wish was that the lobby and living room were bigger or the living room had a loft design.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & we were treated well!”
Reviews.Author: stltraveler01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights this past July. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly and had a very friendly and competent person check us in. He was very professional and we instantly felt comfortable here. Upon enterring our room on the 19th floor, we were instantly impressed. Loved the view of the Empire State building and loved the comfy king size bed. Bathroom products were top quality! The room was very clean. Sleeping here was a real treat as it was super quiet, cool and comfortable. We really appreciated the daily free wine service they have from 5pm to 6pm. What a fun and cool way to relax in your hotel! The wine was very good and no questions asked when you go back for more! The employees here are very friendly and go out of their way to help you with any questions or needs you might have. We will stay at this hotel for our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: output555
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I spent four days in NYC staying at t Eventi and were very pleased. Like all Kimptons, Eventi exudes class, quality and attention to detail. The lobby, while a bit narrow (it's New York, everything is tight) is impressive and very clean. The staff greets you with a friendly smile and has none of the pretentious arrogance of an Ian Schrager place. We stayed in a suite and loved it. A gorgeous view of the Empire State Building, with a lovely sitting room to relax and watch TV. The bathroom was ample and had a fantastic shower. Again, first-class and super clean, like you expect from a Kimpton. The hotel is quite large but never felt that way. It's designed like a boutique with an air of easy, stylish comfort. There's a lovely outside lounge on the 5th floor that we visited but never had the time to enjoy. The official hotel restaurant isn't opening until the fall so we didn't dine at the temporary one, although it looked fine. The hotel's location is very convenient, if not in the in the most attractive neighborhood (OK, truth is this block of 6th Ave. is butt ugly). You can easily catch the subway to anywhere in Manhattan and it's an easy walk to Chelsea, Broadway, 5th. Ave., 7th Ave, and Park Ave. Lots of restaurants within a few blocks and Penn Station is right around the corner. If we had any complaint,--and it's minor--room service could have been a bit quicker. The hotel was less than half full during our stay but it seemed to take at least 15 minutes for something like ice to be brought up. Nonetheless, staff was attentive and friendly. Rare in New York. Would I recommend Eventi? Absolutely. It's a great hotel, and although new, showed few, if any newbie hiccups. It's rooms are upscale, clean, ample, and extremely comfortable. And reasonably priced! About as close to perfect as you can get. Stay at Eventi and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: vienna_myCapital
Reviews.Content: The Eventi Hotel is quite new (I think they opened up in April 2010) and therefore when we booked in June we were able to take advantage of their special Grand Opening offer! The premises are just beautiful: the lobby is not big but features distinctive and stylish pieces of furniture; the front desk staff was friendly and professional (special thanks to Victoria); the bedroom was not very spacious either but nicely furnished, with the most confy and largest bed ever and a great view! We were offered complimentary tee & coffee in the morning, wine reception at 5pm (we just adored their veranda!), wi-fi connection at all time and a $15 voucher for the in-room minibar!! Everything was spotless clean and every single person of the staff was always nice and smiling! Last but not least, a subway station is only 5 minutes walking from there. During our vacation in the US we stayed at 6 different hotels and we realized that their standards are somehow lower than the European ones, but the Eventi was no disappointment! To be very very picky, although in the heart of Manhattan, its immediate surroundings are quite ugly and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Clean, but nothing extraordinary beyond that”
Reviews.Author: am5
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel, I really did. I was excited about staying there for months, and really excited after it opened and I saw the great reviews on Tripadvisor. But, this hotel disappointed me in nearly every way. I'll list my pros first - which are few. The rooms are clean and new. The carpet still feels very plushy beneath your tired feet and the bathroom is immaculate. The location of the hotel is also very good. Although it is not right next to all of the tourist attractions, it was a short walk to the garment district, Times Square, or the Empire State building. It also had numerous subway stops close by, with practically any subway train you'd ever need to take at one of those subway stops. I never felt like the location was dangerous or scary (as previous reviewers mentioned) and we were out on the streets at all hours. So A+ for location. Now onto the cons. The hotel felt too trendy to me. It was always so dark. The elevators were especially dark and it was hard to see the buttons. I'm all for new looks, but this place was so trendy I could see it needing a complete overhaul in 5 years because it will look so dated at that time. Check-in was smooth at the hotel, they got us into our room around 1pm (which is earlier than the normal check-in time). However, the room they put us in was on the south side of the building. I specifically asked for a quiet room. 10 minutes after being in that room I couldn't take it anymore because there was construction outside the window and the noise was a constant beep beep beep. Not something I want to listen to on my vacation or when I'm trying to sleep in the morning. I called and asked if we could be moved, they said that construction was on all sides of the hotel and they could move us up 2 floors to the 11th floor and maybe the noise wouldn't carry as much. So we took that room. It was smaller and didn't have a sofa chair in it like the other room did. But, this new room was on the East side of the hotel facing 6th Ave and the Empire State building. That side of the hotel didn't have any construction, so I don't know why the person on the phone told me construction was on all sides of the hotel. I was happy that the new room was much quieter - we only had to hear noise from the traffic below instead of construction noise. When we checked in we said Kimpton's secret word of the month that we saw on their facebook page and they said they would be sending a gift up to our room. It took hours for it (a bottle of white wine, and we don't even like white wine) to arrive. We called twice to ask about it. I think it got messed up because of the room switch, but nonetheless this was annoying and a shadow of what was to come in the next few days (slow service) Also when we checked in I made sure to tell them that we had two separate reservations for our stay. One for the first three nights and another for the last night. They said they would take care of everything and combine the reservations. Well, that didn't happen. The day that the first reservation ended they locked us out of our room and we had to walk all the way back downstairs and wait in a line to get it figured out. And when we checked out after our final reservation they only gave us our receipt for the last night there. Not the first three nights and the last night. They messed up the bill with the mini bar too. I still never got the receipt for the first reservation, so who knows if they charged us correctly. I didn't like how they put the receipt in an envelope and called up the next guest in line. I didn't even get a chance to review the bill at all before they were helping someone else. Everyone at the front desk was really snotty. I didn't meet a single person who was friendly. They all seemed very fake and I felt like they had to force their kindness. Cons about the room - the sink was clogged the whole time we were there. It wouldn't drain ever and would fill up with water quickly. The shower was confusing to use. They should put instructions in there. The water never got very hot either. The biggest con for me was the bed. I've known in the past that the Kimpton chain is very pet friendly. But I don't think that means I should have to deal with the remnants from the pets. And during this stay I did. Our bed smelled like wet dog the whole time. I noticed it right away the first night when I snuggled under the blankets. The comforter is what smelled like wet dog. Everyday I had them change the sheets hoping that would eradicate the smell, but some wet dog in a previous stay must have slept on the comforter and soaked through the sheets. Gross. I know some people are obsessed with their dogs, but not everyone is a dog lover and I don't think it's fair that I should have to sleep in that stench. Kimpton, you should clean your comforters too after dogs are in the rooms, not just the sheets on top of the comforters. Imagine if someone was severely allergic to a dog. They could have been taking a trip to the hospital if they were staying in the room we were in. The air conditioning or vent in our room was also extremely noisy. It sounded broken. It wasn't making this noise all the time, only every 5 minutes or so, but it would last a few minutes. Someone needs to check that out because I don't think that loud buzzing noise is normal. The mini bar service was crap. As a Kimpton in-touch member we got a $15 voucher for the mini bar. The sign in the room said it would be replenished daily. It was not replenished daily at all during our stay. We had to call multiple times to ask them to bring up single items. It sometimes took over 2 hours for them to bring the items up. One time it took a whole afternoon. They never ever brought the items up to us in less than an hour. Also, after the third day there they took the mini bar list from our room and so we didn't know how much anything cost after that. I think they overcharged us on our bill too. They charged us for food from one of the times when we called and asked them to bring up an item. During that time they never actually dropped the item off at our room because they took so long to stop by and by the time they did we had the do not disturb sign on and were getting ready for bed. I don't actually know how much we were charged though because like I said they never ever gave us the official bill for our whole stay, just our last night there which didn't have the mini bar charges or our first three nights on it at all. Lastly, I didn't think the concierge was particularly helpful. We called one night to ask for a few restaurant recommendations for a particular type of food. He told us the name of one restaurant. I didn't quite understand the name when he first said it so I asked him to repeat it and then he was all short with me. I felt that he could have been a little more friendly or suggested a few restaurants or told us what was good about that particular one he suggested. Also, one day when I called to ask if there was free internet and printing in the business center the concierge said yes. We left our room early to go down there and print off tickets for an event. However, the internet was not free at all. In fact, they wanted us to pay $6.95 for 15 minutes of internet! Insane! Plus 49 cents for one B&W page printed or even more for 1 color page. I felt like the concierge wasted my time that night and was very mad that we weren't able to print off our tickets. We just ended up not doing that event because of that. The hotel staff should learn more about their hotel before they tell their guests incorrect facts. It's funny because after all of this happened I recalled a previous stay I had at a Kimpton in Boston where they had also said internet was free and it ended up not being free at all. Overall, I was disappointed mostly with the service and the staff at this hotel. The rooms themselves were nice and new, despite the problems with the construction noise, AC noise, stinky blankets, and clogged sinks. I would stay here again if I could get the pre-opening rate again. That rate was worth it for this hotel in NYC (although I would still consider that pre-opening rate very expensive if it were any other city). However, I am hesitant to recommend this hotel if you have to pay the normal rates that they are now charging, which are over double what I paid. I don't think it is worth it at those rates. At those rates I would expect a very high level of service and that is not what we received at all. Maybe other guests who look like business travelers or who are older will receive better care. But as a younger guest who looked like a typical tourist, I found that I didn't receive any special treatment at this hotel. I rate this hotel average. Because that is what I think the hotel will become overtime and that is what my experience was. Right now the other reviews are bloated since it's a new hotel. But I think it will eventually fall into the average category for NYC hotels, especially if they keep up the level of service and unfriendliness that they currently have.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JBUDAI
Reviews.Content: Loved the wine reception on the roof. Nice staff, small but clean and lovely room. Good central location. Get your Kimpton rewards card before you stay! Umbrellas in the closet for rain, MP3 player in room. All and all I was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: sandandwater793
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this stylish & modern hotel that I had to write a review. The hotel was glorious to the eyes and had everything you could need (free etro toiletries, individually wrapped pouches of qtips, cotton balls, a menu of complimentary items, hair dryer, etc.) for our romantic getaway away from our young kids and everyday life. The service was great and they really treated us like VIP's. For the prices of the rooms, this hotel is a steal. We've been to many hotels around the world but this one knocked our socks off! It's brand new and the attention to design and detail is obvious and so welcome in the land of boring mega chain hotels. While we were there to relax and reconnect, the location is an ideal home base for nightlife and for shopping jaunts downtown and midtown. Good job Kimpton! We can't wait to try out the other sister hotels this fall.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary experience!”
Reviews.Author: Paula5524
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an amazing experience at this hotel! The ambience, warmth of the staff, and true beauty of this hotel are unsurpassed! One of the most spectacular hotels I have stayed in. I will never go anywhere else in NYC! (A special thanks to one of the staff, Doris, who made it all the more special!) HUGE thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel. Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: karalyn84
Reviews.Content: This Kimpton does not disappoint! First off, its brand new so everything is in tip top shape. The bedding was amazing. They offer more amenities than any hotel I've stayed at (I sleep with a fan at night and they delivered one to my room free of charge). Allows pets, they have food & water in the lobby waiting for them. I loved the location. In Korea Town essentially, close enough to walk to 5th ave, but not right in the hustle and bustle of Times square. Even walked to the West Village and Chinatown. I definitely WILL be back. In fact I am not sure I'd stay in a different hotel (and I've stayed in places like the Waldorf & Roosevelt).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KMichigan
Reviews.Content: Swanky modern decor. The beds were amazing. Very friendly staff. We brought our pet and they rolled out the red carpet for her! The free happy hour on the 5th floor outdoor veranda was a hit with us. We would just hang out and relax there before heading out for the evening. Only downside is the neighborhood, but not a far walk or subway ride to get you where you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel - Unique and Clean”
Reviews.Author: DiegoFlorida
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel so everything is clean and new. The room was unique in that it has a bathroom and closet door that closes by sliding sideways. There is a huge floor to ceiling window that lets in a lot of light. I liked the small grills on the tables that lift up to show the outlets underneath. I used this outlet to plug in the cord to charge my cell phone.The shower was great. It was partially closed by glass and open the rest of the way. No shower curtain needed. There are 2 shower heads and one was a hand held which was a nice feature. There was a desk in the room where we could set up our laptop. The gym was small but nice, although it took us forever to figure out how to open the door to get out. We needed our room card to get in but there were no signs to show us how to get out. We had a room package with a $25 in room dining discount. We used the credit for breakfast and the only complaint was that the oatmeal we ordered came with a ton of sugar on it and we had to send it back. We used up the credit pretty past because the food is pricey & not only do they tack on a 20% tip, they had a $4 service charge. There is a complementary wine hour on the 5th floor at 5pm and you can either sit inside in the screening room where they had a Wii set up or you can sit outside on the deck. Everyone that worked there was very friendly and although it is not our first preference of location, we would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Living in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: We live in the suburbs and from time to time stay in the city for the weekend. We chose this hotel because it is brand new, and also because we usually enjoy Kimpton hotels. What was surprising about this hotel was that it felt more like a condo building than a hotel, and not just because there are about thirty floors of apartments above the hotel floors. The apartment feel starts at the lobby which is very stylish but small. There is a cool looking sitting area in the corner, but it is not the type of lobby where guests will just hang out. There is nothing else on this level so you move on. A couple of levels up is the Café at Eventi. This was the only restaurant available at the hotel at the time of our stay. Also during the time of our stay there was work still being done on this floor, so we are not sure how the final look will turn out, but our impression was that the café was going to have a bland grey design. We had breakfast here each morning and it was pretty good. You can order off the menu or have the buffet. There will be more restaurants opening up in the fall. On the fifth floor is a “screening room” and outdoor terrace. This was where the cocktail hour was held each night. We especially enjoyed the outdoor terrace which has several nice and interesting seating areas and a great view of the city including the Empire State building. We stayed in an executive one bedroom suite which consisted of two medium sized rooms. The décor included dark hardwood floors, modern furniture and muted colors. Some might find the suite a little on the dark side. The bathroom was very nice and large. It featured white marble, two sinks, rain shower, Jacuzzi tub, and separate water closet. Our only complaint about the room was the lack of useful drawer space, and an automatic closet light that did not work very well and was not very effective. In general the hotel is located in a very convenient area. You can walk to some great areas of the city like the “Meatpacking District”, and the Flatiron District.” Midtown is close by, and Madison Square Garden and Herald Square are very close, in fact they may be too close for some guests. The immediate area around the hotel is not that interesting and an area that most guests may just walk through on their way to someplace else. We enjoyed our time at this hotel, especially because it is brand new and has a nice clean modern look. We also really enjoyed the cocktail hour on the terrace which of course will not be available during in inclement weather. There are so many hotels to choose from in Manhattan, and this is one worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Away2much
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi in mid-July while traveling on business. It was a great experience - the staff is cordial, the beds are comfy - no complaints. The rooms skew towards modern with dim lighting but everything worked fine. I ate breakfast in the restaurant and the buffet was reasonable with a good choice of breakfast items. The fitness center is okay not great like a Westin but there are enough cardio machines and a limited number of weight machines. They do have free weights which is a big plus. In the late afternoon - 5 pm they have a hospitality hour (I never made it but it is a nice plus). I would stay here again - very convenient to SOHO if you have business in that area.

Reviews.Title: “A great new hotel in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: Alison014
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Eventi the weekend after it opened, May 21st to 23rd 2010 with my mother for her 60th birthday. As it was a brand new resort and was doing a soft opening, we got an amazing deal, only $20 more a night than the Radisson Martinique down the street. The rooms are great, very new and clean. The rain shower is amazing. Location is very central to everything, two blocks to the subway station that will take you where you need to go. Staff was great, very helpful. Wine reception from 5-6 is a very nice touch! Would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can find a great deal like I did!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: simrankaur
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eventi just a couple of days ago and was very impressed with the hotel. The location, while it may not seem very upmarket, is near Madison Sq Garden and Herald Square. The hotel is clean and well organized. The only things I found incongruent with the overall elegance of the hotel was that the air conditioning system was rather loud and the temporary restaurant was not up to the mark in terms of atmosphere. However, their main restaurant will be opening very soon. The best part of this hotel was the service. Ali at guest services was incredibly helpful to us... and he is the reason we will be staying there again very very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay elsewhere?”
Reviews.Author: tymelyron
Reviews.Content: Stayed over at the Eventi last Saturday after a night out in the city. We loved the hotel, very new, modern, and sleek. Located on 6th Avenue and 30th Street, it is a bit removed from mid-town, but this is a benefit, not being in the crowd and traffic 20 blocks further up. A fairly quick trip up 6th, or cross-town in either direction, gets you where you need to be anyway, and parking Saturday night and all day Sunday on the adjacent streets is free. Our room was good-sized, HD flat panel tv, and the MOST comfortable bed. We were on the seventh floor, not a great view overlooking the back and other rooftops, however, very quiet, no traffic noise. Other great features: free wine tasting at 5 p.m. in the lobby, $15 free mini-bar credit and free wi-fi for Kimpton In Touch members (sign up for free in advance), sliding wood panel door to close off the bathroom, a quiet central a/c, mini lamps over the bed for reading, a do-not-disturb light on the outside of the door instead of a flimsy card, and a window that opened slightly to let in fresh air. There are currently very reasonable introductory rates into September. Our only complaint is that the well equipped fitness center needs an exit sign for the separate exit door, as the entrance door evidently can only be opened with a card from the outside and we needed help to figure out how to get out; also no apparent express check out, with the usual receipt left under the door; line on checkout at 11:00 a.m. was a bit long. Otherwise, the Eventi is definitely a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Odd location, funky modern place”
Reviews.Author: ChamoisNewYork
Reviews.Content: We had an executive suite, which was nice because we took our complimentary wine (from the wine hour) back to the suite and could visit with our friends in comfort. Comfortable bed, fully outfitted nice bathroom (why no tub? Just a shower, although a big one), and odd, confounding European-type light switches. The area is kind of nothing, but if you can get a good price (as we did), this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ddadoly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice (brand new) and the staff was wonderful - helpful and friendly. Wine reception at 5:00 and nice deck to sit outside. The hotel is located in the Flower District, you can walk to Times Square. Walk to Central Park was a bit of a hike. Easy access to train.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - location ok”
Reviews.Author: craigTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eventi for two nights and really enjoyed it. The hotel is new, clean and the staff is fantastic. The room was comfortable and nice, larger than the Courtyard Marriott /5th Ave I stayed at a few days before. It was easy to get to a subway line and Penn station, and a short walk to Times Square. The 5pm-6pm free happy hour each night is great. The only two drawbacks . . . 1. The area is a bit sketchy. Not bad, just not as nice as I had hoped. 2. Valet parking was $50/night. This may be a typical amount in NYC, but seemed high. I would highly recommend the hotel and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: TomC54321
Reviews.Content: Had a 16th floor 1 bedroom suite that was wonderful: large, nicely decorated, two flat panel TVs, comfortable bed, and a spa-like bathroom. Good view of the Empire State building to boot. I always enjoy the wine hour at Kimpton hotels, and this one was especially relaxing on the 5th floor outdoor terrace. I guess location in NYC is relative to where you want to spend your time, I wanted to be in the Village and Chelsea neighborhood so the Eventi was a bit of a walk, but a short cab ride. Typical Kimpton hotel and I love Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms; Great Sleep; Neighborhood is a dump”
Reviews.Author: JATB
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a bad neighborhood. The neighborhood is safe, it's just blah. Not much going on and kind of far from anything. The Eventi is new, hip, and happening. The Eventi is everything it is billed to be - hip, luxurious, comfortable. I'm a fan. I had a corner room on the 16th floor with a magnificent view down 6th Avenue. The Eventi has large bathrooms and rooms that are pretty good size (for New York). I loved the large open shower with two heads and the bathroom amenities are really nice. The desks are small, but I appreciated that - I often find the large oversized desks to be wasted space in a hotel. They had a wine reception in the lobby that was relaxing. More on my trip: http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/2010/07/new-yorks-eventi.html

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel in a Great Location...if only the rooms were a bit bigger”
Reviews.Author: CarolineD14
Reviews.Content: I have just checked out of the Eventi. Booked room for husband and children. As we had to use the sofa bed we had very little room left for our luggage. The bathroom is stunning and the hotel is so new. What's not to love. Very friendly and helpful staff. Loved the complimentry tea/coffee in the foyer (mornings). The nearby delis are a welcome relief for people on a budget. Great location means that you can find a fab restaurant or pop into a deli to eat there or take away. I did secure the rooms at a discounted rate so having said that, the value was great for the location. Walking distance to Madison Square and Times Square. I had a great time in NY with thanks to the Eventi experience.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars with a three star price”
Reviews.Author: HlmBarbato
Reviews.Content: We usually stay near Times Square when visiting New York City, but this times we did not. We booked our rooms at the Eventi a Kimpton Hotel on 30th and 6th in Chelsea. Yhe Eventi location was not as convenient to Times Square but it was worth the taxi fare to stay in such a wonder boutique hotel. We are picky about cleanliness, but with the Evenit being open only three weeks before our arrival we figured that would not be an issue. Gladly it was not. The rooms were very tastefully appointed and large, especially by New York standards. We needed two rooms, each with two queens, cannot handle doubles. The Eventi is one out of a handful of NYC hotels that have double queens, and they were extremely comfortable. Did not wake with a stiff back, just restful sleep. The bathrooms are large and wonderful. Marble walls, double shower heads, and plush towels made us feel like we were in a spa. Every employee we spoke with was friendly and courteous, they could not have been more welcoming. I would stay at the Eventi again in a New York Minute!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Kimpton success story!”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I love love love Kimpton hotels. The Eventi is my new favourite, after The Monaco in Chicago. Service excellent and effervescenly cheerful from the front desk to the maintenance guy in the elevator. Loved the 5th floor veranda and wine reception at 5. Rooms are very sleek and modern. Bed has pillow top mattress, which is lovely. Nice robes and bath products. Only one complaint: for some reason, they haven't installed black out curtains? So a little light will leak through in am. I got a $15 minibar voucher for being an in touch member so do join before you go. Also, I learned by following their Twitter account that if you say "fireworks" when you check in in July, you'll get a free gift! Gym nicely equipped. 3 treadmills, 2 bikes, 2 x-trainers. Bathrooms huge. Shower, no tub as others have noted. Location is a bit dismal but saving grace is that macys is only four blocks away. JC Penny mall is also quite nice. Free wifi and iHome alarm clock with iPhone dock make Eventi (or "the new hotel" as every taxi driver called it) a no brainer for me . Go!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Brand New Hotel and Pet-Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Petsetter
Reviews.Content: My husband, dog and I just got back from an overnight trip to the Eventi Hotel in Chelsea. We've stayed at other Kimpton hotels before and have never been disappointed. We decided to bring our 90 lb lab, Tyson, with us on this journey since the hotel is pet-friendly. My husband and I were celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary as well and when we walked into our room, we had a bottle of Prosecco and strawberries and blueberries waiting for us. There was also a dog bed and a nice Planet Dog dog toy for our pooch. Everyone from the valet, the front desk and the concierge was very accommodating. After we checked out of the hotel, we still weren't ready to go home and wanted to do a little shopping. The staff was willing to take our dog for a few hours while we went out. I thought this went above and beyond any other hotel we've ever stayed at. We're not talking about a small lap dog either, we have a big dog! We returned back to the hotel in the late afternoon to still-smiling staff and a happy dog. Special thanks to Jocelyn, Tori and Nathalie for being so helpful and kind to my little family. We love Kimpton hotels because they are modern, reasonably priced and pet-friendly. The Eventi Hotel lives up to this and then so. Thank you again for helping us make our quick trip to NYC a memorable one. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Great Hotel, Location, Service & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Businessman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this magnificent newly built hotel (June - July 2010). My original 5 day stay was extended to 20 days because of the wonderful treatment I received. I highly recommend it for the business and vacation travellers for several reasons. 1. The SERVICE was excellent. Laura K and the Bert (Hotel Manager) were very professional. Both bent over backwards to help me and to make my stay enjoyable and incident free. 2. The ROOM was stylish and spacious. I was fortunate to get a high floor (22nd floor out of 23 floors). The bathroom was also very spacious. 3. The STAFF were very helpful. Jocelyn, Adriana and Victoria (on reception) were cheerful and helpful. They helped me with queries on my account, places to eat away from the tourist spots and their smiling faces greeted me when I returned to the hotel. The doorman and concierge were also very helpful. 4. The LOCATION was good. I was in town combining business and pleasure. The location on 6th Ave was central and made it easy to reach the financial district and the shopping precincts of 5th Ave, SoHo and midtown. 5. VALUE was good. I travel frequently and was aware of the high costs of hotels in New York. The Eventi Hotel was a surprise. The costs were very good for the location and a newly built hotel. I also received a discounted rate because of the duration of my stay. Highly recommended hotel and I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Kimpton gem!”
Reviews.Author: gottakeepongoing
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great room. I'll be e-mailing the manager about these guys. Friendly, helpful, they bend over backward to assist. The hotel itself is lovely. Room foyer itself its too narrow but I don't think there's much that can be done about that. I hope they keep the veranda on 5th floor open to guests (other than booked events)- it should stay open later than 10 pm, too. I love the Kimpton chain to begin with - The Eventi is brand new and sparkling. I've stayed at the Ink but it's too far west. This one is more central. But Kimpton deserves praise for training its staff to be truly service-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at beautiful Eventi!”
Reviews.Author: 1KirstenV
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her three friends saved and planned for two years for their graduation trip to NYC. They stayed at Eventi and were treated like royalty! The staff gave them terrific tips and recommendations. A memorable trip was made more so by Eventi!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful wonderful wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BlueEyedNYC
Reviews.Content: While I now in live in NYC, I have stayed in innumerable hotels over the years and aside from the incredible secret value at is the garden apartment at Chelsea Lodge Suites (now that I live here, I can give away that secret), I can't recall a hotel room I've enjoyed more. Frilly people note -- this is not the place for you (and in frilly, I mean french provencial, and lace, and yellow, and all that). My room was one sleek machine, with one detail after another that made me want to steal the idea for home. The staff was incredibly nice. If you have a view of the East Side with floor to ceiling windows, you may not want to leave the room. The Veranda (large outdoor space looking east/south) will become a big draw for locals when the liquor gets up and running (likewise, hotel-food, etc). For God's Sake, don't use the mini-bar (for which, incorrectly, there is no price list). Walk south down Sixth to 27th, make a sharp right and there's a liquor store. (That advice goes for any hotel in terms of liquor, unless you're having the cocktail in a great space, then it's worth "renting" that spot for the price of the drink). Be prepared -- even on a high floor, you will still hear that NYC nighttime noise (I had the window open) -- the radios, the garbage trucks, music, all the sounds of the city -- it's just the way it is, don't complain. Now if you're hellbent on staying in Times Square and eating at TGIFridays and shopping at the Gap here, I wonder why you're even coming to New York City. The Eventi is in a real neighborhood -- one that can be a little rough around the edges as it's just coming into its prime, but it's New York City. If you're a woman by herself out on the street late at night, you'll want to keep your wits about you (that's not to scare you off of "Upper" Chelsea or the Flower District in any way), remember: don't be pulling a map out to see where you are, walk quickly with a purpose, don't wait for the "Walk" light, and keep moving no matter who calls out to you (there, now you're a New Yorker).In reality, you'll be safer at the Eventi than in Times Square (seriously, you don't want to be up there with all of those "tourists" with their maps do you? no, i didn't think so) and accosted much less frequently. It's very difficult to get beat up or mugged in NYC these days (which is kinda bad in a way, but that's a whole other story). If you're looking to be dazzled by right outside shopping at the Eventi, forget it. But at 29th and Sixth in NYC, you can walk wherever you want to go (whether it's the theater district, the Flatiron lower fifth shopping, to Madison Park and Union Square, Chelsea (wear sensible shoes and the west Chelsea art district (10th/11th between 24th and 27th, wear sensible shoes and walk there -- really, you can do it), Gramercy Park, really anywhere you may want to go is close by). And if it's a haul to Soho or to Central Park (which it would be walking), simply use the closest subway (the NRW at 28th and Broadway -- note there are often two sides for subway entrances, an uptown and a downtown, unless it's a very major stop) which will take you anywhere you want or need to go. (Non-NYers, be prepared but have to swipe repeatedly with your subway card -- it's annoying but still your best value. And don't forget you've got two hours to use the transfer (the card knows), but transfers can't be subway to subway, only subway to bus, bus to different bus, or bus to subway).

Reviews.Title: “Please keep it the way it is!”
Reviews.Author: call_me_a_cab
Reviews.Content: The locale of Hotel Eventi is a little too far uptown for us (6th Avenue between 29th & 30th Street), but we first tried it for its soft opening rates, and now we have re-booked for our next long weekend in NYC, because it’s that good. The first thing that caught my smile was they let us check in early. Thank you! Our room was on the 21st floor, with knockout views. Huge bathroom, with room to put all our stuff. Great modern shower, with no annoying tub or shower curtain. I think they have tubs in the hotel, so if that’s what you want, make sure to let them know. Personally, I hate tubs, and I’d rather use that space for an extra large shower, which is what we got. Loved the shower. Bed was extremely comfortable. No noise whatsoever, which, for me, is not the greatest, since I enjoy “street noise”. But most travelers do not, so there should be no fear of that. Hopefully, when they get the restaurant going, there will be no “thumpa-thumpa” of loud disco music to keep me awake. I’ll take street noise over thumpa-thumpa any day. The 5th floor veranda had knock-yer-socks-off views of the Empire State Building, and surrounding area. And it’s not a thumpa-thumpa pick-up joint. It’s a quiet, laid back, view-rich place to hang out, read, have a BYO coffee, and relax. Note to Hotel Eventi: please keep it that way. This is an adult hotel. Kids and wanna-be rock stars should find someplace else to wreck. Lots of staff people around, but we always had to open the door ourselves, even when we were dragging luggage. In-room safe did not work, and three requests to fix it were acknowledged by staff, but the safe was never fixed. Besides that, we thought it was a wonderful place, and it merits five stars. The rates will definitely increase and make it out of our price range, which is unfortunate, but understandable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirltraveler
Reviews.Content: Eventi is just another example of Kimpton's great hotels and service. This new hotel doesn't skimp on the service or the details. We used the hotel valet but couldn't get to the front door so someone came out and met us on a side street to park the car; he also very happily carried our bags all the way to the hotel saying, "It's my pleasure, you're my guests". Check-in was friendly & we were upgraded to a city view King which was a nice surprise. The room was on the small side (not for NY though) but the space was very well utilized. The bathroom was a very good size and extremely clean with great amenities. The location was good (a couple of blocks from Penn Station and the Garden) although you have to walk a little for a good restaurant. The bed was extremely comfortable-I wish I could have taken it home. The view was absolutely amazing-looked right to the Empire State building. The hotel isn't yet complete. The small restaurant currently there is a little disappointing (it's very small and menu is limited-however food is good). When the actual restaurant opens I'm sure it will be excellent. The evening wine reception was a nice indulgence. It was held on the 5th floor terrace which was expertly decorated - a nice haven in the middle of the city. There was even a Wii inside for the kids. While we didn't utilize them, the gym was complete with machines equipped with TVs and weight equipment. The business center was comprehensive with several large-scale computers, a seating area etc. It was on a secluded floor with little distractions. Even the elevators were well-planned with TVs and illuminated ceilings. PROS: Location, great service, amazing views, comfortable beds CONS: Expensive parking, a little noisy at night (street noise even from higher levels) While the hotel isn't

Reviews.Title: “Newly opened hotel was very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: jean1Chicago
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern and attractive. Convenient to many locations and only a couple of blocks walk from Penn Station. Very helpful, courteous staff. Coffee is offered in the lobby in the mornings and wine in the evenings. Wish they had soda vending machine in hotel. Few glitches included television that didn't work, door key cards that didn't work and a couple of staff who we would have liked to be more helpful or knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cowlin
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at the Ink48, a different Kimpton hotel, but after a booking snafu with Kimptons online agent I was inadvertantly moved to the Eventi. At first I was a bit annoyed as I was looking forward to ink48. But it was too late to change back and I decided to go with it - glad I did. The Eventi is VERY new, so new in fact it isn't really done. Do not choose this hotel if you're big on hotel bars and restaurants (at least not until they're completed) - DO stay here if you like beautiful rooms with amazing beds, large windows with glass so think that it drowns out the street below. I've seen what the hotel will be, once they complete it, on their website and it looks awesome. The rates right now are great by NYC standards, but I believe they will go up dramatically once all the hotel amenities are compete.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth considering”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: It seems to be getting harder and harder to find decent business-style hotels in New York at a reasonable price. When I am travelling alone on business I don't really want to spend many hundreds of dollars per night staying in uber-luxury places on my own - I'd rather save my cash for when I'm vacationing with my family. But I want a level of comfort that doesn't make me totally miserable to be on yet another long business trip. In this regard, Kimpton hotels seem to hit the mark pretty well. I've stayed at quite a few recently and the Eventi is definitely close to the top of their range in quality terms. The hotel is located at 30th & 6th which is not an area I've stayed in before, and isn't that convenient for me frankly as most of my meetings are generally in mid-town but what it lacked in convenience it definitely made up for in quality - plus as an added bonus it is right near Korea-town where I had one of the best Korean meals I've ever tasted (and that includes several trips to Seoul!). There is also a subway very close to the hotel which meant midtown was literally minutes away. Arrival was very straightforward, no waiting in line, no long forms to fill out plus they remembered to offer me the $15 complimentary credit for the mini-bar which I get as a frequent visitor to Kimpton hotels. As usual they were also offering complimentary wine 5pm-6pm in their verandah bar which I think is a nice friendly touch. The room was a very good size for New York which nice bathroom and very comfortable bed. Wardrobe was fine and as usual they offered free internet. The hotel seemed to be something of a hot-spot as there was some sort of fashion event going on one night which looked like fun. I didn't use the restaurant. Check-out was very easy. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “My family stayed at the Eventi for 3...”
Reviews.Author: Bestadvice10
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Eventi for 3 days. Nika Selsov was amazing!!! She is the assitant front office manager and quickly resolved a space issue for us. We reserved a suite, but realized that a family of four would be too uncomfortable in a one-bedroom suite. She understood our concerns and addresses our needs, without any haggling, pleading, or whining. Excellent customer service and a true service provider. The hotel is beautiful and the service was tremendous!!! Worth a try and a long stay!!! Dwayne was also very informative and patient. Loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic new hotel, a MUST when in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Jem87
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Eventi and what a wonderful stay it was! The staff at reception were extremely friendly and welcoming and happy to assist you whatever your needs and the doormen were always there to open the doors for you and assist you with your luggage/call a cab for you. The hotel is in a great location and close to many major attractions, restaurants and shopping. I had requested a room on a high floor and was given a room with a great view of the Empire State building on the 19th floor. I was extremely impressed with the size of the King room, especially by New York standards. The bed was just heavenly, by far one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! There was a large flat screen LG tv in the room and a chair with a small reading lamp attached which could be handy at night if you did not want to disturb others. There were outlets on both bedside tables, on the main desk and in the bathroom which was great as it can often be difficult to find just one free outlet in a room! The signature Kimpton animal print robes were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was of a good size; all marble with a large sink area, toilet and great sized shower with the option of using the hand-held shower or the main waterfall shower and there is also a stool in case you want to sit down in the shower. There is no bathtub in the King rooms but I believe other rooms do have these. There is a safe in the room large enough to accommodate a laptop. They also provide you with a good powerful hairdryer and an iron/ironing bored which is always good after your clothes have been folded in your suitcase! Kimpton In Touch members are given free wireless internet in rooms which I took advantage of and the speed of the internet was pretty quick too. KIT members are also given a $15 mini bar voucher to use. It's free to sign up to KIT so it's definitely worthwhile to become a member! Eventi also provides free tea and coffee in the mornings in the lobby and they have their free wine hour between 5-6pm. I can't comment on the food in the hotel as I did not eat in the hotel, however I have only read great reviews about their food. I did get a good opening rate for my stay at Eventi and if I could get something similar again then Eventi will definitely be top of my list next time I am in New York. Saying that, the friendly and welcoming atmosphere and the comfort of the rooms would no doubt persuade me anyway! Would highly recommend to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusMcK
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you want to explore Chelsea. There is a subway station 3 blocks away, so you can get anywhere quickly. Our suite was pretty, although not large. The hotel is brand new, and the restaurant and bar are not open yet. They have a free wine hour from 5-6pm everyday, which is really nice after you have been out on the town all day.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Hotel Does it Again :)”
Reviews.Author: christina1225
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the beginning of June and everything from start to finish was great. The staff was accomodating and the wine hour was delightful. I'm staying here again this weekend and couldn't be more excited. Hotel is 2 blocks frfom Penn Station and central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “shiny and new”
Reviews.Author: G1_H
Reviews.Content: Just like a new penny, everything was only a few weeks old in this hotel so you would expect it all to be clean and working, very nicely done. I could not fault any of the staff we met, the guys on the door always opened it for you, opened cab doors, looked after our luggage on our check out day and generally good manners. The lobby staff/ reception staff were most helpful and always polite "welcome back", "have a nice day" etc, gave a full welcome and walked around from the desk to give key cards. housekeeper was nice to, met her in the hallway, very pleasant. rooms were good, nice living area in the suites, LG HD tv in the bedrooms and the living room, big baths with separate walk in shower (not great power shower if you like that but its an eco one I think), separate WC room and twin sink area. Hotel had a good fitness area, the roof terrace was a nice touch, go to the free wine hour between 5-6 and then go sit up on the terrace. never tried the restaurant but I know its only a temp setup untill the full restaurant is ready. Beds were really comfortable with good quality linens, pillow etc. Rooms had a safe, plenty storange space, iron/board, dressing gowns mini bar and hardwood flooring with rugs. The mini bar was expensive, just like any other hotel. I got charged for the mini bar that I never used at check out, but this was quickly rectified. I just glad I asked for a receipt and this is much easier to sort at the time than after ive left the country. Location is fine, ive stayed on the hilton Garden Inn on west 35th a few blocks away and its handy for everything, macys, times square, penn station etc. train from EWR is only $15 and takes about half an hour. Andrews is a good value breakfast place, with quick service on 35th corner at back of Macys. The hotel had good introductory rates, so that was why I chose to stay here, nice view on the 19th floor and I was not dissapointed. Only thing I would say to the hotel is make the free wi-fi available to everyone please not just the members. it really something that I expected from a new build hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, delightful, and best hotel bed I've slept in!”
Reviews.Author: CharlestownWanderer
Reviews.Content: Kimpton hotels are the way to go but the Eventi was definitely exceptional. The king-size bed was heaven with fresh white down. The floor to ceiling windows were gorgeous with a beatiful cityscape view. The hospitality as usual was wonderful; the wine hour, coffee in the a.m., and generous service. We loved the room and the details like the rain shower head and a perfectly placed flat screen. I recommend! The room was very comfortable for two. (We did book with a generous new hotel discount, the price is no longer such a steal).

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton delivers a winner in New York City”
Reviews.Author: TomKNY
Reviews.Content: This place is sweet! You don't get to stay too often in a brand new shiny hotel. We took advantage of a Kimpton reduced rate offer to spend the weekend in New York City. We had a city view room on the 17th floor. We could look out at the Empire State Building. In fact, at night, you could see the flash from tourist's cameras as they took pictures from the observation deck. Wonderful special touches in the room. Very, very comfortable king size bed. Individual reading lamps on flexible stalks on each side of the bed and also over the arm chair. Sliding bathroom door. Bathroom was all marble -- floor, walls, vanity top, shower stall. Normal shower head plus a rain shower head. Teak bench in the shower. The usual Kimpton bath robes. LG flat panel TV with HD source. iHome clock radio with iPod dock. No less than three sets of outlets (one on each nightstand plus another on the desk). In most hotels, you can't find a single outlet! Outdoor veranda on the fifth floor. Very friendly front desk staff and doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel -- wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: jsh0323
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the newly opened Eventi hotel in Manhattan and was extremely happy with all aspects of my stay. All of the staff that I encountered greeted me with a smile and a hello -- they were extremely helpful and seemed to truly enjoy their work and also seemed very proud of the hotel (which they are justified in feeling that way!) The room was great, very sleek and the bed was so comfortable I could have stayed in it all day long. The Veranda on the 5th floor is a great place to relax and enjoy the view of the city. The location is great -- just a two block walk from Penn Station so no need for a taxi to get to the hotel from the train station. All in all I can't wait to return to NYC because it will be the Eventi again for me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: amr777
Reviews.Content: I have to note first that I rated the price as 5, but I did get a great deal. The hotel was offering a huge discount since it was still under construction. You would never have known it was still under construction though. The rooms were a nice size for a NY hotel. There were 4 of us in the room and never had a problem. The bathroom was spacious. The beds were amazingly comfortable. The hospitality was above and beyond amazing. As soon as we needed something, they were there with it. And to top it all off...they hosted a wine hour daily in the lobby between 5 and 6 in addition to very good coffee and tea in the morning. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies getaway-NYC 6/9-6/13”
Reviews.Author: GApeach68
Reviews.Content: This is a new property built from the ground up. It is still not fully complete, but the staff does a great job w/attentiveness to guests. We had a Q/Q room. Not too small/but not roomy either. Nice size marble bath w/shower only. There are suites avail with more space. Rooms are virtually sound proof. The beds are comfy and the towels are thick. The workout facility is nice as well. Location is among retail/wholesale accessories stores. Macy's is a 10 minutes walk, Times Sq is a 20 minute walk. Soho/Tribeca/Canal St is a 10 min cab ride. There is complimentary tea/coffee 6-9 & complimentary wine 5-6 (missed both during my stay) Overall, enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again in the future☺

Reviews.Title: “another fantastic hotel by Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: natlildog4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night to celebrate my husband's birthday. Everything was perfect, from being greeted at the car by valet, easy check-in and our room was ready, with the requested bottle of wine waiting. The hotel is brand new, so everything was spotless still. The ONLY drawback is the HVAC system in the room is soooo loud. But absolutly no street noise. If you can get used to the air conditioning going on/off then you'll have a great night's sleep in the super comfy bed. Oh yeah, views of the Empire State Building are pretty impresive too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel..Beware of noise”
Reviews.Author: kmjohnson
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. We stayed in a king room that was lovely. There was plenty of room, great lighting, great tv, and nice marble bathroom with cool shower. ( No separate dressing/shower area made me glad I was travelling with my husband.) The bath products were a nice touch as were the comfy robes. Friendly staff, nice atmosphere. One problem was the construction noise. Although I realize NYC often has construction, our room (10th floor, even side) was directly above the construction. On Friday and Monday at about 4 am something was going on, garbage pick-up? moving equipment in? not sure. (I was too tired to get up and look) The workers arrived before 7 and it was quite noisy. I asked whether there would be construction on Saturday and if so, could we be moved. I was told they would know by noon Friday and would let me know. No one ever called, I hope it was because there was not construction that particular Saturday. I would need to be assured I would have a quieter room to stay again even with all the other positives about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: xyzscori
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! The place is brand new. We stayed in a king suite which was spacious and woderfully decorated. Huge bath and bedroom, 2 HD TV's, great furniture...everything about the room was perfect. Staff is also top notch. Very friendly and attentive. I asked to speak with the manager to express how happy we were with the room. Had to wait less than a minute to meet him and he was very gracious and remembered our names for the remainder of the trip. They also have a nice wine tasting every evening in their beautiful lobby. Would highly recommend thios hotel

Reviews.Title: “Another good hotel by Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Jumped on an introductory rate for this hotel and couldn't wait to try it out. Kimpton Hotels offer so much more than traditional chains. Check in was a breeze. We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom premier suite which included a separate living room area and entryway. Loved the modern and sophisticated decor of the rooms. Hardwood floors with nice area rugs, flatscreen tvs, fluffy bed with down pillows, wooden hangers in the closet, an electronic safe, great bedside lamps, ipod docking station, free and strong wifi (if you are a kimpton Intouch member), great accent lighting, very high ceilings, marble bathroom with separate tub and rain head shower, double vanity sink and separate toilet. Don't forget to check out the 5 th floor outdoor terrace which is gorgeous and perfect for a meeting place or party. Plenty of comfortable sitting areas and tables. Every day from 5-6pm guests can enjoy complimentary wine in the lobby area (you can take your drink to your room if you wish). They are very generous with the wine so don't be afraid to ask for more. They do have room service, but the hotel restaurant is not open just yet. As for the location of the hotel, it's on 30th and 6th ave. 4 streets from Macy's and all the shopping along 34th st. We were happy to have had a chance to stay at this new property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlmmlm
Reviews.Content: Generally, I am an All-inclusive, beach resort type of guy. I have traveled to many different countries and stayed in a wide variety of different rated hotels. This was my first extended family of 4 visit to NYC and I have to say that overall The Eventi was a great hotel. Once I arrived, the staff was extremely helpful and very friendly. I never once had an issue with any outside traffic noises from my 8th floor room. The subway was an easy 2 block walk. We arrived at the hotel at around noon and the room was ready. Now the negative; Prior to booking any hotel, I will spend weeks if not months researching for the perfect hotel for what I need on the particular trip that I am taking. Prior to booking this hotel, I spent many weeks researching hotels in NYC to seek out rooms with 2 QUEEN BEDS. I hate pull out sofas and 2 days before my arrival, guess what happens, I received a call stating that they over booked the 2 queen bedrooms and that they were going to up-grade us to a 1 bedroom with a pull out sofa for free, which was something that I did not care for. Free is good, pull out sofas, Bad. LOL Or they were going to let me have 2 rooms with King beds for an additional $75.00 a night. Other words, because THEY screwed up, the only way that I was going to get 2 real beds to sleep on, was for me to pay for it. In all my years of traveling, this was the first time that a company told me that I was going to have to pay for their mistake. I choose the 1 bedroom suite. I was not going to spend more money for their error. Am I an isolated case or is this something that Kimpton does on a regular basis? I don't know the answer to that. Do I recommend the Eventi? Yes I do. It was a beautiful hotel, at a great location with a friendly staff. Once I arrived and got settled, I did enjoy the room. Will I ever again stay at a Kimpton Hotel? NOPE!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Central, Clean and Courteous”
Reviews.Author: drharro
Reviews.Content: I'm a Kimpton hotel fan. My experiences have always been very positive and the Eventi in New York is no exception. The Eventi is a new, beautifully decorated and designed hotel with quality fittings and furnishings throughout. It is conveniently located. A short walk to Herald square or Penn St will put you on a train that can take you uptown or downtown with ease. There are plenty of places to grab a quick bite to eat, coffee or beer nearby. For more serious shoppers, Macy's and a range of other fashion stores are an easy 5 minute walk up 6th Ave. Kimpton hotels are always well maintained and the house staff do a great job of making your room feel fresh and new every day. As a new hotel, the Eventi makes an even bigger impression if you like a hotel that is clean and organised. The facilities are also very impressive. There is a well equipped gym, a day spa and large outdoor balcony area that guests can share on the 5th floor with a nice view down 6th Ave. Every evening, the 5-6pm complimentary wine event makes great use of the lobby, creating a pleasant social atmosphere where guests can mingle and chat with fellow travellers. Lastly, I must compliment the staff of the Eventi for being, without exception, friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. Thanks for a great experience team Eventi. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeachPaul
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Eventi for 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. With this being a brand new hotel, the rates being offered were extremely reasonable. We decided to treat ourselves to a "Premier One Bedroom Suite". We got it for $399 a night, but they had standard rooms available for $260 a night. I've stayed in many hotels in NY, and I have to say that this is the best value for your money. The suite was very large, beautifully furnished, 2 large plasma TV's, super comfortable bed, and a huge marble bathroom. Truly impressive. We ordered room service one evening and the food was very good and arrived quickly! We checked out the gym, and it was your typical hotel gym. Not great, but sufficient for most. The restaurant is a temporary setup, as the actual hotel restaurant is not due to open till later this year. The hotel has a really nice terrace on the 5 floor but as of now, there is no service out there. The hotel lacks a place to have a drink. No bar yet. I'm sure this is in the works. They do have a sort of happy hour each day in the lobby, from 5 till 6 they serve free wine to all guests. In the morning, it's coffee. This seemed very popular with guests. A nice touch with Kimpton hotels is that high speed internet is free for members of their loyalty program, and you get a $15 mini bar credit. Nice touches. The one thing that REALLY stood out for us was the service. Everyone was fantastic. In particular Caroline Grass from the concierge desk was extremely helpful with shipping something to me that I'd left in my room when I checked out. We will definitely be back to the Eventi, and look forward to experiencing the hotel when it's 100% finished.

Reviews.Title: “Worth another visit”
Reviews.Author: Matombo
Reviews.Content: We tried Eventi for one night based on a promotional rate. I had really liked the Kimpton in which I had stayed in Philadelphia, so I wanted to try Eventi. While not as polished as the Palomar in Philadelphia – Eventi had only been open a few weeks – it was still a decent choice and worth another visit. Located at Sixth and 30th, it was located between the bustle of Times Square and the neighborhoods of lower Manhattan, not far from the PATH station and the 33rd Street subway stop (although I continue to find the New York subway system to be unnecessarily confusing). Check in was a little ragged – we arrived early and were promised a call when the room was ready, but we never received one – but reasonably competent. The lobby was small, although nicely done, and their evening wine hour was pleasant, if not a little crowded. They have a delightful veranda on the fifth floor where you can relax outside and listen to the sounds of the city below you, but I was disappointed when they closed it at 11:00 p.m. – we had hoped to end the evening with a drink out there. The fitness room was also on the fifth floor and struck me as very small for a hotel of this size; it had only about 8 machines. The hotel’s sole ice machine was also on the fifth floor. Our room was on the sixteenth floor. It was small – this is New York, after all – and well appointed. The bathroom was nicely done with a lot of marble and a huge shower with a teak stool in case you wanted to sit your shower out (although there was no bathtub if you want to soak after a long day of walking around). It had lights on dimmers for late at night, but the dimmed lights just went out after about an hour, so they were not much help. Towels were thick and adequate. The room had floor-to-ceiling windows looking over the west side (it was a “City View” room). Lighting was good (dimmers again), but I especially liked the goose-necked reading lights on either side of the bed and on the chair. There was a small desk crammed in under the flat-panel high-definition television: it would not be an ideal work station, but we weren’t there on business. The mini bar was well stocked and typically expensive. The radio was a good one and had hookups for both iPods and MP3 players. The bed was firm and comfortable, and the pillows were a delight. There was a standard hotel safe in the closet, which I always appreciate, and one of the two telephones was wireless. The room had no “Do not disturb” sign, and it took me a minute to determine that there was a light switch by the door that changed the color of the room number sign as a signal to the housekeeping staff. The room had more issues than I would expect for a new hotel. The mini bar did not lock – the key was useless – and the bathroom sink was slow in draining. The room was also supposed to have two bathrobes and there was only one: I had to call the front desk to make sure we weren’t charged when they discovered that one was missing. The bathroom had a sliding door – a nice feature in a small room – but it was already off the track and I couldn’t figure out how to get it back. On the whole, though, we liked the hotel and we would try it again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NateKinFL
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just stayed at the Eventi over Memorial Weekend. This was the best hotel experience we have ever had, and cannot say enough positive about it. Here is my review from the beginning. I found the hotel a month or two ago before it opened and emailed a Kimpton representative for information several times. From that point I was provided outstanding service. I received a great preview rate, but realized what a great deal it was after our stay considering what an awesome experience it was. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we received exceptional service. Staff: The staff at this hotel is incredibly cognizant of their surroundings at all times. Not once did we have to get the door ourselves. We were greeted by every staff member each time we came and went, and they would not allow us to carry our own luggage or bags if we came back with them. Every single staff member at this hotel was friendly, attentive, courteous, and answered all questions. I was truly impressed by all of them. The hotel: The lobby is amazing and very comfortable to just lounge in. Coffee (very good) and tea is always complimentary in the mornings, and there is the typical Kimpton wine reception from 5-6pm daily, which was great. On the 5th floor there is a roof deck that wraps around most of the building. It was so beautiful and the views were great. There are also nice common areas on the 2nd and 3rd floors, which are very nice. The hotel is gorgeous. The room: Our room was amazing. When we arrived at the hotel our first day we were checking in at 9:30am. We did not expect to be able to check in that early. The front desk staff person advised us they had none of our King Rooms available, so she gave us a complimentary upgrade to a City view King Room. I was so grateful. That was incredible! The room had floor to ceiling windows with the most AMAZING view. The bed was incredibly comfortable. We actually slept in every day because we couldn’t get out of it. There are electrical outlets everywhere to charge all your gadgets. They are actually on nightstands and the desk, so you don’t have to plug them in a wall out of the way. Nice touch! We loved the all-marble bathroom. The shower is beautiful with two different nozzle options, a seat, and great bath products from Etro. They have a great use of space as the closets are in the wall, and the bathroom has a sliding door to close it off. We also loved the bathrobes. This was the best hotel experience we ever had. Outstanding service, incredibly beautiful hotel with amazing rooms, and the best Kimpton staff!

Reviews.Title: “WOW views from city view rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Seektravel
Reviews.Content: Eventi – Chelsea – Grand Opening I checked in the evening of the Grand Opening at the Eventi Hotel in Chelsea on May 14th. The staff could not be more inviting. They were very welcoming as we arrived. The Staff very excited that my doggie was the first to check into the hotel. The Lobby area has a nice small sitting area where they have the wine hour. Unfortunately the roof deck and restaurant was not open yet. I knew about this and figured it was ok, because NYC had so many dining options to offer. Check in was a zip and we were up to our “City View” room in NO time! And my jaw dropped when I saw the floor to ceiling windows with an awesome view of the city. The Empire state building was so close I almost felt like I could reach out and touch it. The room was an decent size maybe it felt larger because of the huge windows. You can see pictures I posted on my review. I have no complaints on this property. They really did a nice job with the building. The location central midtown so very easy to get everywhere in the city. When going to Kimpton Hotels remember to join Kimpton in Touch. We got a 15.00 raid the mini bar and get free wifi. The only reason I gave this review a 4 STAR - Very Good - is because the full services of the hotel are not all up and running....as soon as they are....I would give it a higher rating.
